title: Senior Fullstackutvecklare
description:
**Vill du bidra till att ge poliserna i fält ett informationsövertag och underlätta deras jobb i skarpa lägen?**

**Organisation**It-avdelningen


**Kommun**Stockholm


**Län**Stockholms län


**Utlyst**04 september 2025


**Ansök senast**10 oktober 2025


**Referensnummer**A541.182/2025


**Arbetsplatsbeskrivning**
--------------------------


Polisiära gemensamma system är en enhet inom IT-avdelningen som ansvarar för att tillhandahålla gemensamma IT-förmågor och IT-stöd som används inom flera polisiära områden såsom system för dataanalys, dataförädling och GIS (geografiska informationssystem). Polisiära gemensamma system ansvarar också för drift och livscykelhantering av polisens integrationsplattform samt för att utveckla och förvalta applikationer/bassystem och tjänster som stödjer operativa, utredande, underrättelse, forensiska- och kanslisystem med information eller funktionalitet.



Inom Polisiära gemensamma system ryms även sektionen för mobil systemutveckling som ansvarar för att utveckla mobila lösningar för den polisiära verksamheten. Till sektionen söker vi nu senior fullstackutvecklare, sektionen består idag av tre grupper som har helhetsansvar i att designa, bygga och förvalta mobilappar, samt anknytande backendtjänster och applikationer.



Du kommer att ha din placering i moderna lokaler centralt på Kungsholmen i Stockholm, och det finns möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån upp till två dagar i veckan. Som statligt anställd på Polismyndigheten erbjuds du särskilda förmåner kring pension, föräldralön, friskvård m.m. Läs mer om våra förmåner och villkor här.


**Arbetsbeskrivning**
---------------------


Du kommer att ingå i ett tvärfunktionellt team som består av bl.a. erfarna utvecklare, arkitekter med hög teknisk expertis inom app/systemutveckling.



En vanlig arbetsdag kan innehålla:


* Nyutveckling av både frontend- och backendlösningar samt mobilapplikationer
* Underhåll och vidareutveckling av komplexa system med höga krav på säkerhet och prestanda.
* Aktivt bidra till tekniska riktlinjer och arkitekturval för att utveckla hållbara och effektiva systemlösningar.
* Nära samarbete, exempelvis verksamhetspraktik hos slutanvändare inom den polisiära verksamheten för att förstå deras behov och omsätta dem till tekniska lösningar.


Vill du veta mer om hur det är att jobba med att utveckla mobilappar för polisens verksamhet kan du läsa mer här där Samuel berättar som sin arbetsvardag.


**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


**Detta är en möjlighet för dig som har:**


* Relevant akademisk utbildning (företrädesvis med examen) inom IT, eller examen från relevant YH-utbildning, exempelvis inom webb/systemutveckling eller liknande. Alternativt att du har motsvarande förvärvad kompetens som kan bedömas likvärdig
* Minst 3 års aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av att ha arbetat som fullstackutvecklare med god erfarenhet av agil systemutveckling för ett eller flera system för mobilappar så som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant
* Yrkeserfarenhet av design och planering av systemarkitektur
* Yrkeserfarenhet av databashantering
* Erfarenhet av autentiseringslösningar
* Yrkeserfarenhet av IT-infrastrukturkomponenter, exempelvis Kubernetes eller liknande som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant.
* Ett par års erfarenhet av att ha arbetat i en organisation med höga krav på säkerhet, med god förståelse för IT-säkerhetsprinciper
* Du behöver behärska svenska mycket väl i tal och skrift och engelska väl i tal och skrift


Anställningen kräver svenskt medborgarskap.


**Meriterande**  

Nedanstående kompetenser/teknikområden är i meriterande, du behöver inte ha kompetens kring allt, då du kommer att få möjlighet att lära dig/få påbyggnad hos oss på plats:


* Node.js
* TypeScript
* Certifikat och PKI
* Utveckling med hårda krav på kvalitet och av prestandakritiska IT-system
* Erfarenhet av mobil apputveckling, SwiftUI eller motsvarande för Android
* Erfarenhet av UIKit och anknytande hårdvarufunktioner
* Erfarenhet av webbutveckling
* Kompetens/intresse för UI och användargränssnitt
* Erfarenhet av testdriven utveckling
* Erfarenhet från arbete inom statlig myndighet eller större organisation är också meriterande.


**Personliga egenskaper**



Vi ser att du är skicklig på att analysera och lösa komplexa tekniska problem med en ambition att driva effektiv utveckling som löser användarnas problem och stärker deras förmåga. Du bidrar till att skapa en kultur av samarbete och kunskapsdelning, där vi strävar efter att ständigt förbättra våra processer och tekniska lösningar. Nyfikenhet och omvärldsbevakning ser vi som en viktig del för att trivas hos oss.



På samma gång vill vi erbjuda dig en plats att utvecklas, både i din tekniska kompetens och som en lagspelare. Vi tror starkt på kunskapsdelning och gemensam iteration för att ständigt ligga i teknisk framkant – samtidigt som vi har det roligt tillsammans.



Vi värdesätter dina personliga egenskaper högt och kommer lägga stor vikt vid dessa för att hitta rätt person för rollen.

* Har du yrkeserfarenhet kring databashantering? Om ja, berätta närmare om din erfarenhet/kompetens kring området.


* Har du erfarenhet av autentiseringslösningar? Om ja, berätta närmare om din erfarenhet/kompetens kring området.


* Har du yrkeserfarenhet kring IT-infrastrukturkomponenter? Om ja, berätta närmare om din erfarenhet/kompetens kring området. Nämna gärna även Ifall du har kompetens kring Kubernetes eller liknande


* Har du minst ett par års erfarenhet av att ha arbetat i en organisation med höga krav på säkerhet? Om ja, berätta närmare om din erfarenhet/kompetens kring området.


* Har du god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på engelska? (Bara ja eller nej)


* I annonsen/kravprofilen har vi därutöver listat ett meriterande kompetenser/teknikområden. Berätta närmare ifall du har erfarenhet/kompetens kring något eller några av dessa områden.

title: Senior Androidutvecklare
description:
**Vill du ta en ledande roll i att bygga upp mobil appinfrastruktur inom Android till nästa generations kommunikationssystem?**

**Organisation**It-avdelningen


**Kommun**Stockholm


**Län**Stockholms län


**Utlyst**04 september 2025


**Ansök senast**10 oktober 2025


**Referensnummer**A541.175/2025


**Arbetsplatsbeskrivning**
--------------------------


Polisen står nu inför ett generationsskifte när det gäller kommunikation där vi går från Rakel till Rakel generation 2, detta kommer att ge helt andra kommunikationsmöjligheter och dataflöden. Som en del av det här arbetet behöver verksamhetskritiska applikationer i den nya mobila miljön utvecklas, och vi söker nu senior Androidutvecklare som vill ta en ledande roll i att ta fram och utveckla mobil appinfrastruktur med fokus på Android.



Du kommer att arbeta inom sektionen Mobil systemutveckling på IT-avdelningen, sektionen består idag av tre grupper som har helhetsansvar i att designa, bygga och förvalta mobilappar, samt anknytande backendtjänster och applikationer. Du kommer att ha din placering i moderna lokaler centralt på Kungsholmen i Stockholm, och det finns möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån upp till två dagar i veckan. Som statligt anställd på Polismyndigheten erbjuds du särskilda förmåner kring pension, föräldralön, friskvård m.m. Läs mer om våra förmåner och villkor här.


**Arbetsbeskrivning**
---------------------


Du kommer att ingå i ett tvärfunktionellt team som består av bl.a. erfarna utvecklare, arkitekter med hög teknisk expertis inom app/systemutveckling. Vi står inför en tid där vi ska bygga upp ny teknisk infrastruktur kopplat till Android, vilket innebär att du kommer beredas en nyckelroll i att forma arbetssätt och vara drivande i arkitektur- och designbeslut. Utöver att du sporras av utmaningen ser vi att du är någon som har hög förståelse för användarupplevelse, robusthet och prestanda samt är trygg i att arbeta i en komplex teknisk miljö med höga krav på säkerhet, tillgänglighet och skalbarhet.



En vanlig arbetsdag kan innehålla:


* Att aktivt bidra till tekniska riktlinjer och arkitekturval för att utveckla hållbara och effektiva systemlösningar.
* Realtidsutveckling för att säkerställa effektivitet och prestanda.
* Bidra till utvecklingen av Android-eko-systemet.
* Skapa och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines för Android-appar.
* Nära samarbete, exempelvis genom verksamhetspraktik hos poliser i yttre tjänst eller andra slutanvändare inom den polisiära verksamheten för att förstå deras behov och omsätta detta till tekniska lösningar.


Rollen kommer även innebära


* Utveckling av ljudströmmar och programmering av knappar för hårdvaruenheter.
* Implementera autentisering för användarsäkerhet.


**Vill du veta mer om hur det är att jobba med att utveckla mobilappar för polisens verksamhet, läs mer** **här** **där Samuel berättar som sin arbetsvardag.**



Vi har idag systemlösningar som behöver fungera tillsammans för att ge varje polis rätt information vid rätt tillfälle för uppgiften. Nu vill vi ta steget längre – genom den nya teknik som Rakel generation 2 medför ser vi en unik möjlighet att sy ihop våra lösningar till en ny nivå. Vill du bli del av det här arbetet – sök jobbet redan idag!


**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


**Detta är en möjlighet för dig som har:**


* Relevant akademisk utbildning (företrädesvis med examen) inom IT, eller examen från relevant YH-utbildning, exempelvis inom webb/systemutveckling, inbyggda system eller liknande. Alternativt att du har motsvarande förvärvad kompetens som kan bedömas likvärdig
* Minst 5 års aktuell och relevant yrkeserfarenhet av native Android-utveckling, företrädesvis från en stor organisation (gärna att du medverkat i utveckling av app med +10.000 användare)
* Minst 1 års relevant yrkeserfarenhet av hårdvarunära utveckling knutet till Android-enheter
* Goda kunskaper om Android OS
* God yrkeserfarenhet av att ha arbetat enligt agila metoder i samband med app/systemutveckling
* Du behöver behärska svenska mycket väl i tal och skrift och engelska väl i tal och skrift


Anställningen kräver svenskt medborgarskap.


**Meriterande**



Följande är särskilt meriterande:


* Yrkeserfarenhet av att ha medverkat att införa Androidutveckling i en organisation och/eller verkat minst något år som lead developer / tech lead för ett Androidutvecklingsteam


Nedanstående kompetenser/teknikområden är i övrigt meriterande, du behöver inte ha kompetens kring allt, då du kommer att få möjlighet att lära dig/få påbyggnad hos oss på plats:


* God kompetens kring att ta fram lösningsarkitektur
* Erfarenhet kring utveckling med anknytande programmeringsspråk, exempelvis Kotlin, Node.js, C#/.NET
* Testautomation
* Byggautomation, och erfarenhet av att ha arbetat enligt ett CI/CD-flöde för Androidutveckling
* Certifikat och PKI
* Utveckling med hårda krav på kvalitet och av prestandakritiska IT-system
* Erfarenhet av radiokommunikation/protokoll
* Erfarenhet av hårdvarunära utveckling med fokus på streaming, tal, ljud eller video
* Erfarenhet av autentiseringslösningar


**Personliga egenskaper**



Vi ser att du är skicklig på att analysera och lösa komplexa tekniska problem med en ambition att driva effektiv utveckling som löser användarnas problem och stärker deras förmåga. title: Backend Developer
description:
Vill du vara med och bygga stabila, snabba och skalbara backend-tjänster som används av tusentals användare varje dag? Vi söker en backendutvecklare med 3–5 års erfarenhet som vill utvecklas vidare och bli en viktig del av vårt produktteam.


Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med moderna tekniker och bidra till ett system som hanterar stora mängder data, höga trafikvolymer och komplex logik kring rättigheter och medieflöden. Du kommer att arbeta tätt ihop med frontendutvecklare, designers och produktägare för att skapa en helhetslösning som verkligen gör skillnad för våra kunder.


Vi tror att du gillar att lösa problem i praktiken, ta ansvar för din kod och samtidigt vara öppen för att lära dig mer om arkitektur och systemdesign. Här får du stöd från erfarna kollegor men också utrymme att växa in i en större roll där du kan påverka både tekniska beslut och hur vi utvecklar våra arbetssätt.


**Om rollen**
-------------

* Bygg och underhåll mikrotjänster i Go som hanterar allt från filuppladdning och transkodning till rättighetshantering och sök.
* Samarbeta tätt med frontend och produkt i små, fokuserade pods för snabb leverans och tydligt ägarskap.
* Designa, optimera och felsöka databasfrågor och struktur i MySQL och Scylla.
* Bidra till sökinfrastruktur med Elasticsearch och caching med Redis.
* Arbeta med eventdrivna flöden via RabbitMQ.
* Höja prestanda, säkerhet och skalbarhet i våra system.
* Bidra till arkitektur, kodstandarder och interna best practices.

**Din profil**
--------------

* 3–5 års erfarenhet av backendutveckling.
* Stark i Go och trygg i SQL.
* Van vid att designa och konsumera RESTful API:er, gärna även webhook- eller eventdrivna flöden.
* Förstår hur man bygger robusta system för stora filer, många samtidiga användare och känslig åtkomst (rättigheter/roller).
* Självdrivande, pragmatisk och trivs med att dela kunskap i teamet.
* Nyfiken på och positiv till AI-stöd i utvecklingsarbetet.

**Meriterande**
---------------

* Docker och Kubernetes i produktion.
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar (t.ex. GCP, AWS) och CI/CD.
* Observability: metrics, tracing och strukturerad loggning.
* Kunskap om grafdatabaser (t.ex. JanusGraph).
* Erfarenhet av rättighetsmodeller, SSO/OIDC, audit logging och datasäkerhet.

**Vår techmiljö**
-----------------

* Go för backend, MySQL som primär databas.
* Kubernetes-baserad drift, CI/CD och kodgranskning i vardagen.
* Vi bygger DAM, site builders, live- och on-demand video streaming och mycket mer, med höga krav på tillgänglighet och prestanda.
* I frontend har vi ett eget designsystem och ramverk skrivna i Lit och TypeScript.

**Varför Mediaflow?**
---------------------

* Hos oss är People First inte bara ord det är grunden i hur vi bygger både produkter och kultur. Vi tror att när människor mår bra, presterar de på sitt bästa.
* Du får jobba med produkter som används av tusentals användare varje dag, verktyg som hjälper människor att samarbeta, skapa och kommunicera med klarhet.
* Du påverkar arkitektur, teknikval och arbetssätt i ett jordnära, prestigelöst team där kunskap delas och idéer välkomnas.
* Vi erbjuder hybridarbete från Göteborg eller Uppsala, eller delvis på distans med fokus på tillit och balans snarare än kontroll.
* Bra villkor, ja – men framför allt en kultur där välmående, utveckling och gemenskap står i centrum.

**Praktiskt**
-------------

* Omfattning: Heltid
* Plats: Göteborg eller Uppsala, hybrid
* Start: Enligt överenskommelse
* Språk: Svenska och engelska, vardagsspråk i teamet är engelska

**Ansökan**
-----------


Skicka CV eller länk till profil samt gärna kodexempel eller GitHub-repo. Berätta kort om ett system du hjälpt att skala eller optimera och vilka resultat ni nådde.

title: GoLang Developer
description:
**WE PUSH KNOWLEDGE FORWARD**  

Digiexam is a Swedish SaaS and EdTech innovator company, founded in 2011. We have a continuously growing exam platform that proudly helps and supports over +900 leading universities, schools, and institutions to do high-stakes testing and exams, on-campus and remote. Since start, over 20 million (!) exams have been handed in from more than 1,000 educational institutions worldwide
  

  

**ABOUT THE ROLE**  

As a GoLang Developer, you will have a key role when it comes to enhancing and developing our exam platform. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining high-quality software applications using GoLang. You will work closely with our development team of six colleagues, to implement new features and improve existing systems.  

  

Some of the things you’ll get to do:

  

* Work with technologies such as GoLang, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL & gRPC
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
* Ensure the performance, reliability, and scalability of applications
* From time to time work with front-end technologies such as Rust, Typescript and React
  

  

**WHAT WE OFFER**  

Our business are made up of our great people and therefore we really care about our Digiexamers. Some examples of what we can offer you are:

* Onsite/remote flexibility - work from home or together at our office
* A modern tech stack and possibility to influence our way of working
* An attractive fixed salary package
* 30 days of vacation and your choice of gadgets
* Professional and personal development with expanded areas of responsibility as we grow the business
* Work in an international team and ambitious SaaS environment
  

  

**WHO ARE YOU?**  

We see that you have a genuine interest for tech and problem solving and happily share your knowledge with your team members. We also think you have:

  

* Some years of experience as a backend developer
* Proficiency in GoLang
* Experience with Postgres databases and cloud platforms
* Knowledge of Kubernetes
* Proficiency in English

It's a big plus if you have...

* Experience in Rust
* Experience in developing for native platforms such as Windows, macOS
  

  

**READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?**  

Fantastic! Use your LinkedIn profile (works from the computer) or upload your resume and answer a few click-in questions. If you have any questions - don't hesitate to reach out.

title: Software Engineer - Stockholm
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are seeking a skilled and proactive Software Engineer with a strong focus on Quality Assurance and Test Automation to join a dynamic team based in Stockholm. This role is integral to ensuring the reliability and accuracy of tracking implementations across various digital touchpoints. The ideal candidate will bring both technical expertise and critical thinking to proactively test, monitor, and resolve tracking-related issues across platforms. You’ll be working closely with cross-functional teams to support high-quality digital analytics and a seamless user experience.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Conduct thorough, programmatic testing of critical events across all digital touchpoints and integrated systems
* Perform manual and automated testing for web and mobile applications (Android & iOS)
* Prepare and maintain test documentation, execute test cases, and manage defect reporting and tracking
* Develop and maintain automated testing scripts to monitor and alert on tracking anomalies
* Perform regression testing and support QA releases, ensuring seamless functionality on platforms such as Tealium, Fabulous, and proprietary web/app environments
* Lead investigations into tracking issues, ensuring timely identification and resolution in collaboration with internal teams and stakeholders


**Requirements:**
* Strong understanding of JavaScript
* Experience with web and app analytics (previous exposure to web analytics tools is a plus)
* Proficient in test management and creating detailed documentation
* Hands-on experience with automation tools such as Selenium or Robot Framework
* Familiarity with tools such as BrowserStack, JIRA, QMetry, and Confluence
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a detail-oriented mindset
* Ability to take ownership of QA processes and collaborate effectively within Agile/Scrum teams


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Junior C++ Developer
description:
**Company Description**
 Technology is our how. And people are our why. For over two decades, we have been harnessing technology to drive meaningful change.
   

  

 By combining world-class engineering, industry expertise and a people-centric mindset, we consult and partner with leading brands from various industries to create dynamic platforms and intelligent digital experiences that drive innovation and transform businesses.
   

  

 From prototype to real-world impact - be part of a global shift by doing work that matters.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a talented C++ DevOps Engineer to join our dynamic team in Stockholm, Sweden. In this role, you will bridge the gap between software development and operations, leveraging your expertise in C++ programming and DevOps practices to streamline our development processes and enhance our product delivery pipeline.
   

  

* Develop, maintain, and optimize C++ codebases for high-performance applications
* Design and implement robust CI/CD pipelines to automate build, test, and deployment processes
* Collaborate with development teams to improve code quality, system reliability, and scalability
* Manage and optimize containerized environments using Docker and Kubernetes
* Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues in production environments
* Develop and maintain documentation for DevOps processes and best practices
* Continuously evaluate and integrate new technologies to improve development and operations workflows
* Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members
* Contribute to the company's overall DevOps strategy and culture
* Work three days at the customer location or in the office


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field
* 1+ years of experience in C++ development, with a strong understanding of modern C++ standards
* 1+ years of hands-on experience with DevOps practices and tools
* Proficiency in version control systems, particularly Git
* Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, or CircleCI
* Strong knowledge of Linux/Unix systems and shell scripting
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and their DevOps-related services
* Experience with containerization technologies, especially Docker and Kubernetes
* Knowledge of infrastructure as code principles and tools (e.g., Terraform, Ansible)
* Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python or Bash
* Experience with monitoring and logging tools (e.g., Prometheus, ELK stack)
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities
* Understanding of agile methodologies and software development lifecycle
* Relevant DevOps certifications (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Docker Certified Associate) are a plus


 Additional Information
   

  

 Discover some of the global benefits that empower our people to become the best version of themselves:
   

  

  

* Finance:
   

 Competitive salary package, company performance bonuses, value-based recognition awards, referral bonus;
* Career Development:
   

 Career coaching, global career opportunities, non-linear career paths, internal development programmes for management and technical leadership;
* Learning Opportunities:
   

 Complex projects, rotations, internal tech communities, training, certifications, coaching, online learning platforms subscriptions, pass-it-on sessions, workshops, conferences;
* Work-Life Balance:
   

 Hybrid work and flexible working hours, employee assistance programme;
* Health:
   

 Global internal wellbeing programme, access to wellbeing apps;
* Community:
   

 Global internal tech communities, hobby clubs and interest groups, inclusion and diversity programmes, events and celebrations.


 At Endava, we’re committed to creating an open, inclusive, and respectful environment where everyone feels safe, valued, and empowered to be their best. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives—because we know that inclusive teams help us deliver smarter, more innovative solutions for our customers. Hiring decisions are based on merit, skills, qualifications, and potential. If you need adjustments or support during the recruitment process, please let us know.

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
At Intric, we're on a mission to let everyone benefit from generative AI by making the creation and deployment of AI-based tools easy, open, and secure. Our collaborative web application is already a trusted resource within the Swedish public sector and we’ll now be entering a pivotal growth phase. Join us now and be a core part of our ambitious journey.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Frontend Engineer, you’ll lead the development of a fast, accessible and scalable web experience. Your work will range from building new features to refining our architecture, always with the end-user in focus. You'll collaborate closely with developers, product designers and business teams to continuously improve the platform across both desktop and mobile.
   

  

 Our tech stack consists of Node, TypeScript, HTML/CSS, Svelte/SvelteKit, Tailwind CSS. Infrastructure: Docker, Git, Jira
   

  

**The** 
**Team**
 You’ll be joining a cross-functional, fast-moving product team with a collaborative mindset. We keep processes lightweight and adapt as we go. You’ll have significant freedom to influence both technology and direction — and we value sharing, learning and pragmatic decisions above hierarchy or rigid frameworks.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 You have 3–5+ years of frontend engineering experience with a solid understanding of core web technologies (HTML/DOM, HTTP, JavaScript/TypeScript). Your experienced in building and scaling modern web applications and proficient in state management and caching (preferably in Svelte or similar frameworks).
   

  

 You can write efficient, maintainable, and accessible code with a collaborative mindset and strong communication skills.
   

  

 You might have a degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
   

  

 While not a must, experience with Svelte/SvelteKit and Tailwind CSS and familiarity with developer tooling and internal workflows is a plus.
   

  

**Perks**
* Flexible, trust-based work environment
* High degree of ownership and influence
* Work on meaningful technology with real societal impact
* A collaborative and curious team that values continuous learning

title: Full Stack Developer – Intranet Development | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Are you a passionate Full Stack Developer looking to make an impact? Do you enjoy working with modern technologies to build and improve digital workplaces? We are looking for a skilled developer to join our team and take our intranet to the next level!
   

  

 SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Full Stack Developer, you will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and optimizing our intranet platform. You will work with a modern tech stack, focusing on both frontend and backend development, while collaborating closely with product owners, UX designers, and other agile teams. You’ll be part of a cross-functional team with highly skilled colleagues and play a key role in ensuring our services are secure, scalable, and high-performing.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Previous experience in .NET Core and creating Single-Page Applications for the web.
* Design and implement APIs and integrations
* Write and maintain high-quality code with a focus on performance, security, and scalability
* Knowledge of writing unit and end-to-end tests based on requirements
* Collaboration skills that allow you to work as a team to understand business needs and translate them into technical solutions
* An academic degree or an equivalent qualification


**Optional Qualifications**
* Skills in Optimizely CMS and Angular
* Good knowledge in Docker, Microsoft Azure DevOps and GitHub
* Used test frameworks like Playwright, MSTest, and Jest
* Worked with databases to store and manage content efficiently


**What We Offer**
* Agile and modern ways of working
* Work with modern technologies in a dynamic and collaborative team
* Influence the future of our intranet and digital workplace
* A great work-life balance with flexible working arrangements


**Ready to take the next step on your career journey?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to the team. The last application date is 2025-10-10. If you have questions about the position, please contact hiring manager Linda Aronsson Steneros, Team Manager Public Websites and Intranet, SEB.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons, while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**We are currently looking for a highly skilled Fullstack Developer to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain highly reliable and scalable web services and UIs that serve millions of users worldwide, for example our platforms UniFi OS, Design Center/InnerSpace, UniFi Network, Accounts or Community
* Collaborate with developers and designers in distributed teams in an agile and fast-paced, international work environment
* Actively participate in projects and voice your ideas and solutions
* Maintain industry-standard programming style and stay up-to-date with the latest technologies and trends


**Requirements**
* Extensive experience of coding in modern JavaScript, TypeScript, React and Node.js
* Experience of building scalable and high-availability GraphQL/REST APIs and working with SQL databases (Postgres) and key-value stores/message brokers such as Redis
* Solid knowledge about programming, design patterns and web protocols
* Experience of debugging, profiling and optimising web apps
* Strong sense of ownership of tasks and responsibilities
* Ability to lead yourself and your own work as well as collaborate extensively with others
* Familiar with Git and Jira
* Excellent communication skills and highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Skilled in Go and/or Java
* Experience developing AWS cloud services / DevOps
* Good understanding of networking protocols and architectures
* Familiarity with the agile software development processes


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests


***Please note that a background check will be conducted in the final stage of the recruitment process***

title: C++ Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Significant modern C++ experience.
* Experience with git, branching strategies, etc.


**Meritorious**
* Have experience with GUI application development (we use Qt).
* Have worked with a Jenkins CI environment.
* Have worked with product development.


**Application deadline:** 
 15-10-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.

title: Automotive Full stack .NET Developer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
Are you a
 **Fullstack .NET Developer** 
 passionate about cutting-edge automotive technology? Do you thrive in a dynamic, innovative environment where your skills can make a real impact? If so, the team in Stockholm is looking for you!
 



 The ALTEN Stockholm office is home to a dynamic, highly skilled team of engineers and developers from all over the world who specialize in delivering tailored solutions across sectors like automotive, telecommunications, life sciences, and IT. Known for their collaborative spirit, the team combines deep technical expertise with a proactive, problem-solving approach, fostering an environment where creativity and efficiency meet to drive impactful results for clients. With a strong focus on professional development and a supportive culture, the Stockholm team is dedicated to both individual growth and collective success, making it an exciting and empowering place to be a part of.
 



  





**WHAT YOU WILL DO** 



* Develop and implement fullstack solutions using .NET framework and modern front-end technologies
* You’ll work on exciting, high-impact projects
* Collaborate closely with automotive engineers and product teams to deliver solutions that meet the highest standards in performance, scalability, and safety.
* Innovate and optimize software systems for advanced automotive applications, such as infotainment systems, autonomous driving, connected vehicles, and more.
* Take part in the full development lifecycle, from concept and design through testing, deployment, and continuous improvement.
* Contribute to a culture of excellence by sharing your expertise and staying ahead of the latest industry trends.



  





**WHO YOU ARE** 




 We are looking for a mid-senior level developer. You’re a driven developer with a passion for automotive technology and hands-on experience in fullstack development.
 


* .NET framework (.NET/.NET Core) and C#.
* Front-end frameworks - React, Angular, Vue.js.
* Experience in the automotive sector.
* Strong knowledge of software architecture principles and best practices for high-quality code.
* AWS and CI/CD.
* A degree in Computer Science or a related field (or equivalent experience).



  





**WHAT WE OFFER YOU** 



* A supportive and inclusive workplace with a focus on personal and professional growth.
* Opportunities to expand your skill set with access to ALTEN’s global network of experts.
* Individual education budget.
* Work-life balance days: three extra days off per year.
* Collective agreement, Pension, insurances, and wellness grants.



  





**ABOUT ALTEN** 




 ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies with over 57,000 employees in nearly 30 countries. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of the most prestigious companies in all sectors, such as Automotive, Defense, Energy & Environment, Industry, Public services & Government and Life Sciences. In Sweden, we are about 1300 committed employees with 9 offices in 9 cities - from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north. For the fifth year in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden's most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Frontend Developer** 
 in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Frontend Developer in our Sports-and Ads Platforms team, you’ll work on improving and developing the frontends of our internal-and partner tools. Your contributions will directly influence the ease, efficiency and quality of the platforms we are building and maintaining. You’ll contribute to building and refining our frontends of the platforms, as well as supporting the users of our platforms having a seamless user experience.
   

  

 We’re modernizing our services in and around the platform, to enhance scalability and performance, and you’ll play a big part in contributing to this transformation. With a modern serverless architecture on AWS built using languages like Java as well as Golang on the backends, and React on the Frontends, you’ll thrive in an innovative and forward-thinking tech environment.
   

  

 You’ll join a newly formed platform team of 6 developers, one Ad tech Specialist, Product Manager and Engineering manager, all working in our Stockholm office.
   

  

**Here’s What Your Daily Challenges Might Look Like**
* Take ownership of technical design, complexity assessment, development, testing, and deployment
* Collaborate with your team members and-or other teams transforming our platform into modern solutions
* Participate in weekly guild meetings, contributing to best practices, long-term strategy, and maintaining technical excellence
* Continuously invest in your personal growth and skill development


**What We’re Looking For**
 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* Deep knowledge with 5+ years of experience in TypeScript
* Good understanding of React
* Team player with a dedication to testing, code review, and other quality-oriented practices
* Team player with a dedication to testing, code review, and other quality-oriented practices
* Curious and motivated by collaborating with and supporting other teams


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Familiarity with modern frameworks like Vite
* Familiarity with UI component libraries like MUI
* Knowledge in UX
* Experience developing and maintaining services in cloud environments, preferably AWS
* Experience in Next.js


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* Flexibility that works. We follow a hybrid model with at least three days a week in the office, giving you the best mix of collaboration and focus time.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Full Stack Web Developer
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**We’re looking for an accomplished developer with experience in all aspects of building web applications to help us create the best video commerce platform on the market.** 




  





  





 The Bambuser Research & Development department builds the world’s best video-based shopping solutions, using our pioneering in-house live video platform continuously developed over the last 17 years. We have a long legacy of quality engineering in this space.
 



 As a Bambuser team member, you will have the opportunity to contribute at the forefront of the emerging market that is video commerce. You will have a chance to work both individually and in close collaboration with others on projects in the challenging environment of real-time live video applications. You will join a group of highly skilled engineers including top open source contributors and world-class experts in their respective fields.
 



 Our philosophy is to build robustly, scalably, and securely for the future, emphasizing quality and practicality, without over-engineering. We ship early and often, and learn from our experiences
 **.** 




  





**What you will do** 




 In the role of Full Stack Web Developer, you will develop, deploy, and maintain the frontend and backend of one or more of our web applications in use by millions of people worldwide. Opportunities to show off your skills will vary across projects, and may include for example: designing the high-performance caching strategies for high-volume APIs, building React applications from scratch, or optimizing GitLab CI/CD deployment pipelines.
 



  





**Who you are** 



* You have at least 5 years working as a Full Stack Developer, Software Engineer, or similar role.
* You have at least 3 years experience building, deploying, and maintaining both the frontend and backend of modern web applications.
* You have at least 2 years experience working extensively in JavaScript/TypeScript code bases.
* You have strong problem-solving skills and the ability to debug complex issues effectively.
* You have a solid understanding of the uses and limitations of the standard building blocks of web services, e.g. REST, databases (relational and document), caches, message queues, serverless/server-based, transfer protocols, etc.
* You have a strongly rooted security mindset and the proclivity to build securely by default.
* You have experience collaborating with other developers in shared code bases, acting as a reviewer for others as well as having the ability to structure and explain your own code changes concisely.
* You have a proven ability to plan, execute, and complete development projects, both independently and in collaboration with others.
* You know when it's the right time to accept technical debt and when it's time to pay it off.



  





**Bonus if you have:** 



* Experience building B2B SaaS platforms
* Experience building enterprise services
* Experience working in start-up or scale-up businesses



  





**Toolkit** 



* Google Cloud Platform (Firebase, Firestore, AppEngine, Cloud Functions, PubSub, Memorystore, etc.)
* Amazon Web Services (EC2, CloudFront, S3, Lambda, RDS, Route53, Elastic Beanstalk, SQS, ElastiCache, etc.)
* MariaDB/MySQL, PostgreSQL, BigQuery
* JavaScript/TypeScript (Node.js, React, Webpack)
* HTTP Live Streaming (HLS), WebRTC, WebSocket
* Bash/Dash, Docker, Git, GitLab
* WooCommerce and Shopify for demosites
* Gemini CLI, OpenAI APIs, Lovable, Cursor



  





**Why Join Bambuser?** 




 We combine the impact and pace of a scale-up with the creativity of a startup. We’re not just another SaaS company. We’re building the future of video commerce. At Bambuser, you’ll have the freedom, trust, and firepower to move fast and build things that matter.
 



  





*This job ad was written by a human (alleged).*

title: Java Software Engineer
description:
**Role Overview:** 




 As a Developer within Swedbank Insurance, you will be part of a team responsible for transforming existing TDE services (legacy Java platform) to Andromeda (new Java platform). With the old platform scheduled for decommissioning in the coming years, this is a crucial strategic initiative to modernize and future-proof Swedbank’s service landscape.
 



  





 You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams across the bank to gather requirements, perform analysis, and initiate conversion or redevelopment of TDE services on the Andromeda platform. This is a long-term program where the initial team will establish the best practices and ways of working for the migration process.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Participate in the migration of TDE services to the Andromeda platform.
* Collaborate with other development and business teams to understand requirements and technical dependencies.
* Analyze existing TDE services and design appropriate solutions for conversion or redevelopment.
* Develop high-quality, maintainable, and scalable code in Java and Spring Boot.
* Deploy and manage services on OpenShift Kubernetes environments.
* Work with messaging and integration technologies (e.g., MQ, Sterling).
* Take initiative in defining best practices, improving development workflows, and sharing knowledge with team members.
* Contribute to establishing the foundation for a long-term migration strategy.



  





**Required Competencies:** 



* Advanced Java Concepts
* Spring Boot
* Kubernetes
* OpenShift Container Platform



  





**Essential Skills & Experience:** 



* 8–10 years of experience as a Java developer.
* Strong expertise in Spring Boot, Kubernetes, OpenShift.
* Experience with MQ and Sterling technologies.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Proactive, self-driven, and willing to share knowledge with others.
* Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
* Familiarity with the Andromeda platform (significant plus).
* Knowledge of the TDE platform (advantage).
* Experience in the banking or insurance domain (advantage).



  





**Desirable Skills:** 



* Familiarity with modern DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines.
* Knowledge of cloud-native application development and microservices architecture.

title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
**About Enity Bank Group** 




 Enity is a challenger in the Nordic mortgage market, choosing to see the potential in people. Through inclusive, yet sustainable and responsible mortgage lending, we play an important role in supporting those who are often excluded by traditional banks.
 



  





 Since 2005, we have enabled financial empowerment for our customers, providing them access to the housing market or opportunities to get back on track through remortgage as well as offering high-yield savings accounts.
 



  





 Our brand portfolio includes Bluestep Bank, Bank2, and 60plusbanken. Together they serve customers across Sweden, Norway, and Finland, joined in a dedication to make banking simple, forward-looking, and accessible for more people.
 



  





**About the role** 




 We’re looking for a senior developer with a strong backend profile to help us modernize banking technology and create seamless digital experiences for our customers. If you enjoy solving complex problems and working with modern tech stacks, this is the role for you!
 



  





**What you’ll be doing** 




 As part of our cross-functional team, you’ll design, develop, and maintain secure, scalable applications for core banking. A key part of the role is modernizing legacy systems and transitioning them into a cloud-based, microservice-oriented architecture. You’ll collaborate closely with product owners, designers, and fellow developers to continuously improve our platforms and deliver high-quality user experiences.
 



  





**Tech stack** 




 Our tech stack includes
 


* .NET Core and C# for backend development
* SQL and stored procedures for data management
* RabbitMQ, messaging patterns, and REST APIs for integration and communication
* Azure, Azure DevOps, Kubernetes, and Docker for cloud infrastructure and deployment
* Angular, TypeScript, and ASP.NET MVC/Razor for frontend and server-side rendering



  





 While the role is backend-focused, you’ll occasionally interact with the frontend and infrastructure layers.
 



  





**Who you are** 




 We’re looking for someone with extensive experience in backend development using .NET and cloud technologies, ideally 5+ years. You are passionate about clean code, scalable architecture, and robust solutions. You enjoy collaborating, sharing knowledge, and contributing to a learning culture. Staying curious and keeping up with modern development practices comes naturally to you.
 



  





**We offer** 




 We offer an inclusive and collaborative culture where innovation is truly encouraged. With a hybrid work model (three days in the office and two remote), you’ll have the flexibility to balance work and life. We also provide great opportunities for career growth, including access to training and professional development. Plus, you’ll get to work with a modern tech stack on exciting challenges in the banking industry.
 



  





**Sound interesting?** 




 We would be happy to see your application as soon as possible, as the selection is ongoing. Please note that a valid work permit for Sweden is required for this position.
 



  





**Please note that this recruitment is managed by our external partner Safemind.
 *All* 
 applications are therefore submitted via Safemind's application form.**

title: F# utvecklare till Svea Bank
description:
Vi söker nu efter en nyfiken och lösningsfokuserad F# utvecklare som vill vara del av vår unika resa där vi bygger den bästa möjliga företagsbanken. Gillar du att arbeta med lösningar i fokus, driva utveckling och trivs i en händelserik miljö? Då kan det här vara nästa möjlighet för dig!
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Vi letar efter en erfaren F# utvecklare, men om du är en senior C# utvecklare eller utvecklare inom funktionell programmering med bredd, så tror vi att du också kan vara en match. Hos oss kommer du tillhöra en engagerad grupp av utvecklare som brinner för funktionell programmering och vi letar efter någon med samma mindset. Du kommer tillhöra ett självorganiserat team med flera olika kompetenser såsom frontend, backend, test, design och produkt. Systemen vi bygger fokuserar mycket på att optimera automatiserade arbetsflöden. Våra användare är både interna och externa. Våra team ansvarar för att bygga och underhålla flera avancerade system inom Svea Bank vilka är byggda i F# och på Microsoft SQL server. Vi arbetar med eventdrivna system på ett domändrivet sätt. Teamet har en hög autonomitet och en stor frihet kring hur de väljer att lösa problem. Teamet har även en hög grad av involvering från designfasen hela vägen till produktionssättning. Vi har ett nära samarbete med affären för att försäkra oss om att vi löser våra utmaningar på bästa möjligt vis.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att passa i den här rollen tror vi att du är en genuin lagspelare. Du är en ”doer” som uppskattar att ta dig an nya utmaningar och som är van att väga in ett helhetsperspektiv i utvecklingen. Vi letar efter någon som bidrar med mer än att bara skriva kod. Vi tror att du är van att ta ansvar för att driva utveckling framåt och har en bra genomförandeförmåga. Utöver detta så tror vi att du är en skicklig kommunikatör med vana att kommunicera tekniska utmaningar med såväl icke-tekniker som tekniker.
   

  

**Erfarenheter och kvalifikationer**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling
* Stort intresse av att utvecklas inom F# tillsammans med en stabil grund inom programmering F# (eller annat funktionellt språk såsom Haskell, Scala, ML, Elm eller Erlang) e
* Mycket god kunskap inom .Net, alternativt grundläggande kunskap om du är en erfaren utvecklare med annan bredd
* Erfarenhet av eventdriven arkitektur
* Mycket god kunskap om SQL


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet från regulatorisk verksamhet, såsom bank eller försäkring och relevant utbildning inom datateknik, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande.
* Frontend – Fable/Elmish eller React
* Svenska flytande i tal och skrift


**Om Svea**
*Svea är en koncern med finansiell verksamhet med över 2000 anställda i ett flertal europeiska länder. Med fyrtio års erfarenhet skapar vi smarta administrativa och finansiella lösningar för både privatpersoner och företag. Sveas vision är att vara en ledande finansiell aktör i Europa. På Svea råder en entreprenörsanda och vi har en familjär företagskultur. Gemenskap är viktigt för oss och vi jobbar för mångfald och att alla ska känna delaktighet och ha möjlighet att kunna påverka. Vi sitter i nya fräscha lokaler i Arenastaden, Solna.*
**Ansökan**
 Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och vi önskar att tillsätta tjänsten så snart som möjligt så skicka in din ansökan redan idag. Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till rekryterare Johanna Rooth på johanna.rooth@svea.com
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior Software Engineer - Cloud | SEB, Solna
description:
SEB is a leading northern European financial services group and one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes an enormous impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you?
   

  

**Are you a seasoned backend engineer, interested in joining a strong engineering team at a leading bank?**
 We’re hiring a senior developer with experience building modern backend applications (preferably using .NET), strong cloud platform knowledge, and a passion for building production-grade solutions alongside a passionate, innovative team.
   

  

**Where will you work**
 The team is responsible for business-critical components, right in the middle of the flows between the front-end apps and back-end infrastructure. The delivery from the team is the centerpiece for delivering stellar customer experience when our customers are trading and investing in stock and fund markets. The platform is undergoing an exciting transformation, moving to modern technologies in cloud to unlock new possibilities. As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll work directly on developing core service layers and business-critical APIs that drive real-time, order-decision, and position-management workloads.
   

  

**Daily Work & Tech Stack**
 We have dedicated platform engineers, but you'll be expected to contribute to DevOps initiatives, security, observability, and maintainable workloads - balancing platform reliability with forward-leaning improvements. We’re looking for someone who builds with awareness of business context and systems.
   

  

 NET Core and C#, Google Cloud Platform, terraform, GraphQL, SQL / Entity Framework, Kubernetes (K8s) and pub/sub Bonus: gRPC, in-memory caching technologies, real-time architecture
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
* Experience in backend development, ideally in .NET/C# environments
* Experience with cloud-based application design, deployment, and scaling (GCP, Azure, AWS, etc.)
* Experience with DevOps
* A bias for business-critical, high-quality engineering—not just “building to spec”


**What We Offer**
* Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment
* Hybrid work model, meaning remote work is possible up to 2 days/week
* International opportunities and working environment
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 7th of November 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Hiring Manager Filip Normann at filip.normann@seb.se, but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts. https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Mobile Software Developer
description:
****More independence, freedom, and better pay****
 Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 It's not rocket science.
   

  

 Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.
   

  

 The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.
   

  

 Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

****Why Coody****
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?
   

  

**Maximized Compensation** 
 - Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security** 
 - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shaping the Future** 
 - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

****This is Coody****
 We’re a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.
   

  

 Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.
   

  

 Explore our
 **Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.
   

  

****What you’ll be doing****
 As a Mobile Developer Consultant at Coody, you’ll dive into technically challenging and engaging assignments that help companies level up their teams and projects. You’ll be crafting high-quality, efficient, and maintainable code using native or hybrid platforms (such as Android, iOS, React Native, Kotlin Multiplatform or Flutter). You will collaborate close with other engineers, designers, product people and other teams to build mobile experiences for some of the most exciting brands within tech.
   

  

 You’ll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. New challenges? Bring them on. We see them as opportunities for growth. Typically, you’ll take on 1-2 different assignments per year. Are you ready to make a difference?
   

  

****Who you are****
 We’re looking for a Mobile Developer with
 **5+ years of experience** 
 and a doer’s mindset. Here’s what we’re after:
   

  

* Strong expertise in either Swift, Kotlin, Flutter or React Native
* Unit testing experience and a solid understanding of the release cycle, and CI/CD
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics (or similar)
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


****How to apply****
 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criteria? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Backend Developer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Backend Developer** 
 in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Backend Developer in our Sports-and Ads Platforms team, you’ll work on improving and developing our sport scheduling platform. Your contributions will directly influence the ease, efficiency and quality of the planning of live sports event on Viaplay as well as outside our own product. You’ll contribute to building and refining our backend services in the sports-scheduling platform, as well as supporting the users of our platform having a seamless user experience.
   

  

 We’re modernizing our services in and around the platform, to enhance scalability and performance, and you’ll play a big part in contributing to this transformation. With a modern serverless architecture built on Java and AWS, you’ll thrive in an innovative and forward-thinking tech environment.
   

  

 You’ll join a newly formed platform team of 6 developers, one Ad tech Specialist, Product Manager and Engineering manager, all working in our Stockholm office.
   

  

**Here’s What Your Daily Challenges Might Look Like**
* Take ownership of technical design, complexity assessment, development, testing, and deployment
* Collaborate with your team members and-or other teams transforming our platform into modern solutions
* Participate in weekly guild meetings, contributing to best practices, long-term strategy, and maintaining technical excellence
* Continuously invest in your personal growth and skill development


**What We’re Looking For**
 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* Deep knowledge with 5+ years of experience in Java
* Solid understanding of Micro services and REST APIs
* Strong grasp of object-oriented programming principles
* Experience developing and maintaining services in cloud environments, preferably AWS
* Team player with a dedication to testing, code review, and other quality-oriented practices
* Curious and motivated by collaborating with and supporting other teams


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Familiarity with modern frameworks like Quarkus
* Knowledge in event-based architecture
* Knowledge or willingness to learn Go


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* Flexibility that works. We follow a hybrid model with at least three days a week in the office, giving you the best mix of collaboration and focus time.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: OneStream Developer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Business Consulting and Services, and Professional Services
description:
**Who is the company and context?** 




 Our client is an international CFO advisory firm looking to strengthen their EPM practise in Stockholm. They are seeking an
 **OneStream Developer** 
 to play a key role in bridging the gap between business and IT departments at large corporations across various industries. This is a permanent position within an established consultancy where you will work on complex financial systems and process change projects.
 



  





**What will I be doing?** 



* Design and implement OneStream solutions for FP&A and Group Consolidation projects, bridging business and IT functions at major corporations
* Build complete models in OneStream and develop reporting systems from conception to delivery
* Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand finance problems, identify improvement opportunities, and create effective technical solutions



  





**What kind of skills and background will I need to have?** 



* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, Business, Finance, Accounting, or related discipline
* Proficiently in C# and VB.net
* Knowledge of data integration and databases e.g. SQL and related database technologies
* Proficiency in leading EPM platforms such as OneStream, Oracle, SAP, Anaplan, Tagetik, Board, IBM Planning Analytics/TM1, Workiva, Workday Adaptive Planning, Lucanet, Prophix, or Pigment is essential
* Track record of delivering digital transformation projects
* Ability to engage with finance and business teams, translating requirements into technical solutions
* Understanding of finance processes (e.g., FP&A, accounting, consolidation)
* Fluent in English; Swedish language skills are a plus



  





**Why join this company?** 




 A great opportunity for someone who to join a company driving impactful digital finance transformations. You will have access to coaching, mentorship, and training opportunities in cutting edge technology solutions.
 



  





**How to apply?** 




 If this opportunity aligns with your experience and ambitions, or if you would like more information, please contact
 **Herman Hille-Dahl** 
 at
 **herman.hille-dahl@systemsaccountants.com** 




  





**Who are we?** 



* SystemsAccountants is a leading global financial systems, analytics, and transformation recruitment company. We provide permanent and contract solutions, helping organisations implement, support, develop, manage, and optimise EPM, ERP, and analytics systems. Our consultants operate internationally, ensuring both clients and candidates benefit from a global network and tailored expertise.

title: Business Developer - Norway
description:
Intric is accelerating its growth, driven by a fresh round of funding from investors and strong demand from both existing and new customers.
   

  

 Our platform - Intric.ai - is currently transforming how work is done, primarily within the public sector and companies that value data sovereignty, by making the power of AI accessible to a wider audience. We have secured a market-leading position in a niche of this segment.
   

  

 We are seeking a motivated individual eager to embark on the journey of a lifetime with our expanding and driven team.
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Business Developer you are at the core of the sales team, helping accelerating our growth by expanding the use of our platform to new customers, primarily focusing on the Norwegian market.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* Passionate about business development and interested in AI.
* Solution-oriented with an entrepreneurial spirit who gets things done.
* Enjoy working in a fast-paced, agile environment.
* We think you have 1-2 years of experience in similar roles or demonstrable achievements in relevant areas. Experience with a startup is considered extra relevant.
* Fluent in Norwegian, social, driven, and eager to learn new things.


**Key Responsibilities**
 As a part of our sales team, one of your primary responsibilities is to bring our revolutionary product to both new and existing markets. This will include executing activities such as:
   

  

* Building up and establishing our presence on the Norwegian market
* Talking to potential customers and understand their needs
* Negotiating and closing deals
* Sourcing and initiating potential partnership opportunities
* Do what it takes to hit targets and deadlines, which might include proactive demand generation and finding creative ways to build the sales pipeline


**What We Offer**
* An opportunity to be a part of building a system and company that defines the future
* Rapid career development in an exciting, fast-moving sector
* Competitive compensation package combining salary and stock options

title: Sales & Business Developer
description:
Would you like to be part of the journey in one of Europes fastest growing fintech? 🚀
 



  





**About Mynt** 




  





 Mynt is an all-in-one corporate card and spend management solution, on a mission to fundamentally change business banking forever. Our digital software, coupled with corporate cards and payments infrastructure, eradicates manual administrative tasks relating to spending for businesses. Mynt is experiencing huge growth in the Nordic markets, and we have recently secured substantial funding to support our continued expansion in Sweden and internationally.
 



  





 Mynt is a tech-first company with a product-oriented mindset, empowering teams to create innovative solutions to complex problems. We are a licensed e-money institution, card issuer and payment processor under the supervision of the Swedish Financial Supervisory Authority. We have established key partnerships within banking, ERP, fleet and mobility - and our solutions are now live in all Nordic countries. Examples of partners include Fortnox and Nordea, with more collaborations underway.
 



  





 Joining Mynt means contributing to creating an exceptional product and company. We seek passionate individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment, prioritizing customer value. With around 75+ employees (and growing fast), we plan to further expand our Platform team to support our growth.
 



  





**About the role** 




  





 We’re on the lookout for ambitious
 **Sales & Business Developers** 
 to join our growing commercial team at Mynt HQ in Stockholm. 🚀
 



  





 If you get a kick out of building relationships, spotting opportunities, and driving real business impact, this is your chance to jump into a fast-growing fintech that’s changing how companies handle spending and payments. You’ll be part of a driven (and genuinely fun) team where ideas move fast, ownership is huge, and your voice really matters. If you love that mix of structure, creativity, and commercial hustle - you’ll fit right in.
 



  





**How you’ll make an impact** 




  




* Run the full business development cycle - from first contact to closing the deal.
* Reach out to mid-level and C-level execs and build strong, long-term relationships.
* Bring Mynt to new companies and act as a true ambassador for what we stand for.
* Spot new opportunities and help shape how we grow in the Swedish market.



  





**What you’ll bring to the team** 




  




* Proven experience in
 **B2B sales or business development** 
 , ideally within SaaS, fintech, or financial services.
* A strong mix of commercial drive, curiosity, and confidence in high-level conversations.
* A creative, proactive, and results-oriented mindset, you make things happen.
* Experience from a startup or scale-up environment (you enjoy when things move fast).
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English.



  





**What we can offer you** 




  




* Be part of an amazing team in a fast-growing scale-up.
* Work closely with a fun, high-performing team.
* Enjoy a flexible working environment with a great office location in central Stockholm.
* Shape your own development and responsibilities based on your passion and interest.



  





*The position will be filled as soon as we find a suitable candidate. Please reach out to us as soon as possible if you believe this for you!*
