title: UX/UI Designer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons, while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**We are currently looking for a highly skilled UX/UI Designer to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Design high-quality and user-friendly interfaces for web and mobile. Examples: UniFi Network app, UniFi Protect app, UniFi Design System, ui.com, store.ui.com, design.ui.com and more
* Embrace a design-first approach, pushing the boundaries of design by working on new and innovative ideas
* Co-work with key stakeholders including leadership, strategists, developers (FE/FS) and other designers
* Navigate an agile work environment, iterating quickly yet maintaining high quality
* Actively participate in mulitple projects across the company and voice your ideas on design improvements


**Requirements**
* Expert level UX and UI design skills
* Minimum five (5) years of experience designing interfaces for web and mobile
* Highly proficient in Figma
* Strong interest in working hands-on with design, considering both user experience and UIs
* You take full ownership of your tasks and responsibilites
* Genuine passion for great UX
* Excellent communication skills and highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Knowledge about networking & wireless technologies
* Experience with Adobe After Effects or any other animation tool for interactions
* Skilled in Cinema 4D or Blender


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests


***Please note that a background check will be conducted in the final stage of the recruitment process***

title: UX/UI designer - vikariat
description:
Har du en passion för att skapa användarvänliga digitala lösningar? Vill du arbeta i en kreativ och utvecklande roll som UX/UI-designer i ett unikt bolag inom försäkring där du kommer att spela en viktig roll i den digitala försäljningen och marknadsföringen? Då har vi på Svedea rätt utmaning för dig!
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Som UX/UI-designer kommer du att ha en central roll i att förbättra och vidareutveckla vår webb. Du kommer att arbeta både med användarupplevelsen och gränssnittsdesignen, i nära samarbete med vår andra UX/UI-designer och andra nyckelpersoner inom organisationen. Genom att kombinera din kreativitet och tekniska kompetens kommer du att spela en central roll i att visualisera och implementera designlösningar som skapar en intuitiv och engagerad upplevelse för våra kunder.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du att:
   

  

* arbeta med gränssnittsdesign genom hela kundresan på webben
* kontinuerligt förbättra och underhålla designsystemet
* skapa prototyper och mock-ups för att visualisera olika delar av processen
* ha ett nära samarbete med det agila utvecklingsteamet, särskilt Front-end-utvecklarna, för att säkerställa att designen implementeras korrekt
* samarbeta i arbetet med användningsstudier (UX-research)


 Du kommer att tillhöra vårt team Digital. Vi är ett härligt och glatt gäng på 7 personer, alla med olika expertiser men med ett gemensamt fokus på digital försäljning.
   

  

 Tjänsten är ett föräldravikariat på ett år med start i mitten på januari 2026.
   

  

**Din bakgrund**
 På Svedea lägger vi stor vikt vid personlighet och potential. Vi söker dig som är kreativ med ett öga för detaljer, färg och form. Med ett högt eget driv och initiativförmåga tar du ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och slutför det som påbörjats. Du tycker om att samarbeta med andra och har en god kommunikativ förmåga. Vidare är det viktigt att du kan ge och ta emot feedback med en strävan efter att utveckla dig själv och dina kollegor. Som person är du öppensinnad och nyfiken på att lära dig nya saker. Med en prestigelös attityd vågar du utmana och kommer med egna förslag och idéer på förbättringar. Din analytiska förmåga hjälper dig att tolka användardata för att förbättra den digitala användarupplevelsen.
   

  

 Utöver din personlighet är det viktigt att du har:
   

  

* relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom UX eller motsvarande
* minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av användargränssnittsdesign och verktyg som Sketch eller Figma
* förståelse för användningsstudier (UX-research)
* mycket goda kommunikationsfärdigheter på svenska då det är vårt bolagsspråk


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* erfarenhet av att arbeta med användningsstudier (UX-research)
* kunskap om och erfarenhet av agila arbetsmetoder
* grundläggande förståelse för HTML och CSS
* erfarenhet av att skapa och underhålla designsystem
* erfarenhet av att samarbeta med flera intressenter för att skapa användarcentrerad design


**Vi erbjuder dig**
* En inspirerade företagskultur som kännetecknas av laganda med passionerade och engagerande kollegor som förstår vikten av att hjälpas åt och att ha kul tillsammans. Mer om vår kultur hittar du här! 💙
* Möjlighet till visst distansarbete med minst 3 dagar på kontoret/vecka för att balansera privat- och arbetsliv
* En arbetsplats som befinner sig i en spännande expansiv fas där dina tankar och idéer uppmuntras 🚀
* Ett riktigt schysst förmånspaket och möjlighet till en årlig bonus. Läs mer om våra förmåner här!
* Kontor högst upp i ett av Kungsholmens häftigaste hus med 360 graders vy över stan och terrasser i flera väderstreck. Spana in vår Office tour nedan 👇


****Låter det intressant?****
 Välkommen med din ansökan! Vi arbetar löpande med urval så vänta inte utan skicka in din ansökan redan idag. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag vilket är den 31 oktober. Observera att vi enbart tar emot ansökningar via länken i annonsen. Om du har frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Caroline Sundvik, Chef Digital mejl: Caroline.Sundvik@svedea.se eller telefon: 072-141 14 94. Har du frågor kring processen, vänligen kontakta HR Helena Andersson, mejl: Helena.Andersson@svedea.se eller telefon: 073-598 51 93.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

*Tester och arbetsprov kan förekomma i samband med rekryteringsprocessen.*
**Om Svedea**
 Svedea är en framgångssaga. Våra första 15 år har gjort oss till det ledande bolaget inom försäkring av fritidsfordon som motorcykel, båt och snöskoter och vi är en stark utmanare inom bil-, djur- och företagsförsäkring. Efter önskemål från våra kunder erbjuder vi nu även hem- och villaförsäkring. Idag har vi omkring 430 000 kunder och fortsätter att växa snabbt.
   

  

 Vår vision är att förändra försäkringsbranschen genom att finnas tillgängliga och göra allt för våra kunder. Hemligheten bakom vår framgång är engagerade medarbetare som trivs på jobbet i kombination med en tydlig företagskultur. Nu ökar vi tempot för att fortsätta växa, behålla de mest engagerade medarbetarna och de nöjdaste kunderna\*. Vår resa har bara börjat!
   

  

* Svenskt Kvalitetsindex (SKI) har tilldelat Svedea utmärkelsen Sveriges nöjdaste kunder i kategorin fordonsförsäkring 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023 och 2024 samt i kategorin djurförsäkring 2023. Vi är även stolta vinnare av SKI för båtförsäkring 2025.

title: Visual Designer
description:
At intric we believe everyone should be able to benefit from AI. That’s why we’re on a mission to build an easy, open and secure AI platform, enabling the public sector and enterprises that value data sovereignty to focus on what’s really important: Creating positive impact and lasting change.
   

  

 We’re at the forefront of enabling wide-scale, organisation-level AI adoption without technical barriers, crafting delightful and powerful interfaces that make novel technologies intuitive. You’ll join us on our journey as the company’s second designer, laying a foundation for our future design culture and organisation.
   

  

 We are ambitious and deeply engaged, united by the drive to break down barriers to AI adoption. You’ll become part of a collaborative, Stockholm-based team where every idea is valued and every voice shapes the product.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Set a new standard of how AI-assisted work looks for everyone, not just tech experts.
* Work across the full creative spectrum, from product to brand and marketing
* Learn and grow fast, with opportunities to contribute in new spaces you might not have tackled before.
* See your work shipped and used by organizations committed to meaningful public impact.


**What you’ll get:**
* Flexible, trust-based work environment
* Rapid career development in an exciting, fast-moving sector.
* Competitive compensation package combining salary and stock options


**How we work:**
* Cross-functional and highly collaborative: Work closely with great minds from business, engineering, and product.
* No hand-offs, full ownership: Pair up from ideation through launch.
* Flat and open: The best ideas win, and everyone has real influence.
* Fast iterations: Lightweight process, pragmatic decisions, and continuous learning.
* Culture of purpose: We are focused on impact.


**What we’re looking for:**
* Creative, independent first-principle thinkers: you invent, not imitate
* How you take ideas from nothing all the way to launch
* You hold the highest bar for quality and champion great user experiences
* Refined taste and exceptional visual expression
* Strong digital intuition—you know the possibilities and constraints of modern mediums
* Formal training in design or comparable professional experience


*Bonus points for*
* Coding skills
* Experience in a product company, startup, or agency—especially in tech or the public sector


**Note** 
 : we welcome all applications demonstrating relevant creative work, especially work spanning multiple disciplines.
   

  

 Apply via this form and include a portfolio showcasing your best work.
   

  

 Applications without a portfolio will not be considered.

title: Creative Intern
description:
Join AVOLT as a Creative Intern in Stockholm. Create bold visual content, explore global design trends, and grow your craft with a passionate team shaping modern aesthetics.
 



  




**About the Role** 

 AVOLT is looking for a 
 
 Creative Intern
 
  to join our team in Stockholm. In this role, you’ll support the creation and production of visual content that strengthens our brand and drives engagement across digital channels. You’ll work closely with the 
 
 Creative Director
 
  and 
 
 Growth Lead
 
 , gaining hands-on experience in everything from concept development to editing and delivery.
 



  




**What You’ll Do** 
* Video Editing:
 
  Create engaging video content for Instagram, TikTok, Pinterest, and YouTube Shorts.
* Photo & Film:
 
  Capture photos and video for smaller campaigns and everyday content – such as native mobile content or camera stills. For larger productions and collaborations, you’ll support external photographers and production partners.
* Organic & Paid Content:
 
  Assist in producing both organic social content and materials for ads and performance marketing. Help adapt storytelling and visuals for different platforms and trends — beyond just adjusting formats.
* Concept & Production:
 
  Contribute to developing visual campaign ideas together with the Creative Director and Growth Lead, and support the production process from planning to delivery.
* Trend Research:
 
  Stay up to date on content, design, and social media trends, and bring fresh, creative ideas that align with AVOLT’s visual identity and tone.



  




**Who You Are** 
* Creative, driven, and eager to learn in a fast-paced environment.
* Passionate about creating visually strong content that inspires and engages.
* Experience or education in content creation, design, or media production is a plus.
* Awareness of digital culture and a strong sense for what resonates on different platforms.
* A collaborative mindset — comfortable taking direction and contributing ideas.



  




**Skills & Tools** 
* Basic to intermediate knowledge of 
 
 Adobe Premiere Pro
 
 , 
 
 After Effects
 
 , 
 
 CapCut
 
 , and 
 
 Photoshop
 
 .
* Experience with 
 
 Lightroom
 
 , 
 
 Canva
 
 , and 
 
 Figma
 
  for still image editing, layout, and visual design.
* Understanding of 
 
 photo retouching
 
 , composition, and optimizing still material for digital platforms.
* Familiar with 
 
 camera (DSLR/mirrorless)
 
  and mobile content creation.



  




**What we offer** 
* Creative Expression – Help shape AVOLT’s global identity.
* Hands-On Impact – See your ideas come to life.
* Fast Growth – Learn in a passionate, experienced and design-driven team.



  




**Additional Info** 
* Location:
 
  Based at our Stockholm office.
* Compensation:
 
  This is an 
 
 unpaid internship
 
  designed for students or early-career creatives seeking hands-on experience in a design- and content-driven environment.
* Opportunities:
 
  Participate in international projects and collaborations with leading global brands.

title: Graphic Designer Web & Print
description:
Job vacancy
   

  

 Graphic Designer Web & Print.
   

  

 Details
   

  

 Location
   

  

 Hägersten, Stockholm
   

  

 Starting date
   

  

 Per agreement
   

  

 Working hours
   

  

 Full-time
   

  

 Form of employment
   

  

 Permanent employment
   

  

 Apply
   

  

**Job Description.**
 We are looking for a passionate graphic designer to our marketing team. Mellifiq produces continuously large amounts of unique content as a result of our extensive research, laboratory tests and groundbreaking solutions. This content is partly used in our communication, marketing and for training purposes of our employees, partners and customers worldwide. We produce all needed graphic design in-house.
   

  

 The position is placed at Mellifiq HQ in Hägersten, Stockholm, and will mainly consist of designing and producing of graphic elements and complete original materials for;
   

  

* Company websites running on Word Press, available in several languages
* Digital solutions such as computing tools and widgets that make it easier for our customers and partners to calculate, convert and visualize information and better manage their projects
* Growth Marketing, both “inbound” and “outbound” online marketing; to campaign sites, widgets, websites, etc.
* Print files for brochures, posters, product signs and other marketing materials
* Generally, contribute to our team’s communicative development and our user-focused marketing


 Candidate profile.
   

  

 We believe you are creative and have a genuine interest in communication and how messages are enhanced with the help of graphic design. You have significant and relevant experience in graphic design, art directing and UX for web, mobile, print and other presentation materials such as Power Point.
   

  

 You visualize your thoughts and ideas as easily when sketching on a piece of paper, a board or on a computer screen. You have an open mind, are a good listener and always look for interesting and relevant details from a conversation. You have an internal driving force and want to make a difference and a passion for design.
   

  

 You work happily with your own design projects on spare time and proudly portray your portfolio of web and print designs. On your free time you read and follow forums to keep yourself updated with the latest in designs and upcoming trends and techniques.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Excellent skills in Adobe Creative Suite, mainly Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, After Effects, etc.
* Understanding in SEO and SEM
* Excellent written and oral communication skills in Swedish and English
* Valid driver´s license in Sweden


 Merits
   

  

* Experience in WordPress
* Experience in design in Microsoft Office
* Easy to communicate with programmers, thus increasing the effectiveness of a project
* Relevant experience of working with brands, visual identities and communication by packaging expressions, solutions and messages
* Experience of motion graphics, animation and illustration
* Experience in social media marketing


 Please include a link to your online portfolio in your application.
   

  

 Application.
   

  

 Interested? Send in your application containing your resume and personal letter by filling in the form below. Do not hesitate to get in touch with us if you find this job opening interesting or have any questions.
   

  

 Applications are only reviewed when sent through our application form below. Applications are reviewed continuously, and the position may be filled at any time.
   

  

 Apply here

title: Arlo Europe CRM Digital Designer
description:
**Arlo Europe** 

 ,
 

 part of Verisure, is seeking a talented, creative, passionate
 
**CRM Digital** 

**Designer** 
 to be based in
 ****Stockholm, Sweden.****


 The role will be part of the Portfolio team and will directly report into
 
**The Head of CRM,** 

 based in France, and will work closely with the
 
**Design and Marketing departments.** 








**The company’s success depends on its people, and it invests in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading world-class company that has a strong entrepreneurial spirit.** 
  
 











**About Arlo Europe** 








 Arlo Europe, part of Verisure, is a leader in smart home security. We combine cutting-edge camera technology with intelligent services to give millions of families across 49+ countries the clarity, confidence, and peace of mind they deserve.
 







 Our mission is clear:
 **to deliver smarter home security that connects, prevents, and protects with intelligence, simplicity, and trust** 
 . Together, with millions of families, we are creating safer, more connected homes everywhere.
 







**In 2019, Verisure acquired all rights to Arlo’s European business,** 
 in particular, the exclusive distribution rights for Arlo branded camera products for all sales channels in Europe, including e-commerce and retail. What makes us unique is that Arlo Europe operates as a
 **start-up within a global group** 
 . This means you’ll benefit from a
 **fast-moving, entrepreneurial, and agile environment** 
 , while also enjoying the
 **stability, resources, and career growth opportunities** 
 of a world-class company. It’s the best of both worlds: the excitement of building something new, backed by the strength of an industry leader.
 







 At Arlo Europe, you’ll be part of a team where
 **your ideas and impact matter** 
 , and where together we are shaping the future of safer, more connected homes.
 










 Responsibilities
 
 Visual Design for CRM Campaigns
 


* Design email templates, newsletters, and other CRM assets that align with brand guidelines.
* Create graphics, banners, and illustrations for use in email, SMS, and push notifications, and other media
* Ensure designs are optimized for both desktop and mobile formats.



 User Experience in CRM Content
 


* Develop layouts that enhance readability and engagement.
* Apply UX principles to ensure intuitive, customer-friendly designs.
* Maintain visual consistency across all CRM touchpoints.



 Brand Alignment
 


* Ensure all visual elements comply with corporate brand standards.
* Adapt global brand guidelines to local market needs when required.



 Creative Assets Management
 


* Maintain a library of reusable CRM design templates.
* Organize and archive creative assets for easy retrieval.



 Collaboration
 


* Work closely with CRM managers, copywriters, and developers to deliver final campaign creatives.
* Incorporate feedback from stakeholders into design revisions.



 Quality Control
 


* Test visuals across different email clients and devices to ensure accuracy.
* Check image resolution, file size, and load speed for optimal performance.


 Location
 
 Permanent hire based in Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid).
 






 Reports and organization structure
 
 Direct reporting line into Head of CRM, France
 







**Candidate profile** 







 Experience and Qualifications
 
 Education
 


* Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Visual Communication, or a related field (Master’s degree or MBA in Design Management is a plus).
* 3–5 years in a professional design environment (agency, in-house creative team, or product design department).


 Competencies:
 
 Technical Skills
 


* Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, XD) and/or Figma, Sketch.
* Strong understanding of branding, typography, color theory, and layout principles.
* Familiarity with UI/UX principles and design system management.







 Nice to have
 


* Experience with any CRM tool (Salesforce, marketing cloud, customer io)



 Soft Skills
 


* Strong creative vision with attention to detail.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and stakeholder management skills.
* Ability to translate business goals into compelling design solutions.
* Strong organizational skills to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
* English fluent, writing and speaking






 Strong fit with our Company DNA
 * Passionate in Everything We Do:
 
 Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly.
* Committed to Making a Difference:
 
 When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline.
* Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small;
 
 it’s a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously.
* Winning as a Team:
 
 Our people know that by leveraging one another’s strengths, investing in and developing our team’s capability and by collaborating well, we will win.
* With Trust & Responsibility:
 
 Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.







**The Company** 




**Diversity & Inclusion** 




 Verisure is an equal opportunities employer. We recognize the richness that diversity brings and encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. We champion an inclusive and collaborative culture and empower all employees to succeed and grow. Please reach out to us if you have any specific requirements throughout the recruitment process, we are happy to help. At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status.
 







**We Are People Who Protect People** 




 We are the leading provider of professionally monitored alarms for residential households and small businesses in Europe.
 







**Peace of mind for families and small businesses** 




 We believe it is a human right to feel safe and secure. We now protect more than 5 million families and small businesses. Our service includes 24/7 monitoring, expert verification and response, customer care, service and maintenance services, and professional technical support. As well as protecting against intrusion, we protect against fire, attack, theft, life-threatening emergencies and other hazards. Verisure people are dedicated and committed and provide what we believe is the best customer service in the industry.
 







**Leading across a broad footprint** 




 We are the leading provider of residential and small business monitored alarms in Europe. We operate in 17 countries across Europe and Latin America. Our business is driven by organic growth, based on our differentiated business model. We attract high quality customers. We work hard to ensure that our customers are happy. This contributes to an industry leading level of attrition and a long customer lifetime.
 







**A technology-enabled human services company** 




 Our 26,000 team-mates are the foundation of our company. Our business model combines technology and human expertise to protect people. We are a human services company. More than 80% of our colleagues interact with customers every day. This connection provides the insight that inspires our innovation. These insights are a source of advantage. We leverage these insights with the significant investment we make into product and service innovation. The close customer contact also fuels the pride which drives engagement.
 







**35 years of experience – and many more to come** 




 We have been protecting what matters most since 1988. Over that time, we have expanded beyond our roots in the Nordics and Spain. We now serve most of Europe and have also established a strong presence in Latin America. In 2017, to evolve our operating model, strategic innovation, operational excellence and access to talent, we opened our new Group headquarters in Geneva, Switzerland. In 2019, we formed a strategic partnership with Arlo, a world leader in connected cameras. Verisure acquired all rights to Arlo’s European business. This allows us to offer connected camera services in Europe as a complement to our professionally monitored security service. It also allows us to access new go-to-market opportunities in retail and e-commerce.

title: Visual and Motion Designer
description:
Established in 2004,
 **OLIVER** 
 is the world’s first and only specialist in designing, building, and running bespoke in-house agencies and marketing ecosystems for brands. We partner with over 300 clients in 40+ countries and counting. Our unique model drives creativity and efficiency, allowing us to deliver tailored solutions that resonate deeply with audiences.
   

  

 As a part of
 **The Brandtech Group** 
 , we're at the forefront of leveraging cutting-edge AI technology to revolutionise how we create and deliver work. Our
 **AI solutions** 
 enhance efficiency, spark creativity, and drive insightful decision-making, empowering our teams to produce innovative and impactful results.
   

  

**Visual and Motion Designer**
 Type: permanent
   

  

 Location: Stockholm, Sweden (hybrid)
   

  

**Portfolio Is Required**
**About the role:**
 Working in partnership with our client, a renowned global leader in the drinks and beverages industry to recruit a talented Visual and Motion Designer. This role involves taking digital, print, and social content projects from concept to completion.
   

  

 You'll infuse fresh ideas, spark consumer interest through compelling creativity, and adhere to brand guidelines, managing projects within time and budget constraints. Collaborate with a multi-disciplinary dynamic team of 15 creative professionals, including Art Directors, designers, copywriters, project managers, UX designers, developers, and product managers, to shape and elevate our brand's visual identity. Reporting directly to the Creative Director, you'll be a key player in driving design excellence and innovation.
   

  

**What you will be doing:**
* Concept, idea development and visual design.
* Graphic design development including artwork, mock-ups, presentations, motion design/graphics.
* Social Media asset production.
* Monitor industry trends and research developments in branding and marketing.
* Produce designs/ideas to the client's brief and exacting standards from start to completion.
* Direct, oversee and execute production of content and concepts for digital platforms.
* Ensure all content is highest quality and relevant for multiple markets.
* Direct development of post imagery and copy, including guiding team members.
* Work proactively to push brands toward new creative expressions.
* Ensure all concepts follow responsible communication guidelines.
* Develop effective working relationships with colleagues and clients.


**What you need to be great in this role:** 
  

  

* Motion Design and Animation:
+ Strong skills in 2D motion design and animation.
+ Keen eye for timing, rhythm, and visual storytelling.
+ Proficiency in After Effects and Premiere.
+ Ability to storyboard animation concepts.
+ Experience creating engaging motion graphics for various platforms.

* Video Editing:
+ Proficient in editing video content for multiple platforms.
+ Skill in ensuring narrative flow and brand consistency.
+ Up-to-date knowledge of current editing trends, techniques, and emerging tools.
+ Experience in post-production and FX.
+ Ability to adapt content for different digital formats and channels.

* Design:
+ Solid foundation in graphic design, including typography, layout, and composition.
+ Ability to support and interpret art direction across motion and static assets.
+ Comfortable contributing to visual concept development.
+ Strong collaboration skills with senior creatives.
+ Experience creating cohesive design systems across multiple touchpoints.

* Excellent client engagement skills with the ability to proactively organise and influence clients and build strong and effective working relationships
* An innate creative flair, interested in art direction and in developing concepting skills
* Strong knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite including Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign.
* Strong typography, layout and technical skills with excellent attention to detail
* An understanding how to work across online banners (static and animated), social media posts (primarily Instagram and Facebook), web design, UI design, HTML email and storytelling
* An understanding of responsive design across all digital platforms
* An understanding of UX and latest Social and Digital technology trends
* Motion and video skills using After Effects, Premiere and Storyboarding Animation concepts
* Working on print-based collateral with great knowledge of branding
* The ability to talk through your ideas confidently with the team and clients
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office and a keen interest in emerging technologies such as AI enhance project deliveries.
* Experience in consumer goods, luxury, or drinks and beverages sectors preferred.
* Fluency in Swedish and English

 to succeed
   

  

 Be

 to push the boundaries of what’s possible

 to understand

 across our community, clients and creations
   

  

*OLIVER,*

All applicants shall be considered for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, neurodivergence, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local laws.*

title: Product Owner
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**We're in Search Of:** 




**A Product Owner who’s hungry to shape what’s next in video commerce with a world-class team by your side** 




  





 At Bambuser, we’re transforming how the world shops online by bringing video commerce to life for some of the world’s most loved brands.
 



 It doesn't matter if you’re early in your career or already have plenty of experience. What matters is hunger. Energy. The drive to spot opportunities, rally people, and ship products that make a difference.
 



 We’re a small team with big ambitions and capabilities. You’ll be right at the center – working with senior devs, designers, and customer-facing teams to uncover opportunities, test ideas, and launch products that create real impact for our users and our business.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Own projects from idea through launch and follow the impact
* Talk to customers and our internal teams to spot opportunities worth building
* Test ideas quickly (no need to design yourself, but you know how to validate fast)
* Write clear, simple specs and work closely with your dev team
* Help bring focus and prioritization in a fast-changing environment
* Share results openly – what worked, what didn’t, and what you learned.
* Drive measurable impact: adoption, engagement, revenue.



  





**Who You Are** 




 We believe you will thrive if you…
 


* Have experience as a Product Owner, Product Manager, Associate PM, or similar role (or you’ve built your own side projects and have something to show for it)
* Know how to build products in cross-functional teams with engineers, designers, CSMs, and sales
* You don’t just make decisions, you make them stick. You explain the why, rally the team, and turn tough calls into shared momentum.
* Can turn user insights into ideas worth testing
* Bring just enough structure to help us scale without slowing us down
* Think in terms of user value and business outcomes, and how to balance them
* Communicate clearly with senior developers and understand technical trade-off
* Are comfortable using tools like Figma, GA, Miro/Notion (or similar)



  





**Bonus If You…** 



* Have been an engineer yourself or studied engineering
* Have worked with e-commerce, video, or SaaS tools
* Have side projects, hackathon experience, or things you’ve shipped just for fun
* Are excited about AI, automation, or rapid prototyping tools
* Have startup or scale-up experience



  





**Who You’ll Work With** 




 You’ll be part of a small, tight-knit product team led by our VP of Product & Innovation. Your closest collaborators will be our engineers (R&D), our designer, and stakeholders from Customer Success and Sales.
 



  





**Why Join Bambuser?** 




 We combine the impact and pace of a scale-up with the creativity of a startup. We’re not just another SaaS company. We’re building the future of video commerce. At Bambuser, you’ll have the freedom, trust, and tech firepower to move fast and build things that matter.
 



  





**How to Apply** 




 Forget buzzwords and laundry lists. Tell us what excites you about this role! Show us how you've driven real impact in previous product work. Applications are reviewed continuously.
 



  





 At this time, we’re only considering candidates located in the Stockholm area who already have the right to work in Sweden (no visa sponsorship required)

title: Master Thesis, 30 HP: Next Generation EW HMI Design
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you a student eager to apply your theoretical knowledge and fresh perspectives to real-world challenges? At Saab, we believe that innovation thrives on new ideas, and your master thesis project could be the spark that ignites our next technological breakthrough.
   

  

 Your role
   

  

 We recognize the immense value that students bring to our company. Your academic rigor, combined with your enthusiasm for cutting-edge technology, allows you to approach problems with a unique and insightful lens. At Saab, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate with experienced engineers and specialists, gaining invaluable practical experience while making a tangible contribution to our growth and development.
   

  

**Background**
 We are looking to define the next-generation HMI for electronic warfare (EW) systems. These systems operate in high-stakes scenarios, where usability of the HMI is crucial. The operator needs to be presented with the most critical information clearly and at the appropriate time in order to facilitate difficult decision-making. The operator also needs to be offered interaction tools that support their goals of detecting and communicating around the active scenario. Furthermore, with increasing levels of automation, the operator’s role in the human-machine interaction loop needs to be understood better. This master thesis will investigate some core aspect of these problems.
   

  

**Description Of The Master Thesis**
 With sensor control trending towards automation, how shall the human operator and AI best collaborate for increased operator performance? This thesis aims to investigate automation of sensor control HMIs from an operator’s perspective. What should be the role of an EW operator in autonomous sensor system, to what level should the HMI adapt autonomously (e.g., cognitive sensor system). Topics such as AI transparency (e.g. mechanistic interpretability), system trust, vigilance and responsibilities might be explored. Looking to define the role of the operator for this next generation of sensors also means defining what metrics “operator performance” describes.
   

  

 Another important aspect of the next generation EW HMI is how one could be better utilized for collaboration between operators of different sensors. As sensor systems grow more complex and distributed, e.g., incorporating multiple EW capabilities, facilitating operator collaboration could aid understanding and lead to more efficient decision-making. Research is required into optimal ways for effective collaboration at different levels of operator control such as single system, multi system, and system tasking, as well as between these. Examples include collaboration within visualizations such as a map, communicating issues, building search programs, and more. Could they collaborate seamlessly as if they were in the same room? How are results best reported to another level of operator?
   

  

 We are looking for research into one of the above topics or a combination, by narrowing the scope together with a suitable candidate. The chosen topic might be researched through literature review, research-through-design, user studies and prototyping at varying levels of fidelity.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 This Master Thesis is suitable for one student with interest in HMI, Interaction Design, and its application to cutting edge technology. You are at the end of your master’s in Interaction Design, Computer Science or Information Technology and about to start your Master Thesis work for 30 HP. We are looking for someone with experience with UX/Interaction Design competence and preferably some skills in HMI/UI development.
   

  

 We provide the support and guidance you need to translate your theoretical knowledge into practical solutions. Join us and become a driving force behind Saab's technological advancements!
   

  

*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*
*What you will be a part of*
 Explore a wealth of possibilities. Take on challenges, create smart inventions, and grow beyond. This is a place for curious minds, brave pioneers, and everyone in between. Together, we achieve the extraordinary, each bringing our unique perspectives. Your part matters.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

**Last application day**
 2025-11-30
   

  

**Contact information**
 Thomas Lindgren, Manager
   

  

 +46 73 4374886
   

  

 thomas.lindgren@saabgroup.com

title: Application Consultant Trainee
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Are you ready to kick-start your career with our European Trainee Program?** 




 We are on the lookout for trainees to join us on our growth journey.
 



  





 Do you want to work with customer-oriented programming across many industries and transform our customers problems into creative technical solutions on a daily basis? Are you technically curious and want to gain more experience in programming? If the answer is yes, then this is the job for you!
 



  





**Building the future for our customers** 




 Lime CRM is a platform with infinite possibilities to customize according to the needs and ways of working of our end users. Your job involves everything from installation, adaptation and development of additional services connected to our CRM system.
 



  





 To be a great Application Consultant at Lime, you have already identified that coding is something you enjoy. But not to worry, we don’t expect you to be an expert in everything before you start – this is a journey where you will develop along the way!
 



  





 Your days will not be just about coding. It’s a 75/25 split between programming and technical project management. One day you develop in SQL and manage integrations using SSIS and Rest API. The next day you might work on tailored customization in Python, HTML, or JavaScript. When you are not coding you are joining costumer’s meetings, workshops, or internal meetings to create solutions for our end users. You will work at one of our awesome offices with a team that together creates the best experiences for our users.
 



  





**An Application Consultant at Lime…** 




 · Creates mappings of data structures between objects.
 



 · Develops front-end components that interact with Lime.
 



 · Contributes to solution design and development of integrations with third-party systems.
 



 · Codes automatic triggers that run based on user actions in the system.
 



 · Reviews code, write tests for your own or others’ code. Quality assurance.
 



 · Plans and estimate of time use related to tasks and projects. High independence in how you control and plan your tasks.
 



 · Works with different programming languages such as Python, SQL and Typescript.
 



 · Has full professional proficiency in Swedish and English.
 



 · Has a relevant academic degree within IT, Engineering, Information Systems, or equivalent.
 



  





**What is the European Trainee Program?** 




 With our trainee program, we promise you a unique opportunity to kick start your career. Faced with interesting challenges from day one, your learning curve will rise rapidly. Throughout the program, you will be mentored by a senior colleague providing support.
 



  





 The trainee program kicks off with two weeks at our HQ in Lund, Sweden. Together with all trainees from our different offices, you will get intense training and education as well as plenty of time for team building and having fun. After the intro period, you head back to your local office and start working hands-on with everything you have learned, combined with more education throughout the year.
 



  





**Are you our next star?** 




 The trainee program starts in January and August every year. Apply asap!
 



  





 Welcome to Lime!

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
At Intric, we're on a mission to let everyone benefit from generative AI by making the creation and deployment of AI-based tools easy, open, and secure. Our collaborative web application is already a trusted resource within the Swedish public sector and we’ll now be entering a pivotal growth phase. Join us now and be a core part of our ambitious journey.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Frontend Engineer, you’ll lead the development of a fast, accessible and scalable web experience. Your work will range from building new features to refining our architecture, always with the end-user in focus. You'll collaborate closely with developers, product designers and business teams to continuously improve the platform across both desktop and mobile.
   

  

 Our tech stack consists of Node, TypeScript, HTML/CSS, Svelte/SvelteKit, Tailwind CSS. Infrastructure: Docker, Git, Jira
   

  

**The** 
**Team**
 You’ll be joining a cross-functional, fast-moving product team with a collaborative mindset. We keep processes lightweight and adapt as we go. You’ll have significant freedom to influence both technology and direction — and we value sharing, learning and pragmatic decisions above hierarchy or rigid frameworks.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 You have 3–5+ years of frontend engineering experience with a solid understanding of core web technologies (HTML/DOM, HTTP, JavaScript/TypeScript). Your experienced in building and scaling modern web applications and proficient in state management and caching (preferably in Svelte or similar frameworks).
   

  

 You can write efficient, maintainable, and accessible code with a collaborative mindset and strong communication skills.
   

  

 You might have a degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
   

  

 While not a must, experience with Svelte/SvelteKit and Tailwind CSS and familiarity with developer tooling and internal workflows is a plus.
   

  

**Perks**
* Flexible, trust-based work environment
* High degree of ownership and influence
* Work on meaningful technology with real societal impact
* A collaborative and curious team that values continuous learning

title: Software Engineer - Stockholm
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are seeking a skilled and proactive Software Engineer with a strong focus on Quality Assurance and Test Automation to join a dynamic team based in Stockholm. This role is integral to ensuring the reliability and accuracy of tracking implementations across various digital touchpoints. The ideal candidate will bring both technical expertise and critical thinking to proactively test, monitor, and resolve tracking-related issues across platforms. You’ll be working closely with cross-functional teams to support high-quality digital analytics and a seamless user experience.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Conduct thorough, programmatic testing of critical events across all digital touchpoints and integrated systems
* Perform manual and automated testing for web and mobile applications (Android & iOS)
* Prepare and maintain test documentation, execute test cases, and manage defect reporting and tracking
* Develop and maintain automated testing scripts to monitor and alert on tracking anomalies
* Perform regression testing and support QA releases, ensuring seamless functionality on platforms such as Tealium, Fabulous, and proprietary web/app environments
* Lead investigations into tracking issues, ensuring timely identification and resolution in collaboration with internal teams and stakeholders


**Requirements:**
* Strong understanding of JavaScript
* Experience with web and app analytics (previous exposure to web analytics tools is a plus)
* Proficient in test management and creating detailed documentation
* Hands-on experience with automation tools such as Selenium or Robot Framework
* Familiarity with tools such as BrowserStack, JIRA, QMetry, and Confluence
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a detail-oriented mindset
* Ability to take ownership of QA processes and collaborate effectively within Agile/Scrum teams


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Frontend Developer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Frontend Developer** 
 in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Frontend Developer in our Sports-and Ads Platforms team, you’ll work on improving and developing the frontends of our internal-and partner tools. Your contributions will directly influence the ease, efficiency and quality of the platforms we are building and maintaining. You’ll contribute to building and refining our frontends of the platforms, as well as supporting the users of our platforms having a seamless user experience.
   

  

 We’re modernizing our services in and around the platform, to enhance scalability and performance, and you’ll play a big part in contributing to this transformation. With a modern serverless architecture on AWS built using languages like Java as well as Golang on the backends, and React on the Frontends, you’ll thrive in an innovative and forward-thinking tech environment.
   

  

 You’ll join a newly formed platform team of 6 developers, one Ad tech Specialist, Product Manager and Engineering manager, all working in our Stockholm office.
   

  

**Here’s What Your Daily Challenges Might Look Like**
* Take ownership of technical design, complexity assessment, development, testing, and deployment
* Collaborate with your team members and-or other teams transforming our platform into modern solutions
* Participate in weekly guild meetings, contributing to best practices, long-term strategy, and maintaining technical excellence
* Continuously invest in your personal growth and skill development


**What We’re Looking For**
 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* Deep knowledge with 5+ years of experience in TypeScript
* Good understanding of React
* Team player with a dedication to testing, code review, and other quality-oriented practices
* Team player with a dedication to testing, code review, and other quality-oriented practices
* Curious and motivated by collaborating with and supporting other teams


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Familiarity with modern frameworks like Vite
* Familiarity with UI component libraries like MUI
* Knowledge in UX
* Experience developing and maintaining services in cloud environments, preferably AWS
* Experience in Next.js


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* Flexibility that works. We follow a hybrid model with at least three days a week in the office, giving you the best mix of collaboration and focus time.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Senior Product Owner - Mobile Apps & Internet Banking
description:
You’ll help shape how millions of customers experience Entercard online and in our app — ensuring every interaction is reliable, intuitive, and secure. This role offers both delivery ownership and visibility — working closely with senior leaders in Digital, Tech, and Commercial to build customer value in a compliant and efficient way.
   

  

 You’ll play a central role in strengthening governance, vendor collaboration, and delivery performance across Entercard’s digital channels.
   

  

 Our Mobile Apps and Internet Banking teams deliver Entercard’s core digital experiences across iOS, Android, and web for over 1.5 million customers in Sweden, Norway, Denmark, and Finland. We enable secure, compliant, and intuitive self-service for credit card and loan customers—working closely with Tech, UX, Customer Service, Commercial, Risk, and Legal/Compliance to ensure stable, customer-centric delivery.
   

  

 We combine disciplined execution with customer insight to continuously improve the digital experience across channels.
   

  

 As Senior Product Owner, you will own and evolve the channel roadmap for Entercard’s App and Internet Banking experiences. Your focus is to turn strategy into structured, efficient delivery — ensuring features are robust, compliant, and aligned across teams and markets. You bring the right balance of technical understanding, delivery discipline, and user empathy, helping Entercard deliver digital products that are safe, stable, and simple to use.
   

  

**You Are a Product Leader Who**
* Brings order and clarity to complex, cross-functional initiatives
* Thinks in systems and dependencies, not just features
* Balances customer value with operational stability
* Keeps teams aligned, motivated, and focused on outcomes


 Your role at Entercard
   

  

* Own and prioritize the App and Internet Banking backlogs, securing clarity and traceability of all items
* Translate strategy and epics into actionable stories with clear acceptance criteria
* Lead the end-to-end delivery process — from discovery through release — ensuring alignment with Tech, Design, and Compliance
* Partner with developers, designers, and analysts to ensure on-time, high-quality delivery
* Manage dependencies across Digital Channels, Commercial, and Tech to ensure cohesive cross-channel experiences
* Coordinate offshore and vendor teams to ensure quality, governance, and timely delivery
* Act as product point-of-contact during critical incidents, ensuring clear communication and post-incident follow-up
* Facilitate workshops to translate business objectives into measurable customer outcomes
* Drive continuous improvement in delivery governance, documentation, and ways of working


 Your strengths
   

  

* 5+ years in digital product ownership/management (apps, web, or fintech)
* Solid understanding of technical dependencies (APIs, architecture, integrations) and agile delivery governance
* Proven experience managing offshore or vendor teams and driving measurable delivery outcomes (quality, speed, or stability).
* Strong collaboration and facilitation skills — able to connect Tech, Design, and Business effectively
* Calm, structured communicator who thrives under pressure
* Bonus: Experience in credit cards, digital payments, or regulated industries


**About Entercard**
 Entercard is one of Scandinavia’s leading consumer credit companies, serving 2 million customers across Sweden, Norway, Denmark, and Finland. Owned by Swedbank, we combine global expertise with deep local insight.
   

  

 We offer credit cards, loans, and digital services under trusted brands. Our mission is to finance life’s big and small moments with transparency, responsibility, and simplicity.
   

  

 Our values shape how we work and lead: We keep our promises, We always improve, We make a difference, We win together.
   

  

 We follow a hybrid model, with 3 days per week in the Stockholm office. This rhythm fosters deeper collaboration, faster alignment, and more effective delivery in a cross-functional environment.
   

  

 We value flexibility, but believe consistent in-person interaction is key to building momentum, trust, and accountability.

title: Business Requirement Analyst
description:
**Drivs du av nyfikenhet och har förmågan att både se helheten och fånga upp detaljer? Vill du omsätta affärs- och kundbehov till tydliga krav för utveckling av våra applikationer?**
 Du är en senior Business Requirement Analyst och sannolikt har du en teknisk utbildning i botten. Du kommer att vara en central länk mellan verksamhet och IT. Du ansvarar för att samla in, analysera och visualisera krav för IT-system och säkerställer att lösningarna möter både affärsbehov och tekniska förutsättningar. Du arbetar nära produktägare, utvecklingsteam och andra intressenter och experter för att skapa tydlighet och samsyn kring krav och lösningar.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Du kommer att jobba i en squad vars fokus ligger på att säkerställa att vi kan stänga ner våra mainframe system och utveckla nya centrala lösningar som provisionssystem, prissättningssystem, fordonsregister med mera. Vår squad tar ett helhetsansvar genom hela utvecklingscykeln från krav, design och implementation till förvaltning. För att sammanfatta kort kan man säga att vi är med på ett hörn på många utav de högst prioriterade initiativen inom If just nu, det innebär också att vi har många kontaktytor.
   

  

 Du kommer att ha en nyckelroll där du får möjlighet att forma och påverka arbetssätt igenom hela kedjan, från krav till testning. Inom några månader förväntar vi oss att du etablerar starkt samarbete med verksamheten, arbetar självständigt med att utveckla värdeskapande funktionalitet och bidrar aktivt med krav som möter tekniska lösningsförslag.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 På samma sätt som vi ställer höga krav på dig som medarbetare, förväntar vi oss också att du ställer höga krav på oss som arbetsgivare. Här är några av förmånerna med att arbeta på If:
   

  

* En inkluderande arbetsmiljö där alla är välkomna
* Karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter inom Nordens största försäkringsbolag
* Sociala aktiviteter, tillsammans med en högkvalitativ professionell miljö
* Möjlighet till hybridarbete
* Hälsosam arbetsplats med exempelvis friskvårdsbidrag, gym och olika idrottsaktiviteter
* Lunchbidrag
* Bra försäkringsförmåner


**Om teamet**
 Du kommer primärt att jobba i en squad kallad Centralized Business Capabilities med ett nordiskt perspektiv. Squaden består idag av ett tiotal personer och tanken är att den kommer att växa. Du har din hemvist i teamet Requirements Engineering & Quality Assurance, bestående av personer som jobbar med kravinsamling, UI/UX och QA.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du är självgående, strukturerad, noggrann och proaktiv och har även ett agilt mindset. Vidare har du har utmärkta kommunikations- och samarbetsförmågor, och trivs med att arbeta med olika intressenter inom både verksamhet och IT.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som:
   

  

* Har teknisk IT-utbildning och flera års erfarenhet av kravinsamling och visualisering av krav för IT-system, exempelvis genom processer, tekniska krav, acceptanskriterier och mock-ups.
* Har erfarenhet av att skapa och bryta ner krav och behov till Epics, Features och User Stories.
* Har mycket god analytisk förmåga och kan hantera komplex data, tekniska strukturer och integrationer.
* Kan facilitera workshops och har en gedigen verktygslåda till hands för att samla in och förstå verksamhetens och IT:s behov.
* Har ett starkt kundfokus i allt du gör, även utifrån ett förenklings- och förvaltningsperspektiv.
* Du har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Certifiering inom kravhantering (t.ex. IREB, BABOK eller liknande).
* Erfarenhet av att skapa designskisser/prototyper i Figma eller likande verktyg.
* Erfarenhet av finans-/försäkringsbranschen
* Van att jobba i Microsoft Azure DevOps


**Övrig information och rekryteringsprocessen**
**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 Screening och intervjuer sker löpande. Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-10-26.
   

  

**Ansökan:** 
 Bifoga din CV.
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Bergshamra, Stockholm.
   

  

**Resor** 
 : Kan förekomma vid behov.
   

  

**Start:** 
 Så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Vid frågor, kontakta Ulrika Hellgren, Head of Requirements Engineering & Quality Assurance, Ulrika.hellgren@if.se
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: Mobile iOS Engineer, Consumer Mobile Platform
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 Wolt is looking for iOS Engineers to expand our Consumer Mobile Platform team. The team is part of the Consumer Product group and is responsible for enabling the delivery of the consumer mobile apps that millions of people in over 20 countries around the world see when ordering food and other products.
   

  

 Our client platform teams have a clear mission:
   

  

**“Enable delivery and ownership of Wolt-grade Consumer Client Applications through engineering excellence and domain expertise.”**
 What you'll be doing
   

  

 As part of the team, and to fulfil our mission, you will focus on many different areas:
   

  

* Building the foundation of our top-rated consumer facing applications
* Enablement of our product teams, architecture and platform robustness, observability, developer experience, and more.
* Driving technical initiatives to foster our engineering excellence
* Aligning with multiple stakeholders
* Supporting product development teams by providing a robust platform that makes it simple and fast for our features to reach our millions of customers
* If you like to communicate with many stakeholders, think about the long-term health and quality of customer experience and technical solutions, find ways to make other engineers’ lives easier and raise the bar of engineering excellence, this is the team for you!


 This role is based in our headquarters Helsinki, Finland. Read more about our remote setup here. 🌍
   

  

 Feel free to check the Wolt Tech Blog for more read about our culture & technology here.
   

  

 Our humble expectations
   

  

* Experienced in iOS development
* Understanding of the iOS ecosystem and platform
* A strong interest in building a maintainable and extensible iOS platform
* End-to-end system design understanding
* Experienced with CI/CD pipelines
* Strong communication skills
* Stakeholder management experience
* Familiar in driving initiatives across an engineering organisation
* Optional, but great to have: Experience/interest in mobile observability
* Have an eye for great user experience


 Next steps
   

  

 We’re reviewing applications on a rolling basis, and the position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so apply as soon as you realize you’d love to join us!
   

  

 The hiring process typically includes an initial chat with our Talent Acquisition Partner, followed by technical interviews, a team conversation, and final alignment.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Experienced Backend Developer - Tracking Information Team, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
*Are you ready to make an impact on millions of lives every day? Join us at PostNord, where your work will help shape the future of logistics across the Nordics!*
*In our team, we build and run the central event manager - the engine that handles millions of events every day. What we do is at the heart of PostNord’s digital ecosystem, enabling everything from parcel tracking to future innovations. We care deeply about quality, ownership, and making life easier for our users - whether they’re customers, colleagues, or developers in other teams. You’ll join a group of curious, collaborative people who enjoy solving real problems together.*
**Be part of the Tracking Information Team**
* We deliver services that impact millions of customers and recipients in the Nordics daily, ensuring they are accessible through platforms like our website and the PostNord app.
* You’ll help build backend solutions that keep things running smoothly for millions of people — making deliveries more reliable and everyday life a little easier, one package at a time. We care about quality and user experience, and you’ll play a key role in making sure our systems live up to that.
* We develop microservices in Kubernetes.
* Our infrastructure is hosted on AWS.
* We prioritize quality and robustness in our deliveries, as they directly affect our customers.
* We take full ownership of our services—from design and development to security, monitoring, and business metrics. With DevOps, we ensure quality at every step.
* We deploy multiple times a week, seeing the value of our work immediately.
* Our team takes responsibility for optimizing our work processes, using practices like mob and pair programming to enhance collaboration, quality, and collective knowledge.
* We collaborate closely with IT teams at PostNord, as well as production units, management, customers, and partners, to capture requirements and ensure our deliveries meet expectations. We’re passionate about what we do, and we want you to join us in shaping the future of logistics!


 ,
   

  

**Who are you?**
 You're a developer with a solid foundation — whether that comes from formal studies or hands-on experience - and you're always looking to grow. You like solving real and complex problems, working in agile teams, and building things that actually help people.
   

  

* You’re into backend development and curious about building robust systems with a great user experience.
* You’re interested in cloud technologies (like AWS) and Java is one of your go-to languages — or one you’re excited to learn more about.
* You take ownership of what you build — from first commit to production and beyond.
* You’re driven by making everyday life simpler for customers, colleagues, and users.


 You’re someone who communicates clearly and openly — whether it’s in code reviews, standups, or just helping a teammate out.
   

  

**Valuable Skills And Experience**
**AWS:** 
 Sound/Basic experience with AWS components such as DynamoDB, Lambda, S3 bucket and CDK/Cloudformation. SQS/Kinesis will be bonus.
   

  

**What we value:** 
 Hands-on experience is great, but a willingness to learn and build serverless solutions is just as important.
   

  

**Java:** 
 We work with Java 21/SE+ and Spring Boot, and we emphasize writing stable, well-tested code.
   

  

**What we value:** 
 Basic knowledge is essential, and we’ll support you in deepening your expertise. Good understanding of Java 21+ and Spring Boot for developing backend applications. I am eager to learn and grow skills for developing cloud native applications using AWS.
   

  

 Kafka (or real data streaming tools) will be bonus
   

  

**Github/Docker and (AWS EKS):** 
 These tools help us scale and orchestrate our applications.
   

  

**What we value:** 
 Some familiarity is helpful, but not required—we’ll help you get up to speed.
   

  

 Basic knowledge will suffice from the task completion via code development till production deployment
   

  

**REST API Services And OpenAPI Documentation (aka Swagger)**
 We use REST APIs and Swagger for defining and documenting secure web services.
   

  

**What we value:** 
 If you’ve worked with APIs before, great! If not, we’ll guide you through it.
   

  

**Prometheus And Grafana**
 Monitoring and visualization tools that help us ensure performance and reliability.
   

  

**What we value** 
 : No prior experience needed—we’ll provide on-the-job training.
   

  

 Knowledge of prometheus/grafana will be bonus
   

  

 You’ve probably studied something like Computer Science or Information Systems — or maybe you’ve picked up your skills in other ways. What matters most is that you know your stuff. You’re comfortable communicating in both Swedish and English, whether it’s in writing or in conversation.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Step into a dynamic hybrid workplace where collaboration, creativity, and innovation are at the heart of everything we do.
* Grow with us! We support your development with opportunities for career advancement—including sponsorship for AWS certifications.
* Feel secure with comprehensive insurance and pension plans that have you covered.
* Stay healthy and energized with a wellness allowance to Arkens gym and pool.
* Enjoy exclusive perks through PostNord Plus, giving you access to a wide range of employee benefits.


**Making everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading provider of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordics. We ensure postal services for individuals and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. Our goal is to make everyday life simpler and more sustainable for everyone in the Nordics.
   

  

 We are accountable, courageous, and committed, effectively leading change for ourselves and others. We value teamwork, honesty, and positive relationships in the workplace. By embracing diversity, we create better outcomes for the business.
   

  

**Apply Now**
 What are you waiting for? Take the next step in your career and join us in creating extraordinary solutions for millions across the Nordics! Selections and interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis, so apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position, feel free to email robert.svensson-eshraghi@postnord.com

title: .NET System Developer
description:
At Sii Sweden we are committed to building innovative digital solutions working on exciting projects for our customers across various industries, with a strong focus on quality.
 



 We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented .NET System Developer to join one of our customers’ teams. The ideal candidate will be experienced in designing and developing robust, scalable, and secure enterprise applications using the Microsoft .NET technology stack.
 



  





**Your tasks** 



* Design, develop, and maintain C# .NET applications and libraries
* Build and enhance web applications using ASP.NET MVC
* Implement and optimize SQL Server databases and stored procedures
* Collaborate in system architecture and solution design discussions
* Analyze and manage customers’ and Product Owner’s requirements
* Build front-end components using HTML5/CSS3 or equivalent technologies
* Participate in code reviews, testing, and deployment activities
* Create system documentation
* Work cross-functionally with project managers, QA engineers, and UI/UX designers, and cooperate with sales and support teams



  





**Requirements** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field
* Strong experience with C# .NET and ASP.NET MVC
* Solid understanding of SQL Server (queries, performance tuning, database design)
* Hands-on experience with SOAP/XML, WCF, and JSON
* Familiarity with Visual Basic .NET
* Proficiency in HTML5/CSS3 or similar front-end technologies
* Experience in software architecture and system design
* Ability to write clean, scalable, and well-documented code
* Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills
* Fluency in written and spoken English



  





**Nice-to-have requirements** 



* Fluency in written and spoken Swedish
