Polismyndigheten kommer att behandla dina personuppgifter i enlighet med reglerna i EU:s dataskyddsförordning (2016/679) och annan tillämplig dataskyddsreglering. Läs mer om vår hantering av personuppgifter på https://polisen.se/personuppgifter/rekrytering



Din ansökan är en allmän handling enligt offentlighetsprincipen.


**Polismyndigheten**

*Polismyndigheten erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som stimulerar till mångfald, kreativitet och personlig utveckling. Läs gärna om våra förmåner som anställd hos polisen på* *https://polisen.se/erbjudande*


*Vi bedriver vår verksamhet enligt vår värdegrund: engagemang, effektivitet och tillgänglighet.* *Som medarbetare inom polisen agerar du för likabehandling. Det är en förutsättning för rättssäkerhet, rättstrygghet och för polisens legitimitet i samhället. Som företrädare för polisen respekterar du allas lika värde och skapar förtroende för polisen.*

*Läs gärna mer om polisen och vår verksamhet på* *www.polisen.se*


**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**



Vi undanber oss samtal och mejl från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.

title: Senior IT-Operations Specialist
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?** 




  





 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
 


* 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than
 **450 million active users** 
 per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.



 As a Senior IT-Operations Specialist, you will balance a mix of both technical support and system administration, ensuring the smooth operation of both end-user devices and network infrastructure. You will be responsible for troubleshooting hardware, software, and network issues across a multi-operating system environment, including Microsoft Windows, macOS, and Linux (a small minority). Additionally, you will play a key role in onboarding new employees, provisioning system accounts, maintaining IT inventory, and managing vendor relationships, all while ensuring compliance with ISO standards.
 



  





**The impact you will create:** 



* End-User Support – provide IT support for employees..
* New Employee Onboarding – set up and configure laptops, user accounts, and system access for new hires, ensuring a smooth onboarding experience.
* Network & System Administration – configure and troubleshoot routers, switches, firewalls, and wireless access points.
* User Account & Access Management – provision and deactivate system accounts, email accounts, and application access, ensuring ISO compliance
* Hardware & Software Inventory Management – maintain an up-to-date inventory of IT assets, including laptops, peripherals, and software licenses
* Software & License Management – purchase, renew, and track software licenses and IT assets to ensure compliance and availability
* Vendor & Procurement Management – coordinate with vendors for hardware/software purchases, IT services, and contract renewals
* System Security & Compliance – ensure IT operations align with ISO certification requirements, access control policies, security best practices, and IT governance
* Documentation & Process Improvement – maintain IT documentation, update asset records, and contribute to process enhancements to meet compliance and audit requirements



  





**What you bring in:** 



* Strong Communication & Customer Service Skills – ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users and provide excellent support
* IT Support & Troubleshooting Expertise – proven ability to provide IT support in a multi-OS environment (Windows, macOS, Linux) with a strong understanding of hardware, software, and peripheral troubleshooting
* Systems Administration Knowledge – hands-on experience managing user accounts, system access, and authentication protocols (Active Directory, Microsoft 365, Google Workspace, or similar)
* Networking Knowledge & Administration – understanding of network fundamentals, including LAN management, VLAN configuration, switch setup, and WiFi network troubleshooting
* Network Monitoring & Troubleshooting – ability to monitor network performance, diagnose LAN issues, and resolve connectivity problems



  





**It would be great if you also have:** 



* Basic knowledge of GCP - be able to conduct access reviews, provisioning of access and similar administrative tasks.
* Firewall & Security Awareness – familiarity with pfSense or similar firewall solutions for managing network security and traffic rules
* Virtualization & Infrastructure – understanding of virtual machines (VMs) and experience with Xen or similar virtualization platform



  





**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/** 




  





**Sounds like your dream job?** 




 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
 







**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.** 




 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
 



  





**What we offer:** 



* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package** 
 : Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!



  





**Come as you are:** 




 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc
 **.** 
 All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

title: Desktop Support Specialist
description:
Job Description
 


* The Band 2 – Desktop Technician will provide day to day local\remote desktop support, receive inbound calls, answer questions, troubleshoot and document steps performed to resolve challenges with hardware, software and application issues in a ticketing system. The candidate will also need to facilitate customer resolution for calls and engage their supervisors and managers to ensure operational consistency across all shifts within the IT Support Center. Desktop Support Engineer provides Break Fix, fault diagnosis and resolution. Providing fault analysis to customer’s various core operating systems and platforms, as well be able to provide support and apply desktop fault resolution for the approved application suite. Ideal candidate should have 2-3 Years’ experience in Windows Desktop support.



  





 Position Responsibilities and Functions
 



  




* Provide first/second level contact and problem resolution for customer issues.
* Handling VIP Users
* Work with vendors to remediate complex AV issues as needed.
* Provide timely communication on issue status and resolution.
* Maintain ticket updates for all reported incidents.
* Install, upgrade, support and troubleshoot XP, Windows 7, Windows 8.1, Windows 10 and Microsoft Office 2010, Cisco Jabber, another authorized desktop application.
* Should have basic knowledge of Mac operating system, to support Apple pc users.
* Install, upgrade, support and troubleshoot for printers, computer hardware.
* Performs general preventative maintenance tasks on computers, laptops, printers.
* Performs remedial repairs on Desktops, laptops, printers and any other authorized peripheral equipment.
* Use diagnostic tools to troubleshoot problems associated with network connectivity, and workstation hardware/software.
* Broad experience of IT with basic understanding of Networks, Servers, Audio/Visual, Smart Devices and Telecoms.
* This position requires the ability to work in a project-based environment requiring flexibility and teamwork. Performs other duties as assigned.
* VIP User Support



  





 Candidate Required Minimum Qualifications and Skills
 


* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related field.
* CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP) or better.
* Minimum of 18 months years of IT experience.
* Windows 7-10, Microsoft Active Directory, utilization of GPOs, MS Office 365, PC hardware installation and troubleshooting, Enterprise anti-virus solutions, Helpdesk ticketing systems.
* Mobile device management including IOS and Android devices, Enterprise encryption solutions, Windows PC/laptop management via Active Directory.
* Proven analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
* Proven ability to multi-task, effectively determine priorities and meet SLA’s.
* Excellent communication relationship-building and internal customer service skills.
* Adaptable and flexible in a fast-changing industry and work environment.
* Willing to work off-hours and weekends when required for projects or emergency support.

title: Creative Strategist
description:
Happy Mammoth is a fast-growing natural food tech business selling across the United States, Australia and Europe. We specialize in formulating, producing and marketing gut, digestive and microbiome health foods and natural supplements, designed to help our clients make long-lasting positive health changes and start living very full lives again.
   

  

 Why You'll Love Working at Happy Mammoth
   

  

* Competitive Salary – Your skills and expertise deserve to be rewarded
* Paid Holidays – Relax, recharge, and enjoy well-earned time off
* Work from Anywhere – Your home, a cozy café, or a beachside co-working space—it’s your call!
* Join a Supportive, Global Team – Work with passionate professionals from around the world
* Flexible Working Hours – Manage your schedule in a way that works best for you
* Growth Opportunities – Access free books, courses, and resources to expand your expertise
* Exciting & Dynamic Work Environment – Every day brings new challenges and opportunities
* Make a Real Impact – Help create products that improve people’s lives


 We are looking for a Creative Strategist to join our growing Marketing Team on a full-time basis.
   

  

 Before you dive deeper, please note the following key points:
   

  

 📍This is a full-time fully remote contractor role
   

  

 📍We are seeking someone preferably with a background in B2C marketing
   

  

 📍Although the role is remote, the candidate must be available during EU hours (GMT)
   

  

 Your primary role will center on digital media advertising with a keen focus on enhancing our ad campaigns.
   

  

 As a Creative Strategist, you will be responsible for developing innovative and effective strategies that align with our company's objectives and resonate with our target audience. Your role will blend creativity with strategic thinking to drive impactful campaigns and initiatives. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, design, product development, to ensure cohesive messaging and brand consistency across all channels. The ideal candidate will possess a combination of analytical skills, creative flair, and a deep understanding of consumer behavior and market trends.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Strategy Development:
+ Develop comprehensive creative strategies that support business goals and objectives
+ Conduct thorough research and analysis to identify market trends, consumer insights, and competitive landscapes
+ Translate insights into actionable strategies that differentiate our brand and resonate with our target audience


* Campaign Planning and Execution:
+ Collaborate with internal teams to conceptualize and execute integrated marketing campaigns across various channels, including digital, social media, print, and events
+ Develop creative briefs and provide clear direction to design and content teams to ensure alignment with strategic objectives
+ Monitor campaign performance and metrics to evaluate effectiveness and identify areas for optimization


* Brand Development and Positioning:
+ Contribute to the development and evolution of our brand identity and messaging
+ Ensure brand consistency across all touchpoints and communication channels
+ Identify opportunities for brand positioning and differentiation in the marketplace


* Cross-Functional Collaboration:
+ Work closely with marketing, design, product development, and sales teams to ensure alignment of messaging and strategy
+ Foster a collaborative environment that encourages creative thinking and innovation
+ Communicate effectively with stakeholders to gather input and feedback on creative initiatives


* Trend Analysis and Innovation:
+ Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and cultural shifts
+ Apply insights to inform creative strategies and develop innovative solutions
+ Experiment with new approaches and techniques to continually improve campaign performance and engagement


 Qualifications:
   

  

* Proven experience in a creative strategy role, preferably in an advertising agency or marketing department
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and insights to drive strategic decisions
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and persuasively
* Creative mindset with a passion for developing innovative and compelling campaigns
* Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines effectively
* Proficiency in digital marketing platforms and tools
* Familiarity with design principles and an eye for aesthetics
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to change
* Strong collaborative spirit and ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams


 CVs must be in ENGLISH.
   

  

 Powered by JazzHR
   

  

 5plQW9VI5a

title: Director of Infrastructure and Cloud
description:
Betsson Group is now looking for a Director of Infrastructure and Cloud
 


**The Wow** 

 This leadership position reports to our CTO and will be responsible for delivering and executing various Engineering initiatives within Betsson Group. We are looking for a driven and passionate individual with an in-depth knowledge of evolving infrastructure technologies, a strong operational presence, a strategic mindset, and a solid understanding of the industry. This role will require being present in both our offices in Stockholm and Malta.
 


**A taster of what you will be involved with** 
* Overall responsible for all infrastructure, both on-prem and Cloud-based, offices and production environments within the Betsson group. Both strategically and operationally.
* Advocate responsibility and a sense of urgency for all things operational—drive improved reliability and availability, explore and support new tools, technologies, and platforms.
* Drive the vision and execution of our systems infrastructure organization internally to the company
* Externally promote our vision as well through external speaking engagements with industry partners
* Collaborate closely with all Engineering departments to ensure proper usage, deployment, performance, and scaling of our platforms.
* Full budget responsibility, both planning and executing
* Frequent travel to our other locations will be required


**What we are looking for** 
* Minimum of 10 years of senior managerial experience (Including managing a support and infrastructure team)
* Experience within the gaming industry
* Academic qualifications
* A varied technical understanding and background, including production environments on-prem, in the Cloud and for end users.
* Extremely strong communication skills
* Ambition, strategic mindset, ability to be proactive and to work within a busy sales environment
* A solid understanding of the industry trends, with the ability to analyse future trends


**What we offer** 

 Much like riding a rollercoaster, sometimes life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1700 strong, spread across 7 offices with 900 based out of our Malta HQ alone! We recognise it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator and adrenaline junkie, always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.
 



  
 


 Challenge accepted?
 


 If you are interested to learn more, please apply with your CV in English.
 


  
 




***By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy***

title: Creative Strategist
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As the Creative Strategist, you’ll play a key role in driving creative excellence across digital channels, with a specific focus on social and influencer marketing. This role is for a digitally savvy creative who understands the new fast-moving media landscape and can turn insights and trends into content strategies that resonate, perform, and build brand equity.
   

  

 Working closely with the Global Creative Director, the Creative Strategist ensures that all creative output aligns with the overarching brand direction and visual identity, maintaining consistency, clarity, and cohesion across all platforms and pushing creative boundaries.
   

  

 Key responsibilities:
   

  

* Creative Strategy for Digital Channels: Develop and support channel-specific creative strategies for social media and influencer marketing that align with the brand identity and objectives.
* Content & Campaign Support: Contribute to the development of briefs, creative ideas, and content production to ensure social and influencer activations feel relevant, fresh, and engaging.
* Collaboration & Leadership: Guide, coach, and direct internal teams and external partners to ensure strong creative development across projects and teams.
* Digital Trendspotting: Stay on top of emerging digital trends, platform shifts, and creator culture, and actively bring forward ideas that can be applied to campaigns.
* Collaboration: Partner closely with the social, influencer, and paid media teams, ensuring creative strategies are clear, actionable, and cohesive across touchpoints.
* Performance-Driven Thinking: Support the optimization of creative concepts by considering insights and data, ensuring ideas not only look good but also deliver measurable results.
* Creator Content & Paid Media Alignment: Lead the creative oversight for creator content in paid and ensure paid assets, influencer content, and storytelling are aligned in tone, look and channel.
* Inspiration & Knowledge Sharing: Share inspiration, best practices, and cultural references that push teams to innovate and stay ahead.


 Performance Metrics:
   

  

* Strength and relevance of creative ideas delivered for social, influencer, and paid channels.
* Measurable improvements in KPIs (engagement, reach, conversions)
* Brand alignment and creative consistency across influencer content, paid assets, and social media.
* Integration of platform trends and creator culture into campaigns.


**Qualifications**
 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 We are looking for people with...
   

  

* Proven experience of similar roles within social media, influencer marketing, or digital-first creative strategy (preferably from the fashion industry).
* Strong ability to connect brand philosophy and strategy with creative concepts that drive measurable business outcomes.
* Strong understanding of organic social, creator content, paid social, and the interplay between them.


 And people with...
   

  

* Great collaboration skills, with the ability to inspire and align cross-functional teams.
* Organized and proactive, with the ability to manage multiple creative inputs.


**Additional Information**
 This is a
 **full time permanent position** 
 based in Stockholm at our offices. Apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through our career page.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE** 

  

  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.
* In addition to our global benefits, our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. (Example: Competitive compensation for your dedication and long-term commitment. A day off on your birthday to relax and celebrate your special day. Special gift to celebrate the birth of your child, etc.)


**JOIN US** 

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Cyber Security Manager - Cybercrime
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a Cyber Security Manager, we are looking for a experienced manager and principal leader within Cybercrime and Online Fraud prevention that can drive our delivery and services portfolio.
   

  

 You will ensure that core capabilities are in place to manage Cybercrime, Online Fraud and Loss prevention. You will grow and mature the internal and external organisation, from individual team members to our managed services partners. You will drive risk management work related to the Cybercrime area, improve the security posture to meet current and emerging threats, and proactively work with compliance to policies and regulations.
   

  

*You will be responsible for:*
* Managing the day-to-day activities of the Cybercrime team and ensuring the teams are meeting operational and performance objectives.
* Team level budgeting, planning, roadmap.
* Professional development of staff to ensure they have relevant skills and qualifications.
* Stakeholder management to ensure that the Cybercrime meets the needs of the business and complies with all relevant laws, regulations and enforcing company policies and procedures.
* Contributing to the Cyber Security strategy and ensuring their team is aligned with the strategy.
* Responding to audit findings, prioritizing remediation measures and manage the budget your team, including staff, contracts, and technology.
* Identify demands, objectives and key results and define and monitor supporting KPIs and metrics.
* Ensure the availability, stability, performance of Cybercrime and Online Fraud prevention services.
* Assess and manage risks to the effectiveness of platforms and services to protect against current and emerging threats.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 To provide a secure, trustworthy, and always available experience to our customers, we are now transforming the way we address the continuously evolving and complex cyber security threats and risks. To do this we have created a new Tech Centre focused solely on managing Cyber Security for all our brands and majority investments. Within this Cyber Security Tech Centre, we have a unit that focuses on Cyber Security Architecture & Engineering, with the mission to protect our customers, colleagues, and company by establishing and managing safe and secure technology use.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to lead our Global Cybercrime team, to drive our delivery and services portfolio for preventing cybercrime and online fraud throughout the whole H&M Group and all our brands. You will report to the Head of Cyber Security Architecture & Engineering Unit.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We believe you have several years' experience as a manager within online fraud prevention, preferably within retail or e-commerce, using driving metric-based business value and implementing modern technologies in complex organisations at scale. You have strong leadership skills with experience as staff responsible and you excel at stakeholder management collaboration across business units. You also have experience from working in an agile team with both analysts and engineers
   

  

 You also have the ability to practice creative and critical thinking by adding ideas and solutions to ongoing challenges with outstanding troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving thinking.
   

  

*We are looking for people with*
* Have a track record of successful Cybercrime, Online Fraud and Loss prevention deliveries in complex and large environments, both operations and change programs/projects.
* Have experience from designing, implementing, and deploying Cybercrime and online Fraud prevention solutions in a global enterprise environment, and driving process change and implementation activities.
* People management experience in leading online fraud teams, and metrics driven delivery in the areas of payment optimisation, policy abuse etc. optimising the team and delivery around metrics such as, approval rates, false positives, chargeback rates, fraud rates etc.
* Have working hands-on experience of cybercrime, online fraud and loss prevention, cyber forensics investigations or proactive pattern recognitions, including behavioural.
* Have a proven ability to drive and catalyst the creation, maintenance, and enforcement of policies and procedures to ensure effective provisioning, de-provisioning, and entitlements of identities and accesses.
* Have managed end to end delivery of projects around Cybercrime and online Fraud prevention.
* Have worked with online fraud prevention tools and vendors, such as Forter, Riskified or similar.
* Have a security mindset and general knowledge around security concepts to go with it.
* Have experience with at least one major cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP).


*And people who are*
* Are an experienced leader that understands team dynamics and personal development of staff.
* Have top-notch collaboration and communications skills.
* Holding a relevant certification is beneficial: CISSP, CISM, ACFE.
* In addition, we truly want you to be passionate and proud of your achievements, and that you share this with your colleagues.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
* All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET.
* In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Required Skills & Experience:** 



* 10+ years of experience in Data Engineering or related fields.
* 5–7 years of experience in Data Analytics and Data Warehousing design and delivery.
* Strong understanding of data warehousing principles, ETL/ELT pipelines, and data modeling.
* Expertise with Cloud Data Platforms: Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory (ADF), Snowflake, Databricks, dbt.
* Programming Languages: SQL, DAX, Python.
* DevOps & Automation: Azure DevOps, GIT, ARM templates, Terraform.
* Reporting Tools: Power BI, Power Apps.
* Experience with IT Architecture frameworks, data governance, and scalable design patterns.
* Strong troubleshooting, performance optimization, and stakeholder communication skills.
* Understanding of utility industry processes and IT landscape (preferred).



  





**Preferred:** 



* Exposure to AI/ML for sustainability analytics.
* Experience in energy or utility sector data project

title: Data Engineer with AI
company_industry: Information Technology & Services, IT System Custom Software Development, and Software Development
description:
Company: US3 Consulting
 



 About Company: US3 Consulting is a leading European IT recruitment agency dedicated to connecting top tech talent with innovative companies across the continent. With decades of experience and a fresh approach, we specialize in rapid, cost-effective candidate sourcing across all tech industry sectors. Our expert consultants are committed to building strong, productive relationships, ensuring the perfect fit between candidates and employers.
 



  





 Job Title: Data Engineer with AI
 



 Total Experience Required: 6+ years in Information Technology/Computers/Software
 



 Relevant Experience Required: 4+ years in data engineering with a strong foundation in AI and machine learning integration.
 



 Contract Duration: A minimum duration of 6 months, with the possibility of extension up to 18 months or beyond, depending on project requirements.
 



 Workplace Type: Hybrid (at least 3 times a week at office)
 



 Languages Required: English
 



 Visa/Work Authorization Status: Candidates must hold a valid work permit or visa to work in Sweden
 



 Work Location: Stockholm, Sweden
 


1. Must be currently based in Sweden or
2. Willing to relocate to Sweden from anywhere within Europe or the UK
3. Candidates outside Europe/UK unfortunately cannot be considered



  





 About Client: Client offers a dynamic environment where innovation and professional growth are at the forefront. With a strong emphasis on continuous learning, the company provides employees access to extensive training programs, including LinkedIn Learning and an Education Assistance Program.
 



  





 The company champions a balanced work-life culture, promoting flexible work hours and a supportive atmosphere that values diversity and inclusion. As a part of the esteemed group, it combines global opportunities with a commitment to employee well-being, making it an ideal workplace for those seeking both professional excellence and personal fulfillment.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Design, build, and manage scalable data pipelines and architectures to support AI/ML solutions.
* Develop and implement data models, warehouses, and lakes for analytics and business intelligence.
* Collaborate with data scientists to create high-quality datasets for AI model training, deployment, and monitoring.
* Ensure data integrity, quality, and performance across all systems.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams to define and deliver effective data-driven solutions.
* Stay up to date with emerging technologies in AI, LLMs, and data engineering.



  





**Essential Skills:** 



* Proven expertise in ETL/ELT, data warehousing, and data lake design.
* Hands-on experience with Big Data technologies such as Spark and Hadoop.
* Proficiency in Python for data engineering and AI/ML applications.
* Strong understanding of AI/ML concepts, MLOps, and experience with LLMs (OpenAI API, Claude, LLaMA, Mistral, etc.).
* Experience with data tools including Databricks, Kafka, LangChain, and LlamaIndex.
* Knowledge of fine-tuning techniques such as LoRA and PEFT.



  





**Optional Skills:** 



* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
* Exposure to AI-driven data analytics or business intelligence frameworks.



  





 Interested? Apply Now!
 



 📧 Send your resume to: sowmya@us3consulting.nl
 



  





 🔁 Not a fit for you? Share this with someone in your network who might be interested!
 



 🔗 Connect: linkedin.com/in/sowmyakotamarthy
 



 🌐 Visit our homepage: https://www.us3consulting.co.uk
 



 🔗 Follow us on LinkedIn for more exciting opportunities: https://www.linkedin.com/company/us3-consulting

title: Administratör
description:
*Trivs du med att ha en central roll där du får saker att fungera smidigt? Är du en strukturerad person som gillar att stötta både chefer och kollegor i det dagliga arbetet? Vill du arbeta i en varierad administrativ roll i en innovativ och internationell miljö?* 




  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Vi söker nu en administratör till vår kund, ett välkänt bolag inom fordonsindustrin. Tjänsten är placerad på kontoret i Södertälje.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som administratör arbetar du i en internationell miljö med administration, systemhantering och kontakt med samarbetspartners.
 



 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:
 


* Hantera deltagarlistor i system – ta ut listor och säkerställa att rätt antal deltagare finns registrerade
* Skapa manuella fakturor utifrån deltagarlistor och utbildningar tillsammans med internationella partners
* Ta ut rapporter för att sammanställa statistik över deltagare
* Ha personlig kontakt med partners i Europa och USA
* Vara en problemlösare och spåra avvikelser i komplexa faktureringsflöden
* Ta initiativ och komma med åtgärdsförslag för att undvika problem framåt








**Dina egenskaper** 




 Som administratör är det viktigt att vara noggrann, strukturerad och ha ett sinne för detaljer. Du behöver också vara serviceinriktad och lyhörd för andras behov, eftersom rollen innebär kontakt med både kollegor och internationella partners. Flexibilitet och förmågan att hantera många uppgifter samtidigt är värdefullt, liksom att arbeta självständigt och ta egna initiativ.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer:** 



* Baskunskap i administration och Officepaketet
* Goda kunskaper inom Cornerstone/MyCompass.
* God IT-vana och förmåga att navigera i flera olika system
* Förmåga att hantera fakturor, rapporter och listor på ett strukturerat sätt
* Förmåga att kommunicera obehindrat i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska



  





**Meriterande:** 



* Erfarenhet av internationella kontakter och faktureringssystem



  





**Omfattning och tillträde** 




 Heltid, konsultuppdrag till sommaren 2026. Start omgående.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Ansökan görs på vår hemsida
 
 perido.se/
 
 . Klicka på knappen
 *ansök* 
 i annonsen för aktuell tjänst och fyll i dina uppgifter samt bifoga CV. Vi rekommenderar att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt då urval sker löpande. Notera att viss information gällande uppdraget och/eller kundföretaget medvetet kan ha utlämnats från annonsen, först vid kontakt med ansvarig rekryterare får du all information som du behöver.
 



 De flesta frågor eller funderingar kan du hitta svar på under
 
 perido.se/vanliga-fragor/
 
 . Om du fortfarande inte hittat svaret du söker är du välkommen att kontakta oss på
 **fraga@perido.se** 
 så svarar någon av våra rekryteringskommunikatörer dig. Ange alltid tjänstens referensnummer
 **35487** 
 i ämnesraden. Vänligen notera att vi endast tar emot ansökningar på vår hemsida och att vi inte har möjlighet att svara på hur du ligger till i processen.
 



  





**Om Perido** 




 Varför heter företaget Perido? Det kommer från det latinska ordet
 *Peridoneus* 
 som betyder ”väl matchad”. Att matcha vår konsults kompetens och karriärinriktning med våra kunders behov är det vi är allra bäst på! Perido är ett konsult- och rekryteringsföretag inom tjänstemannasektorn som hjälper dig till nästa steg i yrkeslivet och vår vision är att alla ska trivas och vara engagerade på jobbet. Vi har vuxit stadigt sedan starten 2003 och har över 1500 medarbetare över hela landet, varav ett femtiotal interna medarbetare på våra huvudkontor i Stockholm och Göteborg. Som konsult hos oss blir du en viktig del av vår organisation och du växer tillsammans med oss genom att förstärka med din kompetens ute i våra kunders organisationer. Läs mer om oss på Perido:
 
 https://perido.se/om-oss/
 
 .

title: Cloud Architect
description:
**Location:** 

  Europe / Remote
 




**Experience:** 

  8+ years in cloud engineering, architecture, or consulting
 




  





**Role Description** 





 As a Cloud Architect / Cloud Strategy Consultant, you will help organizations design, migrate, and optimize multi-cloud environments. You’ll work with stakeholders to define cloud strategies, assess workloads, and build scalable, secure, and cost-efficient solutions across platforms like AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud.
 




  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and implement multi-cloud strategies aligned with business and IT goals.
* Lead cloud migration assessments, planning, and execution.
* Design scalable, high-performance, and resilient cloud architectures.
* Implement cloud cost optimization frameworks and governance models.
* Collaborate with DevOps and security teams to ensure compliance and automation.
* Advise on hybrid and edge cloud architectures as part of digital modernization.



**Qualifications:** 



* Deep expertise in AWS, Azure, and/or Google Cloud.
* Experience with IaC (Terraform, CloudFormation, etc.) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Strong understanding of FinOps, cloud cost management, and workload optimization.
* Proven experience in cloud migration and modernization programs.
* Excellent client-facing and advisory communication skills.

title: UI developer
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are looking for a C++ developer with an interest in Qt development and graphics on embedded systems. You don't need many years of experience - most importantly, you like to experiment, test things in the lab and are not afraid to tweak the hardware a bit when needed.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and test Qt applications in C++ Work with graphics, UI and performance optimization on real devices
* Run, debug and experiment directly against the hardware in our lab Work in a Linux environment with modern tools and version control


**Requirements:**
* Have experience with C++ (preferably C++11 or later)
* Have tried or want to learn the Qt framework
* Thrive in a Linux environment and can handle the terminal
* Are curious, practical and like to test the limits of what the hardware can handle
* See problems as opportunities to learn You will work with:
* Work close to hardware and see direct results of your work Opportunity to grow and learn more about graphics, embedded and real-time development
* A committed team that is happy to help you get started A lab environment with modern equipment and a lot of freedom under responsibility


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Business Analyst
description:
At Evitec Solutions, we create innovative IT solutions and advisory services that support our customers' success across industries. With over 300 professionals across the Nordics, we specialize in providing business-critical software for the finance and insurance sectors. Our solutions streamline complex processes, enabling smarter decisions and delivering long-term value.
   

  

 We are seeking a Business Analyst to join our team in Sweden to support our journey with our product, Evitec Solutions Life, in Sweden. Evitec Solutions Life is a complete and flexible policy administration system for life insurance which easily adapts to changing business requirements and needs.
   

  

 As a Business Analyst, you are methodical in your requirements management work, and you are used to work in the customer interface. You have experience in defining and specifying software requirements. If you're interested, please apply. We offer a position with many exciting challenges and great variety, working within a fantastic cross-Nordic team of experts.
   

  

**About Evitec Solutions Life**
 Evitec Solutions Life is an insurance IT software (ES Life) designed for life insurers offering savings, pension and personal life risk products. The software provides a complete, efficient, and scalable policy administration solution. This highly automated and future-proof insurance platform handles policy sales, lifecycle management, and claims processing securely and reliably. It is ideal for life and pension insurance companies seeking a modern system.
   

  

**At Evitec Solutions, You Shape the Future of the Financial Sector**
 We offer an inspiring work environment in a growing and successful organization where you will have opportunities for development. We value a work culture that promotes a balance between work and personal life, including options for hybrid work and flexible hours. Additionally, we foster a supportive work culture where everyone contributes, spreads joy and grows together. Moreover, we offer competitive salaries and benefits.
   

  

**Who Are You?**
 As a person, you are positive, curious, and unpretentious, and you are happy to share your knowledge. You need the ability to work with both holistic and detailed perspectives and can connect strategy with tactics. You are someone who gets things done.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, you should have:**
* At least 2 years of experience as a Business Analyst, working at the intersection of business and IT
* Experience in specifying and writing software requirements
* Familiar with tools like Azure DevOps, JIRA and Confluence (or similar)
* The ability to network and collaborate with stakeholders at various levels
* A business-driven mindset, preferably with experience in financial industry life insurance
* Experience with agile environments and traditional project methodologies
* A pleasant and empathetic approach to teamwork and client collaboration
* Fluency in both Swedish and English, spoken and written


**We also value if you have:**
* Previous experience with financial industry
* Previous experience working in the customer interface
* A desire to develop and learn new things
* An interest in long-term work with systems crucial to society


 While flexibility is important to us, this position requires regular daily presence onsite at our office or customer locations to best serve our projects and clients.
   

  

**Why join us?**
 We offer responsibility aligned with your expertise and ambitions, plus the freedom to grow your career—toward leadership, deep technical specialization, or customer experience excellence. At Evitec, every team member is an equal part of the team, with diverse opportunities to grow and do meaningful work. We get things done with a smile and a positive attitude. Truly.
   

  

 If you'd like to have more information about Evitec or the job before applying, you can contact Head of Engineering Sami Lehtisaari through email: (firstname.lastname@evitec.com).
   

  

**Interested?**
 Make sure you put in your application latest 10.11.2025, we review applications on a rolling basis.

title: IT-tekniker sökes till Stockholm
description:
Framtidens utmaningar ställer nya krav på oss, vilket gör att Försvarsmakten är under omvandling och tillväxt. Vill du vara en av oss som jobbar för ett starkare försvar av Sverige?
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Försvarsmaktens telekommunikation- och informationssystemförband (FMTIS) söker tekniskt kunnig personal i olika nivåer med placering i Stockholm. Vi erbjuder ett spännande och omväxlande jobb inom ett område som är i ständig tillväxt. Ny teknik tillförs ständigt, vilket gör att du hela tiden kommer att mötas av nya utmaningar.
   

  

**Om verksamheten**
 Genomförandeavdelning Stockholm stödjer ledning och stab på militärstrategisk-, operativ- och taktisk nivå och övrig verksamhet inom Stockholms garnison. Stödet genomförs så att stab och ledning ska kunna verka med sina system dygnet runt, året om.
   

  

 Vi arbetar i en utvecklande miljö präglat av ambition och tekniskt kunnande. Vi söker dig som gärna tar dig an nya utmaningar och med ansvarskänsla arbetar lösningsorienterat.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 Arbetsuppgifterna utförs både självständigt och i grupp och de kompetenserna vi söker personal för är bl.a. kunskaper kring:
   

  

* Drift, underhåll och felavhjälpning på klienter, servrar och nätverk
* Konfiguration och design av nät, switchar och routrar
* Planering av förebyggande och avhjälpande underhållsarbete samt driftsättningar av IT-materiel.
* Felsökning, uppgradering och installation av klienter och annan ändutrustning
* Samverka och koordinera stöd mot övrig verksamhet med fokus på operativ effekt.


 Du kommer att arbeta i ett av våra team som består av skickliga och erfarna kollegor som hjälper dig at komma in i rollen på bästa sätt. Arbetet är omväxlande och utförs i huvudsak i Försvarsmaktens lokaler på Gärdet i Stockholm.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 I Försvarsmakten finns en stark värdegrund som bygger på öppenhet, resultat och ansvar, där såväl professionell utveckling som personlig hälsa ryms. Hos oss är en bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv viktigt. Verksamheten erbjuder stor variation och komplexitet vilket innebär goda utvecklingsmöjligheter och förutsättningar för intern karriärrörlighet. Förutom att du kommer att lära dig våra interna system och processer kommer du även höja din säkerhetsmedvetenhet. Våra medarbetare har ett flertal olika förmåner, bland annat:
   

  

* Kompetensutveckling utifrån verksamhetens behov och individuella karriärsmål.
* Tre timmar träning i veckan på arbetstid samt möjlighet att delta i tävlingar och tillgång till träningsanläggningar.
* Bra balans mellan arbete och fritid med flexibel arbetstid samt 28 - 35 semesterdagar beroende på ålder.
* Lönetillägg vid föräldraledighet och VAB samt möjlighet att växla semesterdagar mot extra pensionsavsättning.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Gymnasial utbildning med inriktning mot IT och datakommunikation eller motsvarande kunskaper som kan bedömas likvärdiga
* Aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av installation och konfiguration av IT-utrustning.
* God förmåga att kommunicera i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska
* Körkortsbehörighet B


**Meriterande**
* Aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet som It-tekniker eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av arbete i 1st, i 2nd eller 3rd-linesupport
* Erfarenhet av arbete med produkter från Cisco, Aruba, Fortinet eller Palo Alto, Microsoft
* Erfarenhet av arbete med VMware vSpere och Horizon
* Erfarenhet av förvaltning av tekniska system inom IT/Telecom
* Erfarenhet av IT-säkerhetsarbete.
* Erfarenhet från införande och drift av lösningar innehållande dot1x, PVLAN
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av att arbeta med signalskyddsnära IT-säkerhetsprodukter t.ex. brandväggar och kryptosystem
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av Försvarsmaktens IT-infrastruktur, både mjukvara och hårdvara
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av Försvarsmaktens ledningsstödssystem
* Kunskap och erfarenhet från arbete med AD, GPO/GPP och radius,
* Kunskap och Erfarenhet inom operativsystem för servrar och klienter, nätverksteknik (routing, switching) samt virtualisering
* Relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av arbetsledning, projektledning eller teamlead
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att arbete i komplexa och säkerhetstunga IT-miljöer
* Vana att arbeta processorienterat (ITIL)


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Vi söker dig som är resultat- och lösningsorienterad.
   

  

 Du är engagerad och serviceinriktad med egen förmåga till initiativ. Du är säkerhets- och kvalitetsmedveten.
   

  

 Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Befattningen är en civil tillsvidareanställning och inleds med 6 månaders provanställning för dig som inte är anställd inom Försvarsmakten.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst. Arbetsorten är Stockholm.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan senast 31 oktober 2025**
 För upplysningar angående anställningsvillkor kontakta HR-generalist Hanna Ottosson.
   

  

 För upplysningar om tjänsterna kontakta Fredrik Ulvstig.
   

  

 Fackliga företrädare:
   

  

 SACO Pär Lohman
   

  

 SEKO Matz Felix
   

  

 OFRS Martin Sparr
   

  

 OFRO Håkan Larsson
   

  

 Samtliga nås genom växeln: 08-788 75 00.
   

  

 ,
 **Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.** 
 -------------------------------------------------------- Information om Försvarsmakten och det rekryterande förbandet: Försvarsmaktens telekommunikations- och informationssystemförband, FMTIS, säkerställer Försvarsmaktens förmåga att kommunicera och leda - dygnet runt, året om. Förbandet har ett samlat ansvar för Försvarsmaktens tekniska ledningssystem som stödjer militära insatser till sjöss, på land och i luften – i Sverige och utomlands. Förbandet har närmare 2000 medarbetare på mer än 32 orter runt om i landet. Läs mer på https://jobb.forsvarsmakten.se/fmtis En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras samt att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Radio Technical Support Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 We are seeking a dedicated and collaborative individual to join Ericsson Radio and Transport Engineering within the Customer Experience organization. This role is ideal for early-career professionals who are passionate about electronics, eager to deliver exceptional technical support, and excited to contribute to product development with field insights. We value diverse perspectives and inclusive collaboration to deliver exceptional customer value.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Engage with customers professionally to understand technical issues and explain concepts clearly and inclusively
* Investigate and analyze issues using established processes; collaborate with design teams to drive effective resolution
* Reproduce faults end-to-end within Ericsson environments (CX or design labs) to support accurate troubleshooting
* Translate technical requirements for the Network Data Analytics team and interpret results to understand network impact
* Provide 24/7 on-call support, including on-call duties and follow-the-sun coverage for emergencies
* Offer technical guidance to development projects during product introduction activities and focused development phases
* Collaborate with design teams early in product development to share field insights about product behavior and usage
* Identify opportunities for improvement and innovation in products, processes, and production; contribute practical ideas that create customer value
* Share knowledge through communities of practice and everyday collaboration, helping to build a culture of learning and inclusivity


**What we look for:**
* Planning and organization: ability to set clear objectives, plan activities, allocate resources, and monitor progress
* Adaptability: comfort with change, openness to new ideas, and the ability to adjust communication styles to diverse audiences
* Results orientation: commitment to meeting customer needs, maintaining high quality, and delivering outcomes
* Collaboration: strong interpersonal skills, respect for others, and the ability to build positive relationships across teams
* Networking and relationship-building: ability to establish broad internal and external networks and engage stakeholders at all levels
* Creativity and problem-solving: willingness to propose diverse solutions and contribute to innovative changes
* You’re curious, collaborative, and resilient, with a customer-first mindset
* You thrive in cross-functional environments and value contributions from diverse colleagues
* You communicate technical information clearly and respectfully to both technical and non-technical audiences


 We encourage applications from people with varied backgrounds and experiences. If you’re enthusiastic about electronics, eager to grow in a supportive and inclusive team, and ready to make an impact across the product lifecycle, we’d love to hear from you. Join us to help shape reliable technology that connects people and businesses around the world. We value your unique perspective and potential—bring your whole self to work and collaborate with a diverse team to drive impact.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 773717

title: Backend Engineer
description:
About 0TO9:
   

  

**Team Is All**
 Ideas matter – but people make them real. In finance, that’s harder than it should be. Innovation shapes how we live, but progress is slowed by complexity, regulations, and outdated systems. Too often, great people go elsewhere.
   

  

**0TO9 exists to change that.**
 We’re a fintech venture builder and investor – a bank for entrepreneurship, founded in Stockholm in 2025 by serial entrepreneur Oliver Hildebrandt.
   

  

 Our mission: bring the right people, skills, and resources together so fintech founders can focus on building. From capital and compliance to tech and talent, we create an infrastructure for success.
   

  

 Numbers are the building blocks of finance and with zero to nine, we can build anything. Our name says it all: From you to a team. From idea to impact. From now to what’s next.
   

  

 With offices in Stockholm and Berlin, operations across the Nordics, and a growing portfolio – we’re just getting started.
   

  

**About The Role**
 At 0TO9, you won’t just build services - you’ll shape the core banking platform powering the next wave of fintech ventures. This is a chance to work with and solve complex problems at scale, and be part of building something from the ground up.
   

  

* Build and maintain C#/.NET Core microservices on AWS ECS for the banking platform
* Collaborate with product managers, architects, and engineers to deliver high-performance APIs
* Write clean, testable code following SOLID principles
* Apply DDD and CQRS to create modular, scalable, and maintainable systems
* Design event-driven communication using NATS
* Ensure reliability through idempotency, retries, and self-healing services
* Implement observability: logging, metrics, tracing, and performance monitoring
* Working with both relational (MS SQL Server) and NoSQL (DynamoDB) databases.
* Contribute to secure design (auth, secrets, compliance)
* Improve CI/CD, containerized workflows, and engineering practices


**About You**
 We think you’ll be a great fit if you:
   

  

* Have backend experience working with microservices and distributed systems, C# and .NET Core and AWS
* Take ownership, challenge unclear requirements, and prioritize reliability
* Have applied DDD and CQRS in real-world systems
* Understand event-driven architectures (ideally with NATS)
* Care about writing clean, maintainable, testable code


*Nice to have:*
* Previous fintech or banking industry experience
* Hands-on experience with integration testing, contract testing, or end-to-end service testing
* Knowledge of observability tools and testing strategies for microservices
* Understanding of cloud security, governance, and compliance


**What we offer:**
* Be part of the leading fintech venture builder
* A dynamic, entrepreneurial, international and fast-paced environment
* Beautiful office in the heart of Stockholm
* Strong opportunities for growth and development

title: Data Engineer
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**More independence, freedom, and better pay**
 Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 It's not rocket science.
   

  

 Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.
   

  

 The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.
   

  

 Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

**Why Coody**
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?
   

  

**Maximized Compensation** 
 - Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security** 
 - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shaping the Future** 
 - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

**This is Coody**
 We’re a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.
   

  

 Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.
   

  

 Explore our
 **Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a Data Engineer Consultant at Coody, you'll be diving into technically exciting and intellectually challenging assignments to help companies strengthen their teams and projects. You’ll be designing and setting up fully automated data platforms and data pipelines that creates values for businesses and products in exciting industries. You’ll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments and usually work on 1-2 assignments per year.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We’re looking for a Data Engineer with
 **5+ years of experience** 
 and a proven track record of making things happen. Here’s what we’re after:
   

  

* Experience in designing, developing, and maintaining scalable data pipelines, infrastructure, and tools
* Professional experience with tools like Python, Snowflake, Airflow, DBT, Tableau, ELT/ETL, BigQuery, Looker Studio, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, SQL
* A solid understanding of cloud environments; AWS / Google Cloud / Azure
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics (or similar)
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


**How to apply** 
 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Cloud Architect
description:
🌐 Azure/AWS Cloud Architect – Stockholm & Malmö
 



  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm / Malmö (Hybrid – minimum 3 days onsite, sometimes 5 depending on project phase)
 



  





**Language Requirements:** 
 Swedish & English (fluency required)
 



  





**Citizenship:** 
 Swedish citizens only (single citizenship, due to security clearance requirements with certain clients)
 



  





**About the Company** 




  





 Join one of Europe’s most established and trusted IT consultancies, with 50,000 employees across 30 countries and 600 colleagues in Sweden. With a strong financial foundation, consistent project pipeline, and a reputation for delivering on critical digital transformation initiatives in
 **government, telecom, defence, healthcare, and energy** 
 , this is an opportunity to build your career within socially impactful projects that shape the future of Sweden.
 



  





 You’ll be part of a team of 20+ cloud specialists (majority in Stockholm, with presence in Malmö), working with industry leaders like
 **Telia, Vattenfall, and Region Stockholm** 
 on complex and high-visibility assignments.
 



  





**The Role - Cloud Architect** 




  





 As a
 **hands-on Cloud Architect** 
 , you will translate business needs into scalable, secure, and cost-efficient cloud solutions across Azure and AWS. You’ll be both technical and advisory, acting as a trusted expert for clients while collaborating closely with developers, project managers, and stakeholders.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* **Architecture & Design:** 
 Define and implement secure, scalable, and cost-optimized architectures using frameworks like CAF, WAF, and Security Reference Architecture.
* **Infrastructure as Code:** 
 Build and manage solutions with Terraform, Bicep, ARM, CloudFormation, and CDK.
* **Automation & Optimization:** 
 Drive automation of workflows, deployments, and operations with Azure DevOps, AWS CodePipeline, GitHub Actions, or Jenkins.
* **Advisory & Collaboration:** 
 Partner with clients as a trusted advisor, supporting them through their cloud adoption journeys.
* **Security & Governance:** 
 Apply best practices in security, compliance, and governance across enterprise environments.
* **DevOps & Scripting:** 
 Contribute to CI/CD and automation initiatives using PowerShell, Bash, or Python.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




  




* 7+ years’ experience in cloud solution design and implementation (Azure and/or AWS).
* Proven ability to translate business needs into technical architecture with focus on
 **security, scalability, cost-efficiency, and performance** 
 .
* Practical knowledge of cloud adoption frameworks (Microsoft CAF, AWS WAF, Security Reference Architecture).
* Experience with
 **CI/CD tools** 
 (Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, CodePipeline).
* Container knowledge (Docker, Kubernetes) – a strong plus.
* Consultancy background and pre-sales experience – meritorious.
* Relevant certifications (Azure Solutions Architect Expert, AWS Solutions Architect Professional, etc.) – essential.
* **Swedish fluency and Swedish citizenship** 
 .



  





**What’s in it for You?** 




  





 ✔ A financially stable, global consultancy with
 **long-term career development** 
 opportunities
 



 ✔ Access to
 **socially critical projects** 
 that make a difference in Sweden
 



 ✔ Work with the
 **latest cloud technologies** 
 in large-scale enterprise environments
 



 ✔ Competitive package:
 


* **6 weeks vacation**
* **Wellness allowance**
* **ITP pension**
* **Hybrid working model (min. 3 days onsite)**
* Collective agreement & full office equipment



  





 Why Apply?
 



  





 This is a unique opportunity to join a
 **well-known, respected consultancy brand** 
 with the scale, stability, and client trust to secure projects in
 **defence, government, and critical infrastructure** 
 . You’ll not only architect solutions but also see the real impact of your work on Sweden’s digital transformation.
 



  





 👉 Apply today and become part of a
 **team of cloud experts driving innovation in critical sectors across Sweden** 
 .

title: Senior Solutions Consultant - Supply Chain
description:
At Anaplan, we are a team of innovators focused on optimizing business decision-making through our leading AI-infused scenario planning and analysis platform so our customers can outpace their competition and the market.
   

  

 What unites Anaplanners across teams and geographies is our collective commitment to our customers’ success and to our Winning Culture.
   

  

 Our customers rank among the who’s who in the Fortune 50. Coca-Cola, LinkedIn, Adobe, LVMH and Bayer are just a few of the 2,400+ global companies who rely on our best-in-class platform.
   

  

 Our Winning Culture is the engine that drives our teams of innovators. We champion diversity of thought and ideas, we behave like leaders regardless of title, we are committed to achieving ambitious goals, and we love celebrating our wins – big and small.
   

  

 Supported by operating principles of being strategy-led, values-based and disciplined in execution, you’ll be inspired, connected, developed and rewarded here. Everything that makes you unique is welcome; join us and let’s build what’s next - together!
   

  

 We are seeking a dynamic
 **Presales** 
**Supply Chain Solutions Consultant** 
 with experience in the manufacturing or retail sectors. In this role, you will leverage Anaplan's platform to design and present tailored supply chain solutions, addressing the unique challenges of major enterprise customers.
   

  

**Your Impact**
* Client Engagement: Collaborate with large enterprise prospects to identify inefficiencies in their supply chain processes. Demonstrate how Anaplan's solutions can effectively address these challenges, driving significant improvements.
* Solution Development: Design and deliver customized, domain-specific demonstrations and proof-of-concept models that directly address client pain points.
* Technical Expertise: Utilize your deep understanding of supply chain processes to showcase the capabilities of Anaplan's platform, ensuring alignment with client needs and business objectives.
* Collaboration: Work closely with sales, product development, and implementation teams to ensure seamless integration of proposed solutions into clients' operations.
* Thought Leadership: Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices to provide innovative solutions and maintain a competitive edge in the market.


**Your Qualifications**
* Experience: Pre-sales experience in supply chain management within the manufacturing or retail industries. Prior experience with enterprise planning management (EPM) or business process management (BPM) solutions is advantageous.
* Technical Proficiency: Strong understanding of supply chain processes, including demand planning, supply planning, inventory management, and production planning. Experience with multi-dimensional modeling, business intelligence, or analytics is a plus.
* Communication Skills: Exceptional presentation and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Problem-Solving Ability: Proven track record of analyzing complex client problems and developing tailored solutions that drive business value.
* Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, quickly learn new technologies, and adapt to changing client needs.
* Travel Requirement: Willingness and ability to travel approximately 50% of the time within the EMEA region to engage with clients and support sales activities.


**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging (DEIB)**
 We believe attracting and retaining the best talent and fostering an inclusive culture strengthens our business. DEIB improves our workforce, enhances trust with our partners and customers, and drives business success. Build your career in a place where diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging aren’t just words on paper – this is what drives our innovation, it’s how we connect, and it contributes to what makes us a market leader. We believe in a hiring and working environment where all people are respected and valued, regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes people unique. We hire you for who you are, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work every day!
   

  

 We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive equitable benefits and all privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
   

  

**Fraud Recruitment Disclaimer** 
  

  

 It has come to our attention that fraudulent and fictitious job opportunities are being circulated on the Internet. Prospective candidates are being contacted by certain individuals, mainly through telephone calls, emails and correspondence, claiming they are representatives of Anaplan. The main purpose of these correspondences and announcements is to obtain privileged information from individuals.
   

  

 Anaplan does not:
   

  

* Extend offers to candidates without an extensive interview process with a member of our recruitment team and a hiring manager via video or in person.
* Send job offers via email. All offers are first extended verbally by a member of our internal recruitment team whenever possible and then followed up via written communication.


 All emails from Anaplan would come from an @anaplan.com email address. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of an email, letter or telephone communication purportedly from, for, or on behalf of Anaplan, please send an email to people@anaplan.com before taking any further action in relation to the correspondence.

title: Business Development Intern
description:
EviGrow Software is a lifetime investor acquiring and developing European vertical market software companies. We believe in preserving the unique cultures and values that entrepreneurs have built, while providing the resources and network to further accelerate growth.
 



  





 We are now seeking a university student in the final stages of their degree or a recent graduate in engineering, business or a related field for a project-based assignment on an either part time basis for 3-4 months or full time for a shorter period.
 



  





**The role will involve:** 



* Complementing our data-driven processes with analysing and structuring data on markets and solutions
* Assessing the commercial potential and positioning of software companies across Europe



  





**What we value:** 



* Currently studying or have recently graduated in engineering, business, or related field with a strong business acumen
* Comfort operating in an entrepreneurial and fast-paced environment
* A proactive and initiative-taking “doer” who takes ownership and responsibility for the delivery
* Given the data- and AI-driven nature of our processes, we’re ideally seeking someone who understands data handling, processing, and how to leverage it effectively — ideally, but not mandatory, with the ability to script and automate tasks



  





**What we offer:** 




 ·      Great opportunity to work with a senior team and gain practical experience in how commercial- and financial insights guide investment decisions
 



  





**Practical details:** 




 ·      Location is Stockholm
 



 ·      We are conducting interviews on a rolling basis and therefore start date is as soon as possible
 



  





**Interested?** 




 Send your CV and short note on availability to Emil Hansson at emil@evigrowsoftware.com. For questions, feel free to call at +46 76 839 19 39.

title: Technical Solutions Manager
description:
At Upsales, we’re not just building software—we’re building a movement to radically transform how B2B companies drive growth. Our latest chapter? We're evolving into an AI-powered revenue engine, building tools that help CEOs and boards accelerate decision-making and scale faster.
   

  

 This is not your typical implementation role. You’ll sit at the intersection of
 **customers, developers, and third-party vendors** 
 —driving complex, high-impact projects that make or break our clients’ ability to scale with Upsales.
   

  

 Your mission?
 **Ensure every implementation and integration project is frictionless, efficient, and delivered with surgical precision** 
 . You’ll be the
 **technical** 
**quarterback** 
 —translating business needs into rock-solid solutions, leading cross-functional teams, and making sure our customers have exactly what they need to succeed.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Leading technical implementation and integration projects from start to finish, always managing multiple projects in parallel.
* Acting as the bridge between our consulting team, developers, and customers—translating business requirements into technical deliverables.
* Scoping solutions, setting timelines, and ensuring projects are delivered on time and to spec.
* Being the technical advisor to our customers—helping them design the right architecture using Upsales, our API, and third-party tools.
* Managing stakeholders internally and externally, including developers and other vendors.
* Continuously improving our project delivery playbooks and best practices.


 Who We're Looking For
   

  

* Sharp, independent, and experienced project manager with a proven track record
* At least 5-10 years of experience leading technical projects within IT, CRM, or SaaS
* Strong technical fluency; comfortable collaborating with developers and discussing APIs, architecture, and integrations
* Master’s degree in engineering, computer science, information systems, or equivalent
* Experienced in managing complex integrations involving third-party systems
* Strong communicator; skilled at managing both stakeholders and timelines
* Fluency in Swedish and English
* Deep understanding of Upsales (as a power user or through close collaboration)
* Business-focused mindset; driven by outcomes and value, not just technology


 Upsales is a bootstrapped company with big ambitions, known for our high-performing team, relentless curiosity, and a culture that challenges conventional thinking. From product to sales, we’re obsessed with creating real value for our customers and building software that actually moves the needle.

title: Construction & Facilities Lead
description:
**Job Description**
**WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US**
 As a Construction & Facilities (C&F) Lead within the Store Implementation Unit, you play a key role in shaping the future of our physical presence across the globe. Your mission is to drive strategic expansion while ensuring our store portfolio remains qualitative, sustainable, and cost-efficient, not only through new developments but also through the ongoing maintenance and care of existing store sites.
