title: Krav/Testare
description:
Krav/Testare – Agilt utvecklingsteam
  
Rollbeskrivning
  
Vi söker en konsult med kompetens inom kravhantering och test för ett uppdrag i ett agilt utvecklingsteam. Uppdraget innebär att bidra genom hela utvecklingskedjan – från kravställning och analys till implementation och test – med fokus på kvalitet och samarbete.
  
Arbetsuppgifter
  
Delta i kravanalys, testdesign och kvalitetssäkring genom hela utvecklingsprocessen.
  
Arbeta med digitalisering av fullmakter och lösningar för identitet, autentisering och auktorisering.
  
Genomföra tester av elektroniska underskrifter och relaterade system för myndigheter och kommuner.
  
Utföra testautomatisering, API-testning, tillgänglighetstester samt utforskande tester.
  
Samarbeta nära utvecklare och produktägare i ett agilt team med korta feedbackloopar.
  
  

Krav
  
Erfarenhet av testautomatisering i Cypress.
  
Erfarenhet av kodhantering och testarbete i DevOps-miljö med GitLab och pipelines.
  
Förmåga att utveckla testskript i Visual Studio Code.
  
Erfarenhet av API-testning.
  
Erfarenhet av tillgänglighetstester enligt WCAG.
  
Erfarenhet av manuella och utforskande tester.
  
  

Meriterande
  
Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt, gärna enligt SAFe.
  
Kunskap om verktygen Jira och Confluence.
  
Erfarenhet av GitLab, Visual Studio Code och Cypress.
  
Erfarenhet av Insomnia för API-testning.
  
Erfarenhet av Figma eller Balsamiq för gränssnittsarbete.
  
  

**Start:** 2026-01-01
  
**Längd:** Till 2026-12-31
  
**Plats:** Sundsvall (hybrid eller enligt överenskommelse)
  
Om Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med både etablerade teknikbolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda attraktiva karriärmöjligheter för dig som vill utvecklas inom digitalisering och IT. Genom vår djupa tekniska kompetens och vårt omfattande nätverk matchar vi rätt konsult med rätt uppdrag – snabbt och träffsäkert. Hos oss får du personlig rådgivning, kontinuerlig återkoppling och möjlighet att ta nästa steg i din karriär.

title: Teknisk generalist inom säker kommunikation
description:
Vi driver utvecklingen av nästa generations hållbara informationssamhälle Ida Infront är ett väletablerat företag som verkar inom offentlig sektor i Norden. Med produkter baserade på iipax erbjuder vi nutidens och nästa generations digitala lösningar inom säkert informationsutbyte, effektiv ärendehantering och hållbar e-arkivering till samhället. Ida Infront grundades 1984 och har i dag ca 140 medarbetare i Linköping, Stockholm och Mumbai. Företaget är en del av Addnode Group vars aktie är noterad på Nasdaq Stockholm
Vill du arbeta med samhällsviktiga system där din tekniska expertis gör verklig skillnad? Hos oss på Ida Infront får du möjlighet att utveckla tekniska lösningar i ett stabilt och innovativt företag.



Nu söker vi en teknisk generalist som drivs av att arbeta med komplexa system och att leverera värde till våra kunder.



Vi söker dig som har bred teknisk kompetens och erfarenhet av både utveckling och system- och nätverksdrift. Du har kunskap och intresse för att bland annat, konfigurera och optimera applikationsservrar, automatisera bygg- och deployprocesser, samt utveckla och driftsätta skalbara Java-lösningar. Du trivs i en roll där du får kombinera systemadministration, skriptning, utveckling, testning och automatisering i vårt tvärfunktionella team som jobbar med vår produkt iipax com. Våra kunder är i huvudsak Sveriges offentliga sektor samt bank- och försäkringsbranchen.


### **Om rollen**



Som systemutvecklare hos oss kommer du att:


* Arbeta med konfiguration och optimering av applikationsservrar (t.ex. Tomcat, Wildfly, JBoss) för att säkerställa prestanda, säkerhet och driftsäkerhet.
* Skriva och underhålla gradlescript för att automatisera bygg- och deployprocesser samt effektivisera hanteringen av beroenden och miljöinställningar.
* Delta i vår resa att utveckla skalbara lösningar baserade på mikrotjänster och containerteknik (t.ex. Kubernetes, Docker).
* Delta i design och implementation av robusta och säkra integrationslösningar, med meddelandeköer och säkra protokoll (t.ex. Active MQ, SSEK,SHS,eDelivery).
* Säkerställa att våra system är skalbara, driftsäkra och enkla att underhålla, genom god dokumentation och automatiserade tester.
* Samarbeta i ett agilt och tvärfunktionellt team där du är med från krav till leverans.


Vi söker dig som har:


* Erfarenhet av konfiguration och administration av applikationsservrar (t.ex. Tomcat, Wildfly, JBoss).
* Goda kunskaper i gradlescript och automatisering av bygg- och deployprocesser.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga och underhålla skalbara system i molnmiljöer.
* Vana av att arbeta med CI/CD, containerteknik och moderna utvecklingsverktyg.
* Erfarenhet av Java.
* Intresse för och erfarenhet av DevOps-principer och automatisering.
* Högskole- eller universitetsexamen inom relevant område, eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Svenskt medborgarskap (krav för säkerhetsklassade projekt).

### **Personliga egenskaper**



Du är lösningsorienterad, kommunikativ och trivs med att samarbeta i team. Du har ett stort intresse för teknik, gillar att automatisera, utveckla och förbättra, med en god förmåga att driva arbetet framåt.


### **Vi erbjuder**


* Möjlighet att arbeta med samhällsviktiga och tekniskt utmanande projekt.
* Flexibla arbetsformer och stort eget ansvar.
* Kompetensutveckling och stöd för certifieringar.
* En inkluderande och värderingsstyrd arbetsplats med stark laganda.

### **Ansökan**



Ida Infront anser att mångfald berikar verksamheten och välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund, kön, erfarenhet samt personliga egenskaper.



Urvalet sker löpande så vänta inte med din ansökan.



Vid frågor om jobbet eller oss, kontakta Pernilla Wigert, mail: pernilla.wigert@idainfront.se



Ansök idag och bli en nyckelperson i vårt team där vi tillsammans utvecklar, konfigurerar och automatiserar robusta och skalbara Java-lösningar!

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**

  

* Advocate for and implement security best practices within ALM platforms and tooling.
* Facilitate cross-team collaboration for optimal security solutions.
* Develop, document, and standardise secure infrastructure and software protocols.
* Stay up-to-date with advancements in relevant technologies.
* Coach and guide the team and work with our Product Owners to prioritise backlogs.
* Identify improvement needs in internal working methods and tools and evaluate new ones for effective IT development.
* Operationally support business development teams using development platforms and CI/CD pipelines.
* On-board and train new users and offer support with customisation and configuration of existing tools.

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**

  

* Minimum five years of relevant work experience, ideally focusing on ALM.
* Academic degree in system development or equivalent.
* Previous experience in coaching and leading technical teams.
* Good knowledge and experience in Microsoft products like TFS, AzureDevOps, AWS Azure or similar.
* Good understanding of DevOps principles and a lean-agile mindset.
* Fluency in English; Swedish is a plus.
* Exceptional organisational and time-management skills.
* Exemplary attention to detail.
* Ability to work harmoniously in a team as well as independently.
* A proactive attitude and resilience to tackle complex challenges


**Technical Skills**

* Azure DevOps, CI-CD
* Docker, Kubernetes

Azure Cloud Sonartype lifecycle  
* 

  

  

  

**Application deadline:** 12-10-2025  


  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Scrum Master
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Jobbeskrivning**  

* Leda och vidareutveckla ett etablerat agilt team.
* Facilitering av agila ceremonier och sprintar enligt SAFe.
* Säkerställa att teamet följer våra processer för test, release och dokumentation.
* Skapa goda förutsättningar för samarbete i ett distribuerat och mångkulturellt team.
* Kommunicera tydligt och inkluderande, både muntligt och skriftligt.
* Vara uppmärksam på kulturella nyanser i kommunikation, beslutsfattande och samarbete.
* Driva teamets utveckling och kontinuerliga förbättringsarbeten.

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande yrkeserfarenhet.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet som Scrum Master eller agil coach.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet från bank, finans eller annan reglerad verksamhet.
* Djup kunskap om agila ramverk såsom Scrum, SAFe.
* Förmåga att hantera flera team och komplexa beroenden.
* Vana att arbeta med verktyg som Azure DevOps (ADO), Microsoft Teams och SharePoint.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 17-10-2025 **Om Oss**  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Security Engineer
description:
### ***Are you looking for a meaningful role?***


Doconomy is a market leader in impact technology, dedicated to driving global climate action by equipping banks with financial tools that both educate and foster positive change.


Our tools are steeped in behavioral science and backed by best-in-class data and third-party audited methodologies. That validity and reliability are key to ensuring that our tools and the insights and recommendations they provide are trusted, adopted, and crucially drive tangible, measurable change.


We serve over 90 clients across 30 different markets and have established key partnerships with renowned organizations, including the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), Mastercard, Boston Consulting Group, S&P Trucost, and the World Wildlife Fund (WWF). Doconomy is backed by leading investors, including UBS Next, S&P Global, Mastercard, CommerzVentures, Ingka Group, Citi Ventures, and ABN Amro Ventures.


Our team includes former bankers, engineers, developers, designers, brand strategists, ESG experts, behavioral science experts, and thought leaders in innovative business and service design. We bring expertise and wisdom from some of the world’s largest digital and sustainable banks, corporations, and fintechs, and our dedicated Impact team keeps us best-in-class and at the forefront of our industry.


Our team comprises former bankers, engineers, developers, designers, brand strategists, ESG experts, behavioral scientists, and innovative leaders. Drawing from the expertise of some of the world's largest digital and sustainable banks, our dedicated team ensures that we remain at the top of our industry.

### ***Join us!***


We are looking for a **Security Engineer** to strengthen the security of our systems, networks, applications, and cloud infrastructure.
  

  

This hands-on role focuses on **vulnerability management**, secure software practices, and continuous monitoring, ensuring our systems remain resilient and compliant with **SOC 2 Type 2** standards.

### ***What you’ll do***

***Vulnerability Management***

* Conduct regular scans to identify and document vulnerabilities in software, hardware, and network components.
* Develop a prioritized remediation plan based on severity and impact.
* Implement patch management and configuration changes to mitigate risks.
* Provide documentation and reports to support SOC 2 Type 2 compliance.

***SDLC Security***

* Integrate security practices into the Software Development Life Cycle.
* Adopt secure coding standards and perform code reviews.
* Implement automated security testing *(static and dynamic analysis).*
* Facilitate training and awareness programs for development teams.

***Intrusion Detection and Response***

* Implement and maintain an Intrusion Detection System *(IDS)*.
* Develop and execute an incident response plan.
* Conduct regular drills and provide training for incident response readiness.
* Monitor and report on detected threats to ensure an effective response.

***Continuous Monitoring and Validation***

* Perform ongoing validation of security controls and internal audits.
* Establish continuous monitoring processes and alerting mechanisms.
* Maintain documentation to demonstrate a robust and consistent security posture.

***Tools***

* Vanta, Wazuh, Kandji, GitHub, NextDNS, Black Kite

### ***What you’ll bring to the Team***

* Hands-on experience in cybersecurity, with focus on vulnerability management, SDLC security, and infrastructure/DevOps security.
* Experience with cloud deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and container/orchestration security.
* Strong knowledge of SOC 2 Type 2 compliance requirements.
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills to explain security issues to technical and non-technical teams.
* Ability to work independently in a distributed team environment.

### ***Preferred Qualifications***

* Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or similar.
* Familiarity with SOC 2 Type 2 compliance and security auditing.
* Experience with intrusion detection systems, incident response planning, and continuous security monitoring.
* Experience in secure cloud architecture, IaC security, and DevSecOps practices.
* Experience with both frontend and backend development stacks.

### 

### ***What we offer***

* **Balance & Employment Flexibility**: This role can be structured as a **consultancy within Europe** (±2 hour CET), allowing you to work remotely with occasional travel to our Stockholm office for team-building activities, workshops, or project-specific tasks. Alternatively, if you are based in Stockholm, you can join as a **Sweden-based employee** with a hybrid setup, spending part of your week in our A-house Ark office, Östermalm, and part working remotely. Please note that we do not provide relocation support or visa sponsorship.
* **Team:** Join a diverse, international team working in cross-functional groups.
* **Tools:** Stay connected and manage projects efficiently using collaborative platforms like **Slack**, Miro, and **Google Workspace.** We will set you up with the latest **Apple** devices and equipment to support your best performance.
  

*Additional benefits such as health and life insurance, pension, wellness allowance, and PTO are available depending on employment set-up, and will be discussed during the hiring process.*

  

We have an ongoing recruitment process; if this role is online, it means it’s still open!

title: DevOps Engineer for Automotive Industry
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
**Are you a senior DevOps Engineer eager to drive innovation in the automotive software industry?** 




  





 Join us at
 **ALTEN in Stockholm** 
 , where you will work with cutting-edge technologies to shape a sustainable future alongside world-leading automotive companies.
 



 As a DevOps Engineer on our team, you will play a key role in designing, automating, and maintaining infrastructure and deployment pipelines using
 **Python** 
 ,
 **Terraform** 
 , and
 **Ansible** 
 . You'll manage and optimize
 **CI/CD workflows** 
 with
 **Jenkins** 
 , and support both development and operations within a microservices-based architecture.
 



 Your responsibilities will also include working extensively with
 **AWS services** 
 such as
 **S3** 
 ,
 **Lambda** 
 ,
 **RDS** 
 , and
 **EC2** 
 , ensuring scalable, secure, and resilient cloud infrastructure. Additionally, you'll leverage
 **Docker** 
 and
 **Kubernetes** 
 for containerization and orchestration, enabling fast, reliable, and automated deployments.
 



  





**Who we are looking for** 




 To be a good match for the role we see that you hold at least 3 years of experience in DevOps. Besides being passionate about DevOps, we think you are communicative, responsive, and collaborative. We also think our new colleague should have experience with:
 



 • Python
 



 • GoLang or Bash
 



 • AWS
 



 • CI/CD
 



 • Docker or Kubernetes
 



 • Git or Jenkins
 



  





*Meritorious if you have:* 




 • Work experience in agile environments.
 



 • Swedish language skills.
 



  





**About ALTEN** 




 ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies with over 57,000 employees in nearly 30 countries. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of the most prestigious companies in all sectors, such as Automotive, Defense, Energy & Environment, Industry, Public services & Government and Life Sciences. In Sweden, we are about 1300 committed employees with 9 offices in 9 cities - from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north. For the fifth year in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden's most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities. Every employee is equally valuable in the success of ALTEN! We meet future challenges by supporting our clients’ projects and enabling our people to reach their full potential. We do so by offering technological challenges, fulfilling opportunities, inspiring togetherness and the possibility to contribute to a sustainable future.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Azure
* Jenkins / Jenkins X
* Gitlab
* Artifactory
* Ansible
* CI /CD
* Containers


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 24-10-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Engineering Manager - Platform
description:
**Title:** 
 Engineering Manager
 



**Reports to:** 
 Engineering Director
 



**Entity:** 
 MSIM SWEDEN
 



**Group:** 
 D&S
 **Capability:** 
 Engineering
 



**Level:** 
 Manager (M4)
 



**Work Arrangement:** 
 Hybrid
 



  





**Company Overview** 




 Metrea delivers effects-as-a-service to national security partners across five domains and more than a dozen mission areas—including airborne ISR, electronic warfare, secure communications, aerial refueling, special mission aviation, aerial firefighting, and advanced simulation. Wherever we operate, we build vertically integrated full stacks of capability—designing, building, and operating turnkey solutions that let customers scale capacity while benefiting from continuous cycles of innovation. With operators and engineers under one roof, we close the gap between lab and field—what we call connecting design with effect. Metrea’s solutions are built for elegance: effective, efficient, and evolving. This approach enables our partners to do more with less and achieve outsized, asymmetric advantage against rapidly evolving threats.
 



  





 Headquartered in Washington, DC, Metrea has facilities across the United States, the United Kingdom, Europe, and beyond.
 



  





**Group Overview** 




 The Digital and Synthetic Capability Unit (D&S) is committed to providing mission-driven information solutions that seamlessly bridge the digital and physical realms. Leveraging cutting-edge technologies and advanced platforms, we empower operational readiness and elevate situational awareness across diverse domains—including air, maritime, and space.
 



  





**Position Summary** 




 We are looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to provide leadership for our flight simulation product as part of a Product-led cross-functional team. This role will lead and support our Platform teams that are responsible for building and running the infrastructure and pipelines. Candidates should have solid knowledge and experience of best practices across the software development lifecycle, as well as excellent People Management skills; they can be relied upon to build and maintain an engineering culture which is sustainably professional and positive, in which high-performing engineers can grow and thrive.
 



  





 Metrea is a people-first organisation and candidates should have strong communication skills and the desire to proactively elevate their team through continuous knowledge sharing, collaboration, feedback, and mentorship.
 



  





**Role and Responsibilities** 



* Mentoring, coaching and leading a team of highly talented engineers, taking responsibility for both their career and personal development.
* Conducting regular catch-ups and check-ins with the team to help to support their day-to-day engineering activities.
* Supporting product management and the technical leadership in refining requirements and shaping the deliverables the team will work.
* Helping to align team efforts with the broader strategic goals of the organisation, helping to plan for future resource requirements and technology adoption.
* Developing and maintaining a deep relationship with the team’s Tech Lead and Product Manager to ensure alignment and support delivery.
* Collaborate with other Engineering Leaders, across the business, to improve engineering processes, code quality, release management and documentation.
* Supporting the recruitment process and taking responsibility for onboarding and integrating new teammates.



  





**Skills and Experience** 



1. Experience leading teams in fast-growing companies where you play a part in shaping ways of working rather than follow pre-defined ones.
2. Experience working with gaming engines, preferably Unreal Engine
3. Understanding of the DevOps field
4. Experience in engineering management having previously mentored and helped to develop the careers of software engineers
5. Experience in employing agile methodologies in software development processes whilst working in a matrix organisation to help support the team establish and develop their ways of working.
6. A deep passion for personal development with a drive to be constantly learning and furthering your professional knowledge.
7. Strong organisational skills with an ability to work independently whilst planning, prioritising and managing your workload.
8. Great interpersonal skills, a servant-leadership mindset and the ability to confidently communicate with others, conveying technical content clearly and articulately to non-technical team members.



  





**Our Culture** 




 Metrea’s single core value, “rooted in humility,” is supported by four key attributes: entrepreneurial, systematic, discerning, and over-deliver. These attributes, combined, form our Teammate Firmware, our culture. We explore these attributes during the hiring process when we grow our teams and continually support the growth of our culture. We are a hyper-collaborative, dynamically hierarchical organization united by a passion for what we do, how we do it, who we do it with, and who we do it for.
 



  





**Benefits** 




 Friskvård of 5K annually
 



 Personal development budget (2K for books, courses, subscriptions etc)
 



 Parental leave
 



 5% occupational pension (swe. tjänstepension),
 



 30 days of leave
 



 Discretionary Bonus
 



  





**Work Authorization / Security Clearance** 




 Employee must be an EU citizen
 



  





**Equal Opportunities Statement** 




 (Metrea is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or other characteristics protected by law.
 



  





**Position Type and Expected Hours of Work** 




 This is a full-time non-exempt position with typical working hours of. Monday through Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Hours and work shifts may
 



 change in accordance with department and business needs. Exempt
 



 Employees must have the ability to be on-call and available, as business
 



 needs require. Non-Exempt employees may be required to work over 40
 



 hours per week with approval from the department manager
 



  





**Work Location** 




 Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





**Work Environment** 




 This job operates in an office setting
 



  





**Travel** 




 This role may require occasional travel to other Metrea offices.

title: Operations & Platform Engineer
description:
**Job ID: 30101**
 We’re seeking an Operations & Platform Engineer to help manage and enhance key business-critical platforms and services. This role is hands-on and cross-functional, centred on delivering reliable, secure, and user-centric solutions while continuously improving operational processes through automation and best practices. If you thrive in an environment where operational excellence, service quality, performance, and user satisfaction are essential, we want to hear from you.
   

  

 Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We're not just a bank, we're a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 You’ll join a collaborative team responsible for maintaining and evolving enterprise platforms that support day-to-day business operations on existing services as well as working in close cooperation with projects and strategic initiatives. We partner with infrastructure, security, service desk, and product teams to ensure systems are stable, compliant, and easy to use. The focus is on driving service quality, operational efficiency, and positive user experiences on collaboration and real-time communication. The team is service provider for collaboration and communication services on Microsoft Teams, Customer Online Meetings, Compliance Recording, Connectivity with Telco operators and Video rooms. Making sure our services are compliant and follow set standards we cover security & risk, service roadmaps, service resiliency and operations.
   

  

**Main responsibilities in this role:**
* Service Operations & Reliability: Manage services throughout their lifecycle, deployment, monitoring, updates, and support with a focus on performance, availability, and user impact.
* Platform Deployment & Change Management: Coordinate and execute rollouts of new features and platform updates. Ensure deployments are smooth, secure, and minimally disruptive.
* Monitoring & Incident Response: Spearhead incident resolution and root cause analysis, driving continuous service improvement and operational excellence.
* Security & Compliance Operations: Help ensure operational practices and services align with relevant compliance, audit, and security standards.
* Knowledge Sharing & Documentation: Keep operational documentation up to date and clear. Provide knowledge transfer to support and operational teams as needed.


**What you'll be doing:**
* Monitoring service health and optimizing operational performance.
* Supporting secure and smooth introduction of new capabilities and updates.
* Collaborating with internal teams to align operations with business needs.
* Automating to reduce manual work and improve efficiency.
* Troubleshooting and root cause analysis
* Helping ensure services are intuitive and reliable for end users.
* Delivering clear documentation and support resources for ongoing operations.


**Who You Are**
 This is the right role for you if: You’re a proactive engineer who takes ownership and keeps the user experience top of mind. You enjoy solving complex operational challenges and work well across technical and business teams. You value collaboration, clarity, and continuous improvement in everything you do.
   

  

**Your background and skills include:**
* Take end-to-end responsibility for platform stability and usability.
* Seek to automate and streamline operational tasks.
* Understand how compliance and security shape operational workflows.
* Communicate effectively with both technical teams and business stakeholders.
* Prioritize service reliability and a seamless user experience.


**It would be ideal if you also:**
* 5+ years in IT operations, DevOps, platform engineering, or similar roles.
* Hands-on experience with cloud infrastructure (preferably Azure or equivalent).
* Knowledge with products like Microsoft 365, Azure, AudioCodes, Pexip, Verint and Intelligent Voice would be beneficial
* Proficiency with automation tools and scripting (e.g., PowerShell).
* Familiarity with monitoring and alerting platforms.
* Understanding of operational security and compliance best practices.
* Strong written and spoken communication skills.


**What We Offer**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

 People are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

**A culture** 
 that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application no later than 10/11/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Goran Djokic at goran.djokic@nordea.com.
   

  

**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.**
**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
   

  

**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
   

  

**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
   

  

**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
   

  

 Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Finland:** 
 A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
   

  

 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
   

  

 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
   

  

 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Cloud Consultant Azure
description:
**Gå** 
**med i vårt Cloud-team – Flera möjligheter tillgängliga!** 




  





 Är du passionerad kring molntransformation och redo att driva innovation för Orange Business kunder? Vi går nu in i en spännande tillväxtfas med stora ambitioner för vårt Public Cloud Delivery-team. Det här är din chans att bli en del av oss, bidra till att forma vår framtid och vara med på vår resa – vi söker talangfulla medarbetare på alla nivåer!
 



  





  





**Din roll kan innebära att du:** 




  





 ✅ Designar och implementerar skalbara molnlösningar på ledande plattformar
 



 ✅ Bidrar i molnmigrationsprojekt och transformationsinitiativ
 



 ✅ Bygger ramverk för governance och landningszoner
 



 ✅ Deltar i pre-sales och kundworkshops
 



 ✅ Översätter verksamhetskrav till tekniska lösningar
 



  





  





**Vi** 
**söker dig som har:** 




  




* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av arkitektur och implementation i Azure
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med moderna verktyg och ramverk för mjukvaruleverans (CI/CD, DevOps, GitOps, Git, agila metoder)
* Erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Bicep m.fl.)
* Kännedom om Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF) och Well architected framework (WAF)
* Erfarenhet av molnsäkerhet och nätverk
* Flytande kommunikationsförmåga på både svenska och engelska (tal och skrift)



  





**Meriterande** 
 :
 



  




* Kunskap inom Docker, Kubernetes (AKS)
* Erfarenhet av kostnadsoptimering
* Erfarenhet av Azure Integration Services & serverless-teknologier (Logic App, Function, App Services, Service Bus)



  





  





**Vår teamkultur** 




  





 Om du tycker om att arbeta med ny teknik och hålla din kunskap uppdaterad kommer du passa bra hos oss. Vi arbetar i agila team med en no-blame-kultur där vi uppmuntrar innovation och ger våra medarbetare autonomi att fatta beslut. För oss är det viktigt att ständigt förbättras, arbeta proaktivt och automatisera snarare än att repetera uppgifter.
 



  





 Är du nyfiken på att utvecklas? Vi ser till att våra team alltid ligger steget före genom att ge tid för certifieringar, delta i eller titta på webbinarier, labba självständigt eller helt enkelt diskutera idéer med kollegor.
 



  





  





**Varför ska du välja oss?** 




  




* Flexibelt arbetssätt – hybridlösning med modernt och samarbetsinriktat kontor i Stockholm
* Kontinuerliga lärandemöjligheter och certifieringar
* Vi är en människoorienterad organisation och stolta över vår Great Place to Work-certifiering
* En kultur utan skuldbeläggning – du får frihet att innovera
* Möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste molnteknologin
* Ett community av experter – som Digital Natives sätter vi innovation i centrum för vår kompetens
* Läs mer om våra förmåner
 
 här.



  





  





**Om Orange Business:** 




  





 Orange Business är ett ledande nätverks- och digitalintegratörsföretag med kontor i 65 länder världen över och en del av Orange-koncernen.
 



  





 Digital Services, en affärsenhet inom Orange Business, är en nybildad division inom Orange Business. I Europa består affärsområdet av cirka 1500 medarbetare fördelade över 10 länder. Vi är digitala natives med innovation i centrum för vår verksamhet, vilket gör oss till en pålitlig partner nära våra kunder. Vårt gemensamma uppdrag är att hjälpa dem att förnya, driva och leda sin digitala transformation och sina affärsstrategier inom viktiga digitala områden, inklusive Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace samt Data & AI. Som en agil och snabbfotad digital affärspartner erbjuder affärsenheten pålitliga end-to-end-lösningar och produkter som hjälper företag i en rad olika branscher, både inom privat och offentlig sektor, att transformera sin verksamhet, förbättra kundupplevelsen och driva tillväxt.
 



  





 Med vår digitala expertis är vi en strategisk partner till Orange Business mål att vara en ledande nätverks- och digitalintegratör, med vårt team som en viktig tillväxtmotor.
 



  





  





**Rekryteringsprocessen:** 




  





 Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande och strävar efter att hålla intervjuer och samtal allt eftersom vi får in dem.
 



  





 Är du intresserad men känner att du inte uppfyller alla kriterier till 100 %? Vi uppmuntrar dig att söka ändå! Vi tror på styrkan i mångsidiga kompetenser, perspektiv och individers unika kvaliteter. Vi vill att alla ska känna sig fria att vara sig själva – dina unika förmågor kan passa perfekt för vårt team! Din perfekta match kanske är nästa tjänst vi annonserar, så varför inte ligga steget före och söka redan nu?
 



  





 Är du intresserad av att läsa mer om Orange Business? Besök vår
 
 hemsida
 
 eller följ oss på
 
 LinkedIn.

title: Infrastructure Engineer - Linux
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Förvalta och vidareutveckla vår Linux-miljö
* Arbeta med virtualisering (VMware), nätverk och lagring
* Samarbeta tätt med kollegor inom IT-säkerhet, utveckling och support


 Att jobba som Infrastructure Engineer - Linux
   

  

 Vi söker nu en Infrastructure Engineer med fokus på Linux som vill vara med och bygga vidare på vår tekniska plattform och bidra till att leverera Sveriges bästa bolåneupplevelse. Hos oss får du arbeta i ett snabbfotat tech-team där innovation, säkerhet och automatisering står i centrum.
   

  

 Som Infrastructure Engineer - Linux blir du en nyckelperson i vårt Tech Operations-team som brinner för teknik, samarbete och ständig förbättring.
   

  

 Du kommer att:
   

  

* Delta i drift och utveckling av vår Kubernetesplattform
* Automatisera med Ansible, Pipelines och scriptning (t.ex. Bash, Python)
* Bidra till ständig förbättring av våra system och processer


 Vi söker dig som är en passionerad Linux-entusiast med bred teknisk kompetens och ett stort engagemang för ditt arbete. Du har gedigen erfarenhet av Linux och OS-nära tjänster, och du är van att arbeta i komplexa, säkra och högtilgängliga miljöer. Du har goda kunskaper i Ansible, scriptning samt versionshantering med Git. Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av Kubernetes och containerteknik. Som person är du ansvarstagande, självgående och prestigelös. Du tar initiativ, är lösningsorienterad och trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med andra. Du delar gärna med dig av din kunskap och bidrar till teamets gemensamma framgång.
   

  

 Vår arbetsplatsstrategi är en hybridlösning mellan att jobba hemma och arbeta från vårt ljusa och luftiga kontor i Solna Business Park med härlig atmosfär, där vi bland annat har gym, cykelparkering inomhus och det bästa: vår egen barista. Rollen kräver att du talar svenska.
   

  

 Har du check på allt?
   

  

* Ansvarstagande
* Bra på att prioritera
* Förändringsbenägen
* Kommunikativ
* Nyfiken


 Annars då?

title: Senior back-end engineer (GenAI experience)
description:
**Senior Back-end Engineer with GenAI experience** 




  





**About Arkus AI** 




 Arkus AI is on a mission to revolutionise medicine and healthcare through intelligent, AI-powered technologies. We are developing autonomous AI agents and a robust AI platform to support clinicians, researchers, and healthcare administrators in addressing some of the most complex challenges in medicine.
 



  





 We are looking for a highly motivated and outstanding
 **Senior Back-end Engineer with GenAI experience** 
 to help design and develop our AI agent platform. In this role, you will focus primarily on back-end systems and infrastructure while leveraging your understanding of generative AI (LLMs, agent frameworks) to enable cutting-edge healthcare applications.
 



  





**The Role** 




 We’re looking for a highly skilled
 **Senior Back-end Engineer with GenAI expertise** 
 to join our team. In this role, you’ll architect and scale the back-end systems that power our AI agent platform, working at the intersection of distributed systems, cloud infrastructure, and generative AI.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Design, build, and maintain the back-end infrastructure of our AI agent platform
* Develop RESTful APIs, orchestration logic, and integrations with third-party systems
* Work with SQL/NoSQL databases and implement event-driven, real-time architectures
* Collaborate with AI/ML engineers to integrate LLM-based capabilities (open-source and API-driven)
* Ensure security, compliance, scalability, and performance of production systems
* Implement observability, CI/CD pipelines, and containerized deployments (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Write robust unit and integration tests to ensure reliability
* Mentor junior engineers and contribute to technical best practices



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* 6+ years of professional experience in back-end or software engineering
* Strong expertise in Node.js/TypeScript and Python
* Proven experience designing APIs, working with SQL/NoSQL databases, and distributed systems
* Familiarity with LLMs and agent frameworks (LangChain, LangGraph, AutoGPT, Semantic Kernel)
* Hands-on experience with vector databases (FAISS, Pinecone, Weaviate) and retrieval pipelines
* Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure), containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and CI/CD
* Experience with observability tools (Grafana, Prometheus, ELK, etc.)
* Bonus: background in healthcare systems (FHIR, EHRs) or regulated environments (HIPAA/GDPR)
* Strong communicator with architectural vision and mentoring ability



  





**Why Join Us?** 



* Shape the future of
 **AI agent platforms in healthcare**
* Solve complex, real-world back-end challenges at the frontier of AI and system engineering
* Be part of a
 **mission-driven, fast-paced team** 
 with direct clinical impact
* Competitive salary, equity options, and flexible hybrid work environment



  





 If you’re passionate about building the infrastructure for AI systems that make a real difference in healthcare, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Data Engineer - OKQ8 Tech
description:
*Hela samhället ställer om mot en fossilfri framtid. Vi vill visa vägen i utvecklingen av vår bransch, så att fler kan ta sig fram, ta hand om sitt fordon och driva verksamheter med ett så lågt klimatavtryck som möjligt. Vill du vara med och bidra till hållbar utveckling, på riktigt? Välkommen att följa med på vår resa!*
 Som Data Engineer hos OKQ8 kommer du att ingå i ett nytt team som kommer att jobba med vår dataplattform. Ambitionen är att skapa ett team på fyra personer med både juniora och seniora profiler. Teamet kommer arbeta tätt tillsammans med vår dataarkitekt samt Business Intelligence teamet på. Du kommer ha en central roll i att tillgängliggöra och bistå i att omvandla vår data till praktiska insikter.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 OKQ8 har idag en diversifierad verksamhet med en stor mängd system som tillhandahåller data och transaktioner. BI, Data och Analytics inom bolaget bygger till största del på Microsofts komponenter såsom exempelvis Power BI, Fabric, Power Platform, Azure Synapse etc. Som Data Engineer kommer du att:
   

  

* Skapa automatiserade arbetsflöden och pipelines för att hämta, organisera och transformera data från olika källor
* Designa, utveckla och hantera skalbar och robust datainfrastruktur för att stödja analys- och data-projekt
* Data Governance, säkerställa datakvalitet, metadatahantering och dokumentation
* Säkerställa efterlevnad av myndighetskrav, datasäkerhet och branschstandarder
* Kontinuerligt övervaka och förbättra prestandan för våra dataplattformar och analyslösningar


 Vi tror att du är fokuserad, lösningsorienterad och analytisk. Du kan arbeta självgående och du brinner för ditt område och vill ha möjligheter att vidareutvecklas. Du tar eget ansvar för att hitta lösningar och driva ständiga förbättringar. Har du dessutom erfarenhet och intresse av statistik, Machine Learning och AI så är det meriterande.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har/är:**
* Högskoleexamen i datavetenskap, informationsteknologi eller ett närliggande område
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet som Data Engineer, Data Developer, Data Scientist eller liknande
* Utmärkt analytisk och problemlösningsförmåga
* Stark kommunikationsförmåga för att interagera med tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter
* Engagerad, kan prioritera och balansera mellan arbetsuppgifter samt hålla deadlines
* Ordningsam och strukturerad
* Goda kunskaper i Engelska samt gärna i Svenska eller Danska


**Meriterande kvalifikationer**
* Kunskaper kring Azure, Fabric, Profisee, Master Data Services
* God kunskap inom Power BI, Fabric, Power Platform, Azure Synapse
* God kunskap inom ordinarie MS 365-applikationer


 Vi uppmuntrar dig att ansöka även om du inte känner att du uppfyller alla ovan nämnda kvalifikationer. Det viktigaste är att du har ett starkt driv, engagerad, skärpt och vill vara med och bidra till hållbar utveckling på riktigt!
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Jörgen Forsman via
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Hos oss på OKQ8 får du arbeta i en flexibel miljö med viktiga och varierande arbetsuppgifter. Vi uppmuntrar samarbete, innovation och utveckling – och vi tror på att vi tillsammans gör varandra bättre. Här blir du en del av en familjär kultur där vi stöttar varandra, har roligt tillsammans och där du ges möjlighet att växa och göra skillnad. Vi vill vara ett företag som speglar samhället, med en inkluderande kultur som minskar utanförskap och främjar mångfald.
   

  

*I rekryteringsprocessen ingår både psykometriska tester och kompetensbaserade intervjuer, med syfte att främja en rättvis utvärdering för alla kandidater.*
 För den här tjänsten behöver du vara medborgare i ett EU/EES-land eller ha permanent uppehållstillstånd i Sverige.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!** 
 Om företaget
 **Ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb. På riktigt.**
 Vi vet att det är en vågad sak att säga, men vi menar verkligen varje ord. Oavsett om det handlar om ditt första jobb, ditt sista jobb, eller om du har modet att anta en ny utmaning, tror vi att du kan få ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb här hos oss. På riktigt.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Senior software engineer (backend) - 6 month project (potential extension) - Full time - Stockholm
 



  





 We’re looking for a seasoned backend engineer who thrives in technical ambiguity and working across the full engineering lifecycle, from solving complex API challenges, to seamless integrations with customer platforms.
 



  





 This isn’t your typical backend role. Yes, you'll write code but your real impact will come from untangling complexity, aligning teams, and driving technical clarity across multiple layers of the stack and organization.
 



  





 🚀 What You'll Do
 


* Lead technical initiatives end-to-end, from scoping to deployment
* Work hand-in-hand with product managers, external partners, and internal stakeholders
* Own integrations with a wide range of third-party APIs and hardware devices
* Navigate complex cloud infrastructure and distributed systems
* Bring structure and clarity to fast-moving, ambiguous environment



  





 This role is deeply backend-focused, but it touches systems-level thinking, infrastructure, and real-world connected devices - working on:
 



  




* API design and integration
* Distributed systems and cloud operations
* Automation and data pipelines
* Real-world, IoT-scale device integrations (think: solar panels, EV chargers, batteries — all speaking different languages)



  





 🛠 Our Stack - We're tech-agnostic when it makes sense, but here’s what you’ll mostly work with:
 


* Golang (must-have)
* AWS (our primary production cloud) – Lambda, RDS, IoT Core, and more
* GCP (mostly on the analytics and data side) – Cloud Run, BigQuery, Python
* MQTT and other protocols for IoT



  





  





 🧠 Who We're Looking For You’re a good fit if you:
 



  




* Have experience at the Staff, Principal, or very Senior Engineer level
* Have worked in
 
 startups or high-growth environments
* Are comfortable owning complex technical projects from idea to production
* Know how to collaborate across function, especially with product and external technical teams
* Love diving into murky, layered systems and driving towards clarity
* Bring a high level of technical ownership and curiosity



  





 A really exciting project and an opportunity to work with some top engineers in a fast-paced and energetic environment. The role is office-first, although there is flexibility as and when needed.
 



  





 Unfortunately unable to assist with visa sponsorship or relocation at this point.

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer
description:
**About Mevisio** 




 Mevisio is a Swedish software company building a low-code platform that helps global manufacturing enterprises visualize, manage, and improve their operations. Our platform digitizes the shop floors and empower every industry in reaching operational excellence. Trusted by some of the world’s largest industrial companies, in over 70+ countries, our solution turns complex data into clarity and action.
 



  





 Our mission is to transform how enterprises visualize, collaborate, and optimize their workflows by providing intuitive tools and insights that simplify complex processes, enhance communication, and drive sustainable growth.
 



  





 Come visualize success and simplify progress with us, and build the foundation that helps organizations work smarter, every single day!
 



  





**About The Role** 




 You’ll work across the stack, from backend and platform instrumentation to frontend implementation, but your main strength should lie in backend and infrastructure. You’ll be involved in modernizing the core of a live, customer-heavy platform, where every change must be made carefully to ensure stability for the customers already building on top of it. Challenging yet fascinating for sure, and an environment with constant learning! Not to forget, your code will run in 3,000+ factories worldwide!
 



  





 Your daily tasks is to:
 



  




* design and implement scalable backend solutions that power a complex, data-driven environment.
* improve and extend the core of Mevisio’s low-code engine and surrounding platform components.
* refactor and evolve legacy code into modern, maintainable architecture.
* collaborate closely with product to deliver reliable, user-focused solutions.
* contribute to engineering practices that ensure long-term performance, resilience, and security.
* continuously learn, explore, and experiment with better ways to build and evolve a live system.



  





*Our platform runs cloud-native on AWS and is built around: Node.js, TypeScript, React and modern front-end tooling. MongoDB (Atlas), Elastic, and Redis.Kubernetes and Terraform for infrastructure and a custom low-code engine powering dynamic configurations.* 




  





**The Team** 




 You’ll join a small, senior team that works closely and collaborates together, engineer to product. Our company values
 *Better Together, People Matter* 
 and
 *Aim High* 
 comes together as we invest in our team and the work we do. Expectations are high, but we rely on each other’s expertise, communicate openly, learn, and stay focused on building things that make a difference - often with a laugh and in front of a white board.
 



  





**What We Are Looking For** 




 Someone with experience from a
 **platform engineering** 
 background in a larger organization or have experience from
 **low-code or internal tools** 
 contexts. What matters most is that you enjoy the mix of architecture, problem-solving, and hands-on engineering, and that you like to bring order to complex systems.
 



  





 We think you;
 



  




* have a degree in computer science
* have 10+ years of experience from engineering
* have experience building and running SaaS platforms or complex B2B products.
* understand what it means when customers rely on your software for daily operations.
* have a background in platform engineering, preferably from low-code development.
* enjoy the blend of architecture, problem-solving, and hands-on engineering.
* thrive on bringing structure and clarity to complex systems.
* are curious, methodical, and take ownership of your work.
* care about doing things properly, not just getting them done.



  





**Perks & Benefits** 




 🚆 Central office close to public transport
 



 🏖️ 30 paid vacation days per year
 



 💪 Wellness allowance
 



 📈 Pension plan
 



 🪐 Opportunities for professional development
 



 🔕 Flexible working hours and hybrid setup
 



 👟 Gym access nearby
 



 🎊 Team activities and social events
 



 💻 Modern tech equipment
 



 ☕ Daily fruit, coffee & tea
 



  





  





**Come and build the future of industrial SaaS, here with us at Mevisio!**

title: Backendutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Du har stor erfarenhet av backendutveckling i Java eller Kotlin.
* Du har mycket god kunskap inom mikrotjänst- och API-design, dataflöden och eventdriven arkitektur.
* Du har erfarenhet av DevOps, CI/CD, Kubernetes, Terraform.
* Du har tidigare haft en roll som Tech Lead eller Scrum Master.
* Du har god förståelse för agila arbetssätt och backlogprioritering.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 15-10-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Senior Cloud Engineer, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Do you want to work in a creative environment where you can make an impact? Apply to Senior Cloud Engineer to PostNord in Stockholm!
   

  

 As a software engineer at PostNord in Stockholm you will work in a modern tech stack and develop our booking solution as millions of people are affected by all over the Nordic region. Some examples are PostNord Customer Portal, Skicka Direkt, PostNord App and the Real Postcards App. Live tracking, parcel robots and digital postage are some of the latest services we have developed. We look forward to hearing your ideas for our future solutions!
   

  

**The Opportunity**
* Work with our modern tech stack and be given great opportunities to influence the choice of technology.
* We encourage you to develop. For example, we sponsor you to AWS certify.
* A job where the value you deliver is crucial for our society.
* Wellness allowance and access to the office ́s gym and indoor swimming pool.
* Employee benefits through PostNord ́s own personnel foundation PostNord Plus.
* Great occupational pension terms.
* Great work-life balance with the possibility of a hybrid solution.


 We believe that you enjoy working in an agile environment where you get great opportunities to be involved and influence the work and the technical choices. We see that you have knowledge of working with cloud solutions, preferably in AWS, as well as knowledge of Node.JS, Java, Typescript or similar. Your main profile is Backend with Fullstack interest.
   

  

 It’s appreciated is if you have an academic education in computer science or equivalent experience. We also see that you can communicate in Swedish and English, both in speech and writing.
   

  

 However, the most important thing is your personal qualities. If you are committed, responsible and unpretentious and you love coding and to bring value to the product you are working with, then we think you will fit in perfectly with us. We look forward hearing more about you!
   

  

**About Us**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.
   

  

 We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at www.postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 Welcome to submit your application. The selection is ongoing, so please apply as soon as possible. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Observability Engineer, Solna/Hybrid
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Do you want to shape the future of IT observability in the leading communications and logistics company in the Nordics? Are you passionate about building reliable platforms that help product teams gain insight into their systems? Then this could be the role for you!
   

  

**You, Us & The Job**
 As an observability specialist, you will be at the forefront of our transformation, bringing new perspectives and ideas that help us rethink how we work with technology. Your expertise will be central in tackling challenges and shaping the role observability plays in supporting PostNord’s complex IT landscape.
   

  

 Within Group IT, the central Observability & Monitoring team helps deliver the insights that make this possible — turning metrics, logs, traces, and dashboards into tools that enable more than 70 product teams to build reliable and transparent services. We foster a culture of innovation, knowledge sharing, and continuous improvement. As an Observability Engineer, you will help us evolve and operate our observability platform while driving PostNord’s observability maturity to the next level.
   

  

**What will you do?**
 In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring that our observability platform is stable, scalable, and cost-efficient, while supporting teams across PostNord to succeed with observability best practices.
   

  

**Your Tasks Will Include**
* Operate and evolve the observability platform – keep our stack (Grafana Cloud, Loki, Thanos/Mimir, Tempo, Pyroscope) reliable, scalable, and cost-efficient while continuously improving features and integrations.
* Enable product teams with better insights – help over 70 teams instrument their applications with high-quality metrics, logs, traces, and SLOs, ensuring observability becomes a natural part of development and operations.
* Build tailored observability solutions – for teams lacking the skills or resources to do it themselves.
* Secure platform performance across hybrid infrastructure – optimize and troubleshoot workloads running in Kubernetes and on-prem, ensuring smooth operations in a complex hybrid landscape.
* Automate for resilience – design and implement monitoring, alerting, and incident response workflows that reduce toil, speed up detection, and improve recovery times.
* Drive collaboration through data – work closely with developers, infrastructure, and platform teams to diagnose issues, improve system reliability, and make decisions based on observability data.
* Contribute to maturity and standards – document best practices, create guidelines, and help raise observability capabilities across the organization.


 We are looking for a collaborative, proactive, and service-minded engineer who enjoys enabling others through reliable platforms. You are curious and adaptable, with a strong technical foundation and a structured way of working. You take responsibility for your tasks, communicate clearly, and contribute positively to team culture.
   

  

**Your Experience**
* Strong knowledge of Linux system administration.
* Extensive experience with observability tools such as Grafana, Prometheus/Mimir, Loki, Tempo, or similar.
* Experience with Kubernetes (OpenShift/EKS) and containerized workloads.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure/AWS) and hybrid IT environments.
* Scripting/automation skills (e.g., Python, Go, Bash).
* Fluent in English (Swedish is a plus).


 You should furthermore have experience with infrastructure-as-code tools such as Terraform, Helm, or ArgoCD, as well as familiarity with profiling solutions like Pyroscope. Certifications in cloud platforms, Kubernetes, or observability technologies are considered meritorious.
   

  

**We offer you**
 At PostNord, we are a modern, customer-oriented company that cares as much about our employees as we do about our customers. With us, you’ll take on a varied role in an international environment, facing exciting challenges and benefiting from quick decision-making.
   

  

 In addition to fair employment conditions under collective agreements, we offer:
   

  

* Flexibility at work – a modern hybrid workplace (watch the film about our office)
* Room to grow – excellent opportunities for personal and professional development
* Security for the future – strong insurance and occupational pension benefits
* Health & wellness – wellness allowance and free access to Arken’s (PostNord HQ) gym and swimming pool
* Exclusive perks – employee benefits through PostNord Plus, our own personnel foundation


**About Us**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are in a constant transformation and work consistently to develop both our offer and our employees, all to achieve our vision of being the favourite carrier of the Nordics. We are PostNord - a fantastic company to work and grow with. Read more at group.postnord.com
   

  

  

  

**Apply**
 Welcome to submit your application. The selection is ongoing, so please apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions or concerns, please email marcus.nilsson@postnord.com or call +46702249216.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Read more about our union representatives
