title: Full-Stack Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin and Bird & Bird. Backed by over $110M in funding from top investors including ICONIQ, General Catalyst, Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a world-class team from Google, Spotify, and top tier consulting and law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 As a Fullstack Engineer at Legora you will build, review and ship amazing products helping legal professionals all over the world in their day-to-day job. You’ll get the chance to work across the entire tech stack with clear ownership and autonomy.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Architect and implement features end-to-end for our web platform
* Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
* Work with technologies such as React, Node.js, AWS, Azure and Kubernetes
* Drive continuous improvement and challenge us, the industry and yourself


 Who you are
   

  

* A passionate engineer with a few years of experience building great products using cutting-edge technologies
* You feel comfortable working across the entire tech stack, with focus on backend development
* You’re autonomous and take pride in the code you write
* You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about software architecture
* Experience in infrastructure and integrations are a big plus


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, London, and NYC, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve. We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Data Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, Data Infrastructure and Analytics, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Ready to reimagine the future of retail?** 




  





 At Bambuser, we’re transforming how the world shops online by bringing video commerce to life for some of the world’s most beloved brands. Our customers’ success is our passion, and we believe in the potential of every individual. Together, we’re building the future of retail, with data playing a central role in how we operate, grow, and make decisions.
 



 We offer an open, honest, and friendly workplace where every opinion matters. Conversations can get lively because we care deeply about what we build. But we always have each other’s backs and make space to enjoy the ride.
 



**Join Bambuser as a Data Engineer and help us take our data platform to the next level.** 
 From product analytics to business-critical insights, you’ll be working at the core of our data ecosystem. Your work will enable smarter decisions, faster development, and better collaboration across the company. If you’re passionate about building reliable pipelines, designing scalable architecture, and contributing to a curious, capable team, we’d love to hear from you.
 



  





**What You’ll Do**



* **Build & Scale:** 
 Design, implement, and maintain our data platform on GCP (BigQuery, Dataflow, Airflow, Pub/Sub), ensuring pipelines are reliable, efficient, and secure.
* **ELT Excellence:** 
 Create robust ELT workflows using Dataform/dbt, SQL, and Python to transform raw data into analytics-ready datasets.
* **Architectural Leadership:** 
 Lead discussions on data architecture, deployment automation, and CI/CD practices to streamline our data workflows and ensure maintainability.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** 
 Partner closely with analysts, developers, and product teams to capture requirements, shape data-driven features, and deliver actionable insights.
* **Observability & Quality:** 
 Implement monitoring, logging, and governance processes to ensure data reliability, accuracy, and documentation.



  





**Who you are**




 We believe you have:
 


* Strong proficiency in SQL and Python.
* Hands-on experience with GCP data technology: BigQuery, Dataflow, Airflow, Pub/Sub, or equivalent.
* A proven track record building and scaling data pipelines at production scale.
* Experience with ELT/ETL frameworks such as Dataform or dbt\_.
* Solid software engineering practices: version control (Git), automated testing, and CI/CD.
* Excellent communication skills; adept at working with cross-functional stakeholders.
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience)



 We'd consider it a bonus if you have experience with:
 



 Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes, streaming data architectures, client-side logging, or observability tools such as Prometheus and Grafana.
 



  





  





**Curiosity** 
 , clear
 **communication** 
 , and a
 **thoughtful** 
 approach to problem-solving go a long way in this role. We value people who ask good questions and enjoy learning as part of a team.
 



  





**Tools we use**




 GCP | BigQuery | Dataform | Dataflow | Airflow | Terraform | Python | Cube.dev | Steep | Embeddable
 



  





**Why join Bambuser?**




 We’re pioneers in live commerce, partnering with some of the world’s most loved brands to create engaging and innovative shopping experiences. As part of our growing team, you’ll help scale a platform that is changing how people shop online.
 



 At Bambuser, you’ll take ownership of meaningful projects, face new challenges, and contribute directly to the development of our product. The work you do will have real impact and be used by thousands of shoppers in real time.
 



 This role is based in Stockholm and offers a flexible work setup. You’ll have the freedom to focus from home when needed, while also spending time with your team in our beautiful office in the city center.
 



  





  





**This is Bambuser**




 Bambuser’s Video Commerce technology drives customer engagement and sales for some of the world’s largest brands and retailers. At the forefront of live streaming technology since 2007, Bambuser launched interactive eCommerce solutions in 2019 and quickly became the platform of choice for companies worldwide. Our team has established long-term partnerships and supported campaign activations for brands and retailers including Adidas, Hugo Boss, brands within the LVMH group, Clarins, Selfridges, Sonos, and many others.
 



*Bambuser values diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, welcoming individuals from all backgrounds, regardless of where you come from or what you believe.*

title: Release Train Engineer in Performance Emissions & OBD Integration
description:
*TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation - Let´s make a difference together. Find out more:* 
*www.traton.com*
*Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.*
 We are looking for a new colleague within the section Performance & Emissions Integration, who wants to join the Group R&D change journey.
   

  

 The role offers the flexibility to be based in any of the locations where the Group HR R&D organization operates (Nürnberg, Germany; Södertälje, Sweden; Lisle, USA), depending on the candidate’s preference and location.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Release Train Engineer (RTE) to support and drive our VCT Performance Emissions & OBD Integration. The RTE will be responsible for ensuring seamless coordination between cross-functional teams, maintaining alignment with program objectives, and enabling continuous delivery of value in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. This is a pivotal leadership role for an individual who is passionate about Agile methodologies, systems integration, and automotive technology.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Act as the chief servant leader and coach of the VCT, guiding teams towards the successful delivery of complex system integration ensuring emissions and OBD compliance
* Facilitate agile events (e.g., PI Planning, System Demos, daily stand-up) and ensure timely completion of program-level objectives and deliverables
* Drive continuous improvement by identifying process bottlenecks, fostering a culture of innovation, and implementing Agile best practices tailored to automotive product development
* Collaborate with Product Management and System Architects to clarify requirements, manage dependencies, and mitigate risks
* Aligning time plans and deliveries inside and outside of VCT
* Facilitate and coordinate of workflow of the VCT in Jira
* Monitor metrics, report on program health, and proactively address obstacles to ensure the highest quality deliverables
* Support the development of high-performing teams by mentoring Scrum Masters, Product Owners, and Agile team members
* Communicate regularly with leadership stakeholders, providing transparency into VCT progress and program maturity
* Ensure compliance with internal process and quality standards and external regulatory requirements for emissions and OBD systems


 As our new Group is part of TRATON Group, we are closely collaborating we are working with all brands in the Group (Scania, MAN, INTERNATIONAL). In your role it’s therefore important to have a Group perspective while taking all brands into consideration.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical discipline
* 5+ years of experience in engine systems or software engineering, preferably in the automotive industry
* 2+ years of experience as a Release Train Engineer, Agile Program Manager, or similar role
* Understanding of Agile frameworks (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban) and practical experience applying them to complex technical programs
* Excellent facilitation, communication, and conflict resolution skills
* Proven track record of guiding cross-disciplinary programs to successful completion
* Experience with regulatory compliance and certification processes for emissions and diagnostics systems
* Knowledge of vehicle performance, emissions technologies and OBD integration is highly preferred
* Familiarity with tools such as Jira, Confluence, and DevOps pipelines
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, highly regulated, and collaborative environment
* SAFe Release Train Engineer (RTE) certification or equivalent is a strong plus


*We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.*
**This Is Us**
 The VCT Performance Emissions & OBD Integration consists of ten cross site teams spanning the entire development cycle from early integration concept development, via optimization of engine types for Brands in the Traton Group, to product follow up and support to production. We integrate engine and exhaust treatment hardware with software and calibration to meet legal requirements for emissions, power and OBD with optimized properties. The main operations of the VCT is in Södertälje and Nürnberg. You will report to the section manager of Performance & Emissions Integration.
   

  

 The management team for the section and VCT is a group of highly experienced leaders in performance and emissions integration with a proven track record of delivering world class solutions. We encourage a collaborative, inclusive, and supportive work culture that values professional growth and continuous learning.
   

  

 Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Being bigger also means being stronger. Together with our brands, we have the collective power to transform transportation.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-11-14.
   

  

 Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

**Cross-Brand Recruiting**
 By applying for this position, please be aware that we will share your CV in order to be able to conduct a group-wide recruiting process.
   

  

**If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:**
 Hiring Manager: Fredrik Lindström, +46 73 961 58 59, fredrik.lindstrom@scania.com
   

  

 Bernhard Grimm, +49 160 96 57 42 45, bernhard.grimm@man.eu
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Senior testautomatiserare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
* Ta fram ramverk för automatisering.
* Skapa ett prototyptestfall
* Jobba med regrissionstester
* Skapa struktur för automatiska tester
* Ta fram en testsuite för regressionstest
* Sätta upp nattliga tester för stabilitet/robustness
* Skapa automatiserade byggen


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 16-10-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Senior Fullstack GenAI Lead
description:
**🚀 Senior Fullstack GenAI Engineer – Stockholm** 




  





 Are you a seasoned software engineer passionate about
 **Generative AI** 
 and eager to shape a product from the ground up?
 



  





 We’re working with a
 **market-leading SaaS provider** 
 whose cloud-based platform is trusted by some of the world’s biggest brands. They are now making a
 **major strategic investment into AI** 
 and are building a brand-new AI team in Stockholm.
 



  





**The Opportunity** 




  





 You’ll be the first senior hire in a newly established AI team, responsible for:
 



  




* Designing and driving the
 **technical roadmap** 
 for AI adoption within the product.
* Building
 **AI infrastructure and agentic workflows** 
 from scratch.
* Leveraging
 **LLMs, RAG pipelines, and cloud-native tooling** 
 to integrate GenAI directly into a large-scale SaaS platform.
* Working closely with engineering leadership and product teams to deliver features that will transform how global users interact with the platform.
* Mentoring colleagues and setting best practices (no people management initially, but scope to step into a lead role as the team grows).



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




  




* Strong
 **software engineering background** 
 with experience building real-world products.
* Proven track record of implementing
 **GenAI solutions** 
 (LLMs, RAG, agentic AI, prompt-based workflows, etc.).
* Hands-on experience with
 **cloud platforms** 
 (AWS preferred, but strong Azure/GCP profiles considered).
* Proficiency in backend languages such as
 **Node.js/TypeScript, Go, Python, or PHP** 
 .
* Collaborative mindset with the ability to influence technical direction and mentor others.



  





**What’s on Offer** 




  




* 🌴
 **30 days’ vacation**
* 💪 4,000 SEK wellness allowance
* 🏡 2,500 SEK home office allowance
* 🛡 ITP1 pension + life & occupational insurances
* Hybrid setup –
 **Stockholm-based with onsite collaboration a few days per week**



  





**Why Apply?** 




  




* Join a
 **global SaaS leader** 
 at the start of their AI journey.
* Huge scope to
 **shape the AI strategy and roadmap** 
 .
* Work in a
 **collaborative, low-ego culture** 
 with real investment into learning and development.
* Be part of a small but growing AI team with clear potential to step into future leadership.



  





 👉 Sound interesting? Apply today to be part of building the future of AI-powered SaaS platforms.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
I
 **Stretch Beyond** 
 använder vi använder Microsofts väletablerade verktyg och tekniker för data och analytics till att utveckla lösningar som är hållbara över tid. Med dessa tar vi in, bearbetar och tillgängliggör data på ett strukturerat sätt enligt våra kunders behov och förväntningar. Centralt för oss är att vi tror att data också spelar en viktig roll i omställningen till mer hållbara affärsmodeller, och självklart ser du också potentialen i datadriven effektivisering.
   

  

 Hos oss kommer du kreativt få rita upp nya lösningar, förverkliga dem hands-on och se effekten av ditt arbete, som exempelvis mer energieffektiva sjukhus. Du kan förvänta dig en arbetsplats i högt tempo där du får ta stort eget ansvar i omväxlande och utmanande åtaganden där vi hjälper varandra att skapa de bästa lösningarna för våra kunder.
   

  

 Om du vill vara med i början av ett nytt geografiskt område i ett väletablerat konsultbolag finns här en riktig möjlighet att bidra med din djupa kompetens. Du får vara med från grunden men har tryggheten och den sociala samvaron som är en självklarhet i Stretchgruppen. Vi erbjuder dig en naturlig plats i vardagen och möjligheten att göra skillnad.
   

  

 Hos oss är det okej med flexibilitet, vi sitter gärna tillsammans med våra syskonbolag på Gamla Brogatan 26 eller ute hos kund men samarbetar väl digitalt också.
   

  

 För den här rollen behöver du behärska både engelska och svenska samt ha flerårig erfarenhet av att arbeta med Microsofts verktyg.
   

  

**Vi tror att du som person...**
* Är en noggrann problemlösare som inte ger dig
* Gillar tekniska utmaningar
* Intresserar dig för ny teknik
* Vill både dela med dig av din kunskap och lära av andra
* Uppskattar högt tempo


**Erfarenheter som hjälper dig att lyckas i denna roll...**
* Datahantering i Azure, Synapse, Databricks, Fabric eller motsvarande
* Spark
* Power BI
* Avancerad SQL
* Python
* Relevant utbildning och längre arbetslivserfarenhet
* Konsulterfarenhet och/eller projekterfarenhet


 Läs gärna mer om oss här.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Hälsar teamet på Stretch Beyond

title: Business Analyst
description:
At Evitec Solutions, we create innovative IT solutions and advisory services that support our customers' success across industries. With over 300 professionals across the Nordics, we specialize in providing business-critical software for the finance and insurance sectors. Our solutions streamline complex processes, enabling smarter decisions and delivering long-term value.
   

  

 We are seeking a Business Analyst to join our team in Sweden to support our journey with our product, Evitec Solutions Life, in Sweden. Evitec Solutions Life is a complete and flexible policy administration system for life insurance which easily adapts to changing business requirements and needs.
   

  

 As a Business Analyst, you are methodical in your requirements management work, and you are used to work in the customer interface. You have experience in defining and specifying software requirements. If you're interested, please apply. We offer a position with many exciting challenges and great variety, working within a fantastic cross-Nordic team of experts.
   

  

**About Evitec Solutions Life**
 Evitec Solutions Life is an insurance IT software (ES Life) designed for life insurers offering savings, pension and personal life risk products. The software provides a complete, efficient, and scalable policy administration solution. This highly automated and future-proof insurance platform handles policy sales, lifecycle management, and claims processing securely and reliably. It is ideal for life and pension insurance companies seeking a modern system.
   

  

**At Evitec Solutions, You Shape the Future of the Financial Sector**
 We offer an inspiring work environment in a growing and successful organization where you will have opportunities for development. We value a work culture that promotes a balance between work and personal life, including options for hybrid work and flexible hours. Additionally, we foster a supportive work culture where everyone contributes, spreads joy and grows together. Moreover, we offer competitive salaries and benefits.
   

  

**Who Are You?**
 As a person, you are positive, curious, and unpretentious, and you are happy to share your knowledge. You need the ability to work with both holistic and detailed perspectives and can connect strategy with tactics. You are someone who gets things done.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, you should have:**
* At least 2 years of experience as a Business Analyst, working at the intersection of business and IT
* Experience in specifying and writing software requirements
* Familiar with tools like Azure DevOps, JIRA and Confluence (or similar)
* The ability to network and collaborate with stakeholders at various levels
* A business-driven mindset, preferably with experience in financial industry life insurance
* Experience with agile environments and traditional project methodologies
* A pleasant and empathetic approach to teamwork and client collaboration
* Fluency in both Swedish and English, spoken and written


**We also value if you have:**
* Previous experience with financial industry
* Previous experience working in the customer interface
* A desire to develop and learn new things
* An interest in long-term work with systems crucial to society


 While flexibility is important to us, this position requires regular daily presence onsite at our office or customer locations to best serve our projects and clients.
   

  

**Why join us?**
 We offer responsibility aligned with your expertise and ambitions, plus the freedom to grow your career—toward leadership, deep technical specialization, or customer experience excellence. At Evitec, every team member is an equal part of the team, with diverse opportunities to grow and do meaningful work. We get things done with a smile and a positive attitude. Truly.
   

  

 If you'd like to have more information about Evitec or the job before applying, you can contact Head of Engineering Sami Lehtisaari through email: (firstname.lastname@evitec.com).
   

  

**Interested?**
 Make sure you put in your application latest 10.11.2025, we review applications on a rolling basis.

title: Mobile Software Developer
description:
****More independence, freedom, and better pay****
 Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 It's not rocket science.
   

  

 Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.
   

  

 The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.
   

  

 Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

****Why Coody****
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?
   

  

**Maximized Compensation** 
 - Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security** 
 - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shaping the Future** 
 - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

****This is Coody****
 We’re a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.
   

  

 Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.
   

  

 Explore our
 **Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.
   

  

****What you’ll be doing****
 As a Mobile Developer Consultant at Coody, you’ll dive into technically challenging and engaging assignments that help companies level up their teams and projects. You’ll be crafting high-quality, efficient, and maintainable code using native or hybrid platforms (such as Android, iOS, React Native, Kotlin Multiplatform or Flutter). You will collaborate close with other engineers, designers, product people and other teams to build mobile experiences for some of the most exciting brands within tech.
   

  

 You’ll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. New challenges? Bring them on. We see them as opportunities for growth. Typically, you’ll take on 1-2 different assignments per year. Are you ready to make a difference?
   

  

****Who you are****
 We’re looking for a Mobile Developer with
 **5+ years of experience** 
 and a doer’s mindset. Here’s what we’re after:
   

  

* Strong expertise in either Swift, Kotlin, Flutter or React Native
* Unit testing experience and a solid understanding of the release cycle, and CI/CD
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics (or similar)
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


****How to apply****
 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criteria? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Embedded Developer
description:
At Sii Sweden we partner with some of the most forward-thinking companies across industries such as automotive, healthcare, life-science and banking.
 



 As an Embedded Software Developer at Sii, you won’t just write code—you’ll contribute to the success of diverse, high-impact projects that demand both deep technical knowledge and creative problem-solving; you’ll play a key role in delivering tailored solutions that meet client’s unique requirements.
 



 Joining us means working in a collaborative, consultancy-driven environment so If you're excited by challenge, and the opportunity to grow alongside some of the best engineers in the field, we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





**Your tasks** 



* Design and implement software architecture for embedded systems
* Develop robust applications using C++ and Qt/QML for device interfaces and control logic
* Work on hardware-related programming, including device drivers
* Design, build, and debug embedded Linux environments (GNU/Linux) for various hardware platforms
* Write scripts and tools in Python (or equivalent) to support development, testing, and automation
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, QA, and UX designers
* Contribute to design reviews, documentation, and system integration activities



  





**Requirements** 



* Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or similar
* Solid experience with C++ in embedded system environments
* Strong knowledge of Qt/QML for UI and application layer development
* Experience with GNU/Linux system development and configuration
* Hands-on knowledge of hardware-level programming
* Familiarity with scripting in Python or a similar language
* Proficiency in embedded systems architecture and real-time constraints
* Ability to debug complex software/hardware interactions

title: Experienced Backend Developer - Tracking Information Team, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
*Are you ready to make an impact on millions of lives every day? Join us at PostNord, where your work will help shape the future of logistics across the Nordics!*
*In our team, we build and run the central event manager - the engine that handles millions of events every day. What we do is at the heart of PostNord’s digital ecosystem, enabling everything from parcel tracking to future innovations. We care deeply about quality, ownership, and making life easier for our users - whether they’re customers, colleagues, or developers in other teams. You’ll join a group of curious, collaborative people who enjoy solving real problems together.*
**Be part of the Tracking Information Team**
* We deliver services that impact millions of customers and recipients in the Nordics daily, ensuring they are accessible through platforms like our website and the PostNord app.
* You’ll help build backend solutions that keep things running smoothly for millions of people — making deliveries more reliable and everyday life a little easier, one package at a time. We care about quality and user experience, and you’ll play a key role in making sure our systems live up to that.
* We develop microservices in Kubernetes.
* Our infrastructure is hosted on AWS.
* We prioritize quality and robustness in our deliveries, as they directly affect our customers.
* We take full ownership of our services—from design and development to security, monitoring, and business metrics. With DevOps, we ensure quality at every step.
* We deploy multiple times a week, seeing the value of our work immediately.
* Our team takes responsibility for optimizing our work processes, using practices like mob and pair programming to enhance collaboration, quality, and collective knowledge.
* We collaborate closely with IT teams at PostNord, as well as production units, management, customers, and partners, to capture requirements and ensure our deliveries meet expectations. We’re passionate about what we do, and we want you to join us in shaping the future of logistics!


**Who are you?**
 You're a developer with a solid foundation — whether that comes from formal studies or hands-on experience - and you're always looking to grow. You like solving real and complex problems, working in agile teams, and building things that actually help people.
   

  

* You’re into backend development and curious about building robust systems with a great user experience.
* You’re interested in cloud technologies (like AWS) and Java is one of your go-to languages — or one you’re excited to learn more about.
* You take ownership of what you build — from first commit to production and beyond.
* You’re driven by making everyday life simpler for customers, colleagues, and users.


 You’re someone who communicates clearly and openly — whether it’s in code reviews, standups, or just helping a teammate out.
   

  

**Valuable Skills And Experience**
**AWS:** 
 Sound/Basic experience with AWS components such as DynamoDB, Lambda, S3 bucket and CDK/Cloudformation. SQS/Kinesis will be bonus.
   

  

**What we value:** 
 Hands-on experience is great, but a willingness to learn and build serverless solutions is just as important.
   

  

**Java:** 
 We work with Java 21/SE+ and Spring Boot, and we emphasize writing stable, well-tested code.
   

  

**What we value:** 
 Basic knowledge is essential, and we’ll support you in deepening your expertise. Good understanding of Java 21+ and Spring Boot for developing backend applications. I am eager to learn and grow skills for developing cloud native applications using AWS.
   

  

 Kafka (or real data streaming tools) will be bonus
   

  

**Github/Docker and (AWS EKS):** 
 These tools help us scale and orchestrate our applications.
   

  

**What we value:** 
 Some familiarity is helpful, but not required—we’ll help you get up to speed.
   

  

 Basic knowledge will suffice from the task completion via code development till production deployment
   

  

**REST API Services And OpenAPI Documentation (aka Swagger)**
 We use REST APIs and Swagger for defining and documenting secure web services.
   

  

**What we value:** 
 If you’ve worked with APIs before, great! If not, we’ll guide you through it.
   

  

**Prometheus And Grafana**
 Monitoring and visualization tools that help us ensure performance and reliability.
   

  

**What we value** 
 : No prior experience needed—we’ll provide on-the-job training.
   

  

 Knowledge of prometheus/grafana will be bonus
   

  

 You’ve probably studied something like Computer Science or Information Systems — or maybe you’ve picked up your skills in other ways. What matters most is that you know your stuff. You’re comfortable communicating in both Swedish and English, whether it’s in writing or in conversation.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Step into a dynamic hybrid workplace where collaboration, creativity, and innovation are at the heart of everything we do.
* Grow with us! We support your development with opportunities for career advancement—including sponsorship for AWS certifications.
* Feel secure with comprehensive insurance and pension plans that have you covered.
* Stay healthy and energized with a wellness allowance to Arkens gym and pool.
* Enjoy exclusive perks through PostNord Plus, giving you access to a wide range of employee benefits.


**Making everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading provider of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordics. We ensure postal services for individuals and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. Our goal is to make everyday life simpler and more sustainable for everyone in the Nordics.
   

  

 We are accountable, courageous, and committed, effectively leading change for ourselves and others. We value teamwork, honesty, and positive relationships in the workplace. By embracing diversity, we create better outcomes for the business.
   

  

**Apply Now**
 What are you waiting for? Take the next step in your career and join us in creating extraordinary solutions for millions across the Nordics! Selections and interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis, so apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position, feel free to email robert.svensson-eshraghi@postnord.com

title: C++ utvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Solid experience in modern C++.
* Familiarity with git and common branching strategies.


**Meriterande**
* Has experience in GUI application development (Qt experience preferred).
* Has worked with Jenkins CI environments.
* Has been involved in product development.
* Experience from regulated industries, especially medical technology, is a plus but not a requirement.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 22-10-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Mobile Android Engineer, Consumer Mobile Platform
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 Wolt is looking for a Senior/Staff Android Engineer to expand our Consumer Mobile Platform team. The team is part of the Consumer Product group and is responsible for enabling the delivery of the consumer mobile apps that millions of people in over 20 countries around the world see when ordering food and other products.
   

  

 Our client platform teams have a clear mission:
   

  

**“Enable delivery and ownership of Wolt-grade Consumer Client Applications through engineering excellence and domain expertise.”**
**What You'll Be Doing**
 As part of the team, and to fulfill our mission, you will focus on many different areas:
   

  

* Building the foundation of our top-rated consumer facing applications
* Enablement of our product teams, architecture and platform robustness, observability, developer experience, and more.
* Driving technical initiatives to foster our engineering excellence
* Aligning with multiple stakeholders
* Supporting product development teams by providing a robust platform that makes it simple and fast for our features to reach our millions of customers
* If you like to communicate with many stakeholders, think about the long-term health and quality of customer experience and technical solutions, find ways to make other engineers’ lives easier and raise the bar of engineering excellence, this is the team for you!


 This role can be based in Helsinki, Finland. Read more about our remote setup here. 🌍
   

  

 Feel free to check the Wolt Tech Blog for more read about our culture & technology here.
   

  

 Our humble expectations
   

  

* Experienced in Android development
* Understanding of the Android ecosystem and platform
* A strong interest in building a maintainable and extensible Android platform
* End-to-end system design understanding
* Experienced with CI/CD pipelines
* Strong communication skills
* Stakeholder management
* Familiar with driving initiatives across an engineering organisation
* Optional, but great to have: Experience/strong interest in mobile observability
* Have an eye for great user experience


 Next steps
   

  

 We’re reviewing applications on a rolling basis, and the position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so apply as soon as you realize you’d love to join us!
   

  

 The hiring process typically includes an initial chat with our Talent Acquisition Partner, followed by technical interviews, a team conversation, and final alignment.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: .NET- utvecklare
description:
**Att jobba som .NET-utvecklare**
 Som .NET-utvecklare blir du en nyckelspelare i teamet som utvecklar och förvaltar vårt centrala personregister (CPR) – en affärskritisk lösning byggd i .NET. Här gör du skillnad varje dag genom att skapa tekniska lösningar som möjliggör effektiva och pålitliga tjänster för hundratusentals kunder.
   

  

* Du blir en del av ett team på 11 personer: Product Owner, Scrum Master, testare, SQL- och .NET-utvecklare, mjukvaruarkitekt och systemansvarig.
* Du får arbeta både självständigt och tätt ihop med kollegor – alltid med stöd från vårt interna .NET-forum.
* Vår utvecklingsmiljö bygger på kontinuerlig integration och leverans (CI/CD) med Azure DevOps Server och Octopus Deploy som självklara verktyg.
* Vi erbjuder en hybrid arbetsmodell där du kombinerar kontorsdagar med distansarbete.


**För att lyckas i rollen**
**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Har flera års erfarenhet av .NET Core-utveckling samt erfarenhet av API:er
* Är van att arbeta med SQL Server
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska, både i tal och skrift
* Är självgående, nyfiken och gillar att samarbeta i team


 Extra plus om du har erfarenhet av React, Typescript och NServiceBus.
   

  

 Hos oss blir du en del av en kultur som präglas av samverkan, nyfikenhet och framtidstro. Vi står inför en spännande resa där vi tar vara på AI-stödd utveckling med GitHub Copilot – och vi vill att du ska vara med och driva den framåt.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Fredrik Othberg på mailadress: fredrik.othberg@skandia.se
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Master's thesis; Deep Reinforcement Learning for Resource Scheduling in Railway Operations with Explainable AI
description:
We are looking for a dedicated master’s student to join us in the Systems Engineering Unit at RISE.
   

  

 The Systems Engineering Unit is part of RISE Mobility and Systems, focusing on Resource Optimization and System of Systems. The unit conducts projects together with industry and academia nationally and internationally. The research focus for the proposed thesis topics is within Resource Optimization and Decision support.
   

  

**Background**
 Transportation systems need continuous development to meet future demands for sustainable transport. Expectations on these systems are constantly increasing regarding reliability, predictability, transparency, and efficiency. The railway sector has many strengths but also faces significant challenges in resource planning. Real-time traffic management and dispatch must account for delays, maintenance windows, and the limited availability of critical operational resources including rolling stock, crews, depots and network capacity.
   

  

 Reinforcement Learning (RL) is an emerging AI method where agents learn to make decisions through interaction with their environment. In this project, you will explore how Deep RL techniques can be applied to railway engine scheduling in a dynamic, constraint-based setting. In particular, the work will also focus on Explainable AI (XAI) enabling stakeholders to better understand and trust AI-based decisions.
   

  

**Description**
 We are offering a master’s thesis aimed at enhancing railway traffic management and resource allocation using AI.
   

  

 The purpose of this thesis is to explore alternative DRL algorithms and evaluate how well they perform on the same planning task using existing custom-built simulation environment. The project also aims to investigate how Explainable AI (XAI) methods can help visualize and interpret the agent’s decisions making them more transparent and trustworthy to domain users.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 We expect you to have a strong and solid knowledge of AI and machine learning, good programming skills in Python and an interest in solving complex problems. You are interested in deep reinforcement learning (DRL experience is helpful but not required) and in making AI systems more interpretable and user-friendly. Experience with data visualization or simulation is a plus.
   

  

**Collaboration**
 You will be supervised by experienced AI researchers at RISE and work in collaboration with stakeholders in the Swedish railway sector. The thesis offers a unique opportunity to contribute to real-world planning challenges using cutting-edge AI methods.
   

  

**Terms**
 Start Time: Preferable January or February
   

  

 Scope: 30 hp.
   

  

 Compensation: For an approved thesis project worth 30 credits, we pay a compensation of 39,990 SEK if one student and 30,000 SEK per student if more than one student.
   

  

 Location: RISE Mobility and Systems, Västerås or Stockholm. Option to partially work remotely.
   

  

**Welcome with your application!**
 We welcome applications from students passionate about making a significant impact on the future of transportation systems. Please specify in your application which thesis opportunity you are interested in.
   

  

 To know more, please contact Zohreh Ranjbar zohreh.ranjbar@ri.se, 070 627 85 98. Applications should include a CV, recent transcript of records, and a code excerpt (example of a code file written by you, or your GitHub repository link). Candidates are encouraged to send in their application as soon as possible but at the latest by the 1st of December. Suitable applicants will be interviewed as soon as applications are received.
   

  

 Join us in shaping the future of railway resource planning through innovation and cutting-edge research!

title: Android Developer, Retail App, Solna/Hybrid

description:

We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com

 What are you waiting for? Send in your application! Due to the summer holiday period, responses and follow-ups may take a bit longer than usual. We will be back after the vacation in August and look forward to reconnecting with you then. If you have any questions, feel free to contact manager malin.rydman@postnord.com.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Master Thesis, 30 HP: Automated Construction of Electronic Warfare (EW) Library Sets Using Hidden Markov Models and Gaussian Mixture Models
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you a student eager to apply your theoretical knowledge and fresh perspectives to real-world challenges? At Saab, we believe that innovation thrives on new ideas, and your master thesis project could be the spark that ignites our next technological breakthrough.
   

  

 Your role
   

  

 We recognize the immense value that students bring to our company. Your academic rigor, combined with your enthusiasm for cutting-edge technology, allows you to approach problems with a unique and insightful lens. At Saab, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate with experienced engineers and specialists, gaining invaluable practical experience while making a tangible contribution to our growth and development.
   

  

**Background**
 In the aviation sector, a vast network of emitters, both on the ground and in the air, is utilised to emit radio waves for communication and radar purposes. This thesis proposal focuses on the identification aspect of Electronic Warfare (EW), specifically Electronic Support (ES). A key component of ES systems is the Radar Warning Receiver (RWR), which passively detects and classifies radar signals to warn pilots of potential threats. The classification of these signals is crucial for deploying appropriate countermeasures.
   

  

 Electronic Warfare (EW): EW involves exploiting the electromagnetic spectrum to disturb, identify, or neutralize emitting sources. This can include jamming communications, disrupting radar systems, or identifying and locating enemy emitters. EW is a critical component of modern military operations, providing both offensive and defensive capabilities.
   

  

 Electronic Support (ES): ES systems, particularly Radar Warning Receivers (RWRs), play a vital role in EW by intercepting and classifying radar signals. RWRs passively listen for emitted radar signals and warn pilots of their presence. The source of these signals can range from air traffic control centres to incoming missiles, making accurate classification essential for deploying justifiable countermeasures.
   

  

 Signal Characteristics: The classification of radar signals typically relies on several key characteristics:
   

  

* Radio Frequency (RF): The frequency at which the radar signal is transmitted.
* Pulse Width (PW): The duration of the radar pulse.
* Pulse Repetition Interval (PRI): The time between successive radar pulses.


 Machine Learning in EW: Machine learning has shown promise in automating the classification of radar emitters. Supervised learning techniques have achieved up to 90% accuracy in classifying declassified emitters. Recently, Bayesian Gaussian Mixture Models (GMMs) have been used for classifying tracks and emitters. GMMs offer the advantage of learning weights (e.g., medians and standard deviations) that can define new emitter characteristics, making them a powerful tool for EW.
   

  

 Current Challenges:
   

  

 Manual Construction of EW Libraries: EW libraries, which contain known and newly discovered emitters, are traditionally constructed manually. This process is labour-intensive and involves experts manually discovering and transferring emitter data to libraries. The manual overhead can be significant, and the process is prone to human error.
   

  

 Complex Emitter Characteristics: More complex emitters often use certain patterns of RF, PW, and PRI in the temporal domain. Modelling these complex characteristics requires advanced techniques that can capture the temporal dynamics of the signals.
   

  

**Description Of The Master Thesis**
 This thesis proposes the use of GMMs to automate the construction of EW libraries. GMMs can learn weights that define new emitter characteristics, reducing the manual overhead and improving the accuracy and efficiency of the library construction process.
   

  

 Complex Characteristic Modelling with Hidden Markov Models (HMMs): Additionally, HMMs can be employed to model more complex emitter characteristics in the temporal domain. HMMs are well-suited for capturing the sequential dependencies in the signal characteristics, providing a more comprehensive model of the emitters.
   

  

 Automation of EW Library Construction:
   

  

* Utilise the weights defined by GMMs to automate the construction of EW libraries.
* Reduce manual overhead and improve the accuracy and efficiency of the library construction process.


 Complex Characteristic Modelling:
   

  

* Explore the use of HMMs to model more complex emitter characteristics in the temporal domain.
* Capture the sequential dependencies in the signal characteristics to provide a more comprehensive model of the emitters.


 Our software development teams at Tactical Functions develop desktop applications, supporting our Electronic Warfare systems. Our products include analysis and visualization of data and real time feeds, big data, secure user transactions, amongst many other things. Read more about electronic warfare and products from SAAB here.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 This master of science thesis is suitable for one or two students, with an interest in software development, AI, machine learning and/or signal processing.
   

  

 You are at the end of your Master of Science in e.g., Computer Science, AI Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent and about to start your Master Thesis work for 30 HP.
   

  

 We provide the support and guidance you need to translate your theoretical knowledge into practical solutions. Join us and become a driving force behind Saab's technological advancements!
   

  

 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 What you will be a part of
   

  

 Explore a wealth of possibilities. Take on challenges, create smart inventions, and grow beyond. This is a place for curious minds, brave pioneers, and everyone in between. Together, we achieve the extraordinary, each bringing our unique perspectives. Your part matters.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 26,100 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

**Last application day**
 16-11-2025
   

  

**Contact information**
 Jenny Lagerlöf, Manager
   

  

 jenny.lagerlof@saabgroup.com

title: Domain Architect - Gaming Frontend
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**  


As a **Domain Architect (DA)**, you are a lighthouse in the Gaming engineering organization, maintaining the Casino, Live Casino and Bingo verticals. You will be responsible for designing, optimizing, and governing the architecture within the Gaming domain, with a primary focus on our frontend stack together with our current backend DA and other domains in the company. You will ensure that solutions are scalable, reliable, and aligned with overall enterprise architecture, business objectives, and industry best practices.  



**YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:**  

* Domain Architecture Design: Develop and maintain a scalable, resilient, and business-aligned architecture for the domain.
* Collaboration: Work with stakeholders, architects, and engineering teams to ensure architectural consistency and effective implementation.
* Governance and Standards: Define, enforce, and validate architectural standards, best practices, and compliance requirements.
* Risk Management: Identify and mitigate risks related to security, compliance, and technology obsolescence.
* Continuous Improvement: Evolve architecture based on business needs, technology trends, and stakeholder feedback.
* Documentation and Reporting: Maintain clear documentation and provide leadership with regular architecture updates.


**OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:**  


ESSENTIAL SKILLS  



* Deep understanding of designing and delivering scalable, maintainable frontend systems using modern technologies (Next.js, React, Node.js, GraphQL, or comparable modern frameworks). Strong understanding of architectural patterns, performance optimization, feature lifecycle management (feature toggling, A/B testing), and observability.
* Deep understanding of technologies and tools related to cloud platforms (GCP), MySQL and Kafka.
* Knowledge in backend technologies are not necessary but highly desirable, such as Java/Kotlin + Spring Boot framework.
* Communication Skills: Strong ability to articulate complex architectural concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Problem-Solving Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to tackle domain-specific challenges.
* Leadership: Ability to lead and mentor teams, driving collaboration across multiple departments and influencing architectural decisions.

  

**WHO WE ARE**  


At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.
**BENEFITS**  

* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.

  

**JOIN US!**  

  

In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!

  

Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!  

  

\*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.

  

**JOIN US!**  

  

In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!

  

Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!  

  

\*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*
