All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Westernacher is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Technical Lead SDK
description:
**Title:** Technical Lead SDK

**Reports to:** Engineering Manager

**Group:** Digital & Synthetic

**Level:** Senior

**Work Arrangement:** Hybrid

 **Company Overview**


Metrea is a defense company dedicated to translating commercial innovation into solutions for the hardest problems in national security. With deep mission expertise, Metrea focuses on delivering effects-as-a-service across Aerospace, Electromagnetic & Cyber, Digital & Synthetic domains via its capability groups. Metrea also consists of six support groups (Operations, People, Finance, Legal, Strategy and Solutions) that guide the development of specific capabilities that Metrea's files (product, projects, programs etc) leverage to achieve their targets.

 **Capability Group Overview**


The **Digital and Synthetic Capability Unit (D&S)** is committed to providing mission-driven information solutions that seamlessly bridge the digital and physical realms. Leveraging cutting-edge technologies and advanced platforms, we empower operational readiness and elevate situational awareness across diverse domains—including air, maritime, and space.

 **Position Summary**


Metrea is looking for an experienced software developer to join our team and to lead the development and usage of the Source Development Kit utilised by our Simulation Engine, NOR. As the Staff Engineer for SDK, you will be responsible for shaping and maintaining a robust SDK that supports multiple versions and ensures backward compatibility whilst balancing the need to maintain a slick developer experience. This role demands a thoughtful approach to API design, a strong commitment to minimising and gracefully handling breaking changes, and a deep curiosity for Unreal Engine internals—particularly around plugin, asset management, and the cooking process. The ideal candidate will bring experience in developing editor-like tools and producing clear, maintainable technical documentation.


This role will require you to be a team player who enjoys working in a multidisciplinary environment and expects you to be communicative and independent in your work. You should be motivated to find creative and scalable solutions for complex problems.

 **Role and Responsibilities**


As the Technical Lead for our SDK, you will work with a small dedicated team to further the evolution of our tools and documentation to ensure that our SDK delivers exactly what its users need to quickly and easily develop assets for use within our NOR Simulation Engine. You will work with the Product Owner for SDK to advise[AK1] on timelines, complexity and resource requirements to ensure that our roadmap for the SDK is realistic. You will interact on a daily basis with a wide range of both internal and external users of the SDK to help understand their pain-points, deepen their understanding and ensure that the product delivers everything that it needs to be successful. Whilst this role has no direct line management responsibilities, you will act as a mentor and guide for other more junior engineers working on the SDK.

 **Skills and Experience**

* Demonstrated ability to maintain a library or project used by others across multiple versions, including backwards compatible
* Willingness to acquire in-depth knowledge of Unreal Engine internals, especially around plugin & asset management and the cooking process
* Experience from the video game industry
* Passion for anything aerospace-related
* Experience with simulation training tools development
* Experience with large-scale games or simulations
* Experience with wargames
* Experience working with international teams

 **Additional Eligibility Qualifications**

* Engineering degree
* 5+ years of professional C++ programming

 **Our Culture**


Metrea’s single core value, “rooted in humility,” is supported by four key attributes: entrepreneurial, systematic, discerning, and over-deliver. These attributes, combined, form our Teammate Firmware, our culture. We explore these attributes during the hiring process when we grow our teams and continually support the growth of our culture. We are a hyper-collaborative, dynamically hierarchical organization united by a passion for what we do, how we do it, who we do it with, and who we do it for.

 **Benefits**


Sweden


Friskvård of 5K annually


Personal development budget (2K for books, courses, subscriptions etc)


Parental leave


5% occupational pension (swe. tjänstepension),


30 days of leave


Discretionary Bonus

  

Poland


Private Medical Care


MultiSport sport card


English lessons


Personal development allowance


Optional PPK scheme


Discretionary bonus


26 days PTO

 **Right to Work**


The employee will have the legal right to work in the Sweden / Poland and will be able to produce right to work documentation.

 **Equal Opportunities Statement**  

Metrea Management Limited (MAM) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or other characteristics protected by law.

 **Position Type and Expected Hours of Work**  

This is a full-time non-exempt position with typical working hours of Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 17:00 p.m. Hours and work shifts may change in accordance with department and business needs. Exempt Employees must have the ability to be on-call and available, as business needs require. Non-Exempt employees may be required to work over 40 hours per week with approval from the department manager.

 **Work Location**  

Stockholm / Warzaw – Hybrid

 **Work Environment**  

This job operates in an office setting

 **Travel**  

This role will require occasional travel

title: Civilingenjör i Railway Engineering
description:
Latronix AB is a dynamic and growing small company at the forefront of developing cutting-edge measurement technologies for the railway industry. We specialize in creating advanced optical and inertial-based systems that enhance safety, efficiency, and maintenance practices across railway networks. Our team is passionate about innovation and committed to delivering high-quality, reliable solutions to our clients worldwide.
  
**Job Description:** We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Development Engineer with a background in Railway Engineering to join our innovative team. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in the design, development, and implementation of our next-generation optical and inertial measuring systems for various railway applications. This position offers a unique opportunity to contribute to groundbreaking projects and see your work directly impact the future of railway technology.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

**Research and Development:** Conduct research into new technologies and methodologies for optical and inertial measurement in railway environments. This includes exploring advancements in sensor technology, data processing algorithms, and system integration techniques.
  
**System Design:** Design and develop hardware and software components for optical and inertial measuring systems. This involves selecting appropriate sensors (e.g., LiDAR, cameras, accelerometers, gyroscopes), designing optical layouts, and developing embedded software for data acquisition and processing for detecting track irregularities and faults.
  
**Prototyping and Testing:** Build and test prototypes of measuring systems in both laboratory and field environments. This will involve conducting rigorous testing to validate system performance, accuracy, and reliability under various operational conditions.
  
**Data Analysis and Algorithm Development:** Develop and implement algorithms for processing and analyzing data collected from optical and inertial sensors.
  
**Collaboration:** Work closely with cross-functional teams, including mechanical engineers, software developers, and railway experts, to ensure seamless integration and optimal performance of the measuring systems.
  
**Documentation:** Prepare detailed technical documentation, including design specifications, test plans, and user manuals.
  
**Compliance:** Ensure that all developed systems comply with relevant railway industry standards and regulations.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

**Education:** Master's degree or Master's degree pending in Railway Engineering and education in Electrical Engineering
  
**Language Skills:** English, Hindi (Since we have close partners in India)
  
**Experience:** Proven experience in the development of optical or inertial measurement systems within the railway sector.
  
  

**Technical Skills:**  

Experience in rail corrugation analysis using advanced signal processing techniques.
  
Strong interest in and understanding of railway engineering principles, including track geometry, vehicle dynamics, and railway infrastructure.
  
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, C++, or MATLAB for data acquisition, processing, and algorithm development.
  
Experience with inertial measurement units (IMUs), including accelerometers and gyroscopes, and their integration into navigation and measurement systems.
  
Knowledge of signal processing techniques and data analysis methods.
  
  

**Soft Skills:**  

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
  
Strong communication and teamwork abilities.
  
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks effectively.
  
A passion for innovation and a keen interest in railway technology.
  
  

**What We Offer:**  

A challenging and rewarding role in a rapidly evolving industry.
  
The opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology and make a significant impact.
  
A collaborative and supportive work environment in a small, agile company.
  
Competitive salary and benefits package.
  
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
  
  

**To Apply:** Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are interested in this position to office@latronix.se

title: Storage and Infrastructure Engineer on Mainframe platform to SEB in Stockholm
description:
Are you interested in working with SEB Mainframe environment that is facing major changes? Are you a driven system programmer with experience working with Mainframe infrastructure and storage? Do you want to work proactively with modernization and enhancements? If so, this might be a great opportunity for you! **About the role**
We are looking for an Engineer who will be part of a team working with primary storage environment but also overlap with tasks within infrastructure and related services on the Mainframe platform. The team is part of SEB Technology and located in Solna in the Stockholm area. The Mainframe is a vital platform within SEB, where we focus heavily on modernization and run many ongoing initiatives related to the Mainframe platform. At SEB we strive towards a modern Mainframe environment well aligned with our digital roadmap.  

Primary, as a Storage Engineer, you will work with managing the storage for best performance and optimization. You will be responsible, together with the team, for daily maintenance, support and system development of the Storage environment. Handling storage is a critical undertaking as excellent performance from storage is of outmost importance in any delivery performed in mainframe. New requirements for data storage are creating a demand for innovative and efficient solutions. The team also has scheduled 24/7 on-call duty, which will be part of this role when applicable. It is an advantage if you have the knowledge to work cross-border with tasks related to Infrastructure, both with hardware and software.
**Who are you?**
You are a skilled technician/engineer with some years of experience of working within Mainframe environment. You are analytical and structured in your work and understand the importance of following processes when operating in critical environments. Teamwork is essential, as the team has significant responsibility for its own deliveries. In addition, the ability to independently run your own activities and take responsibility for them is necessary. It is important that you enjoy working with colleagues, developing as an engineer, and maintaining a positive ‘can-do’ attitude.  

We are looking for you who have the following qualifications:* At least three years’ experience regarding Mainframe platform as technician
* Experience within storage subsystems (DFSMS / HSM / RMM)
* Working with z/OS and associated hardware is meritorious
* Fluent in both Swedish and English language


**What we offer:**
We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:* Friendly and welcoming culture
* Innovative company at the forefront of technology
* Agile and modern way of working
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* We apply a hybrid model where we work both from the office and home


**Recruitment process**
We select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2025-11-10. If you have any questions about the position, please contact hiring manger Anneli Risberg, by email (anneli.risberg@seb.se)  

SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.  

Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes, for example, identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug tests. *Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.*
https://sebgroup.com/career
https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
Vill du bli en del av oss och bidra till det klimatneutrala samhället på en av Europas modernaste anläggningar? Thermia är en ledande aktör inom utveckling, tillverkning och försäljning av värmepumpssystem för uppvärmning, varmvatten och kyla. Vi har över 100 års erfarenhet av innovativ värme. Sedan 2018 är vi en del av Stiebel Eltron-koncernen med ca 5 000 anställda.


Vi söker nu en prestigelös och produktiv Software Test Engineer att komplettera vårt team med på vår utvecklingsavdelning.

### 

### **Om Tjänsten**


Vi är ett team med spetskompetenser där du kommer ha en viktig roll i utvecklingen av programvaror för framtidens teknik- och teknologilösningar för våra marknadsledande värmepumpar samt dess kringtjänster. Ditt huvudansvarsområde blir att säkerställa kvalitet och stabilitet av elektronik och mjukvara. Du kommer att felsöka mjukvara och utveckla automatiserade tester och simuleringsmodeller, samt rapportera och dokumentera testresultat. Tjänsten kan innebära en del interna och externa kontakter så teamwork och samarbete är något vi värdesätter högt. En utmanande och stimulerande tjänst där man har stora möjligheter att forma och bygga både metodik och teknik, baserat på intressen och styrkor.

### **Om dig**


Vi söker dig som har 3-5 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom området. Dig som har en högskole- eller civilingenjörsutbildning inom exempelvis elektroteknik, datateknik eller inbyggda system. Du har ett intresse för mjukvarutestning och erfarenhet av kvalitetssäkring av mjukvaror. Vi tror att du är du är systematisk och noggrann och att du triggas av teknisk problemlösning. Du är engagerad och har en vilja att utvecklas, såväl på ett personligt som tekniskt plan. Du behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


Vi värdesätter erfarenheter inom följande områden:

* Testramverk
* Programmeringsspråk (Python, C/C++)
* Elektronik och inbyggda system
* Firmware
* GUI-ramverk för inbyggda system, t.ex. QT
* Linux
* Jenkins
* Nätverk och kommunikationsprotokoll
* Matlab/Simulink
* Molntjänster
* Agila metoder och processer
* Kravhantering och verifiering av mjuk-/hårdvara

### 

### **Vi erbjuder**

* Ett omväxlande arbete där du får chansen att tillsammans med kunniga och engagerade kollegor arbeta med produkter som bidrar till en hållbar samhällsutveckling.
* Stora möjligheter att växa tillsammans med företaget och utvecklas utefter dina egna drivkrafter.
* Ett omfattande förmånspaket som bland annat innehåller ett bonussystem, friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension och regelbundna personalaktiviteter.

### 

### **Frågor kring tjänsten?**


Kontakta rekryterande chef Robert Stener, +46 76 129 69 22, robert.stener@thermia.com


Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras löpande. Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet. Observera att bakgrundskontroller och drogtester kan tillämpas inför anställning.


Inkludering i arbetslivet är en självklarhet för oss. Vi vill tillvarata de kvaliteter som en stor mångfald tillför och vi välkomnar därför sökanden av olika kön och bakgrund.

  

Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Product Quality Data Analyst
description:
**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------


**Take the lead in driving innovation**  

At Volvo Cars, we are committed to advancing safety, sustainability and electrification. To achieve our ambitious goals, we are looking for forward-thinking individuals who can identify challenges before they arise and deliver cutting-edge solutions that set new industry standards.  

  

When you choose a career with Volvo Cars, you’re not just joining a company – you’re helping shape the future of mobility.

**What you'll do**
------------------



The Product Quality Analyst is responsible for identifying and addressing quality issues with our products by listening to the voice of the customer through various data channels. This role involves analyzing data from warranty reports, technical reports from workshops, vehicle data, and feedback from test engineers. The Product Quality Analyst classifies these issues and assigns investigations to the appropriate engineering/manufacturing departments to ensure timely and effective resolution.

  



Key Responsibilities will include:

  



Identify Quality Issues: Monitor and analyze data from multiple sources, including warranty reports, technical reports from workshops, vehicle data, and test engineer feedback, to identify potential quality issues with our products. Voice of the Customer: Actively listen to and interpret customer feedback from various data channels to understand their concerns and experiences with our products. Issue Classification: Classify identified quality issues based on severity, frequency, and impact, ensuring accurate and consistent categorization. Assign Investigations: Assign identified and classified issues to the responsible engineering/mfg. departments for further investigation and resolution.

  



Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, manufacturing, and service teams to ensure effective classification and assignment of quality issues.

  



Continuous Improvement: Contribute to the continuous improvement of quality assurance processes.

**What you'll bring**
---------------------


You would bring proven technical knowledge in assigned product area: Software systems (e.g., embedded systems, diagnostics, OTA updates), Propulsion systems (e.g., ICE, hybrid, EV powertrains), Tophat/body systems (e.g., interior, exterior, chassis) as well as experience in a technical or analytical role within the automotive or manufacturing industry. You bring hands-on experience with data analysis tools as well as familiarity with vehicle diagnostics, CAN data, or telemetry systems.  



You should bring analytical thinking and pattern recognition skills to identify trends and root causes. You carry experience working with warranty, field issues analysis, technical reports, and customer feedback. You have demonstrated ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams, including engineering, manufacturing, service, and customer support.  



You should have strong communication skills to clearly convey technical findings and influence decision-making. You bring analytical Thinking & Problem Solving, with attention to Detail as well as a customer focus approach. You are collaboration and can initiative and drive for continuous improvement.  



#LI-DNI  

#LI-DNP

title: Test Analysis Engineer
description:
**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------



As the automotive industry evolves, competition has expanded beyond traditional players to include innovative and fast-moving tech companies. Our vision and strategy are focused on maximizing the appeal of owning and using a Volvo, enabling connectivity, and continuously enhancing the user experience for both new and existing cars.

  


**Purpose**



We have an exciting opportunity for you to be part of the development of the next generation infotainment system using Google's Android automotive OS. At Volvo Cars quality is not just a metric but a mindset that is deeply ingrained in our culture and respect for our customers. If you're passionate about delivering high-quality software products that meet the needs of our customers, join our team of talented software developers in Lindholmen!

**What you'll do**
------------------



As a **Test Analysis Engineer**, you will be part of a team that ensures our software products meet Volvo’s quality standards. You will create and run test plans and test cases, track software bugs, and work with developers to fix issues. You will also perform regression testing to maintain product stability, build automated test scripts and participate in code reviews. Additionally, you will improve test methodologies and work with continuous integration systems for seamless software deployment.

**What you'll bring**
---------------------



You are customer-focused and passionate for creating top-notch solutions that improve customers' lives! With your strong analytical skills, you are able to evaluate complex problems and identify feasible solutions. Your natural curiosity and creativity enable you to think outside the box and your cooperative approach allows you to work seamlessly with cross-functional teams to achieve common goals.

  



We're looking for someone with at least Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or equivalent experience. You must have previous experience in quality assurance of complex embedded systems and familiarity with test automation tools such as Python, Pytest, Robot, selenium as well as hand's on experience working on the Android platform. It is also required that you have a **valid Swedish driver's license (B)****.** Knowledge in tools such as CANoe and CANalyzer is added advantage.

  



Having experience in automotive and infotainment systems will be viewed as a meritorious qualification for this position.

  



#LI-DNI

title: Test and Launch Operations Engineer
description:
**At Rocket Factory Augsburg (RFA) we have one goal:** create low-cost, flexible and reliable access to space. We specialize in the creation of small launcher solutions designed for deploying satellites into Low Earth Orbit (LEO) and beyond. Together with you, we want to revolutionize space services and help enhance life on Earth. Sounds interesting? Then join our journey and be part of the team leading the New Space movement in Europe!
  
Our international and agile team is searching for a motivated person to work as Test and Launch Operations Engineer (f/m/d). You enjoy working in a dedicated, dynamic and international environment that aims for high-performance engineering solutions in aerospace technology? Then apply for us. This position will be based in Sweden or the UK.
  
Description
  
Serve as on-console test and flight controllers during launch and test events
  
Test integrated rocket hardware to determine acceptability for flight
  
Take ownership of entire life-cycle of test systems and articles for the RFA ONE Launcher
  
Integration, troubleshooting and commissioning of mechanical, electrical, pneumatic and hydraulic
  
systems
  
Perform data reviews to evaluate the performance of launch/test article and stand systems (software,
  
fluid, structural, thermal, electrical).
  
Find innovative ways to create, review, and optimize test & launch processes/procedures to increase
  
test system capability and cadence.
  
Manage the execution of projects within extremely short timelines
  
Align resources to accomplish key objectives, assign clear accountability for important objectives
  
Use various testing, analysis, modelling and simulation tools to estimate or calculate system
  
performance
  
Create and maintain technical documentation
  
  

Qualifications
  
﻿Higher education in Aerospace Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or related discipline
  
Willingness to travel and work flexibly around RFAs test and launch sites
  
Excellent understanding of staged-combustion liquid rocket engines and launch vehicles
  
Excellent knowledge of physics, fluid dynamics, engineering materials and manufacturing processes
  
Experience with analytical data review tools and numerical methods to solve real world problems (Git, NI
  
LabVIEW, MS Office)
  
**Experience with instrumentation:** pressure, temperature, piezoelectric, strain gauge, load cells,
  
flowmeters
  
Hands-on experience in test operations preferably for propulsion projects
  
Fluent English oral and written (all day-to-day activities are performed in English)
  
Self-independent, a structured way of working and committed to working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment

title: Mobile iOS Engineer, Consumer Mobile Platform
description:
Engineering
  
  

Stockholm, Sweden · Helsinki, Finland · Tallinn, Estonia
  
  

Full-time
  
  

Save role for later
  
Create an alert
  
About Wolt
  
  

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
  
  

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
  
  

Wolt is looking for iOS Engineers to expand our Consumer Mobile Platform team. The team is part of the Consumer Product group and is responsible for enabling the delivery of the consumer mobile apps that millions of people in over 20 countries around the world see when ordering food and other products.
  
  

**Our client platform teams have a clear mission:**  

“Enable delivery and ownership of Wolt-grade Consumer Client Applications through engineering excellence and domain expertise.”
  
  

What you'll be doing
  
  

As part of the team, and to fulfil our mission, you will focus on many different areas:
  
  

Building the foundation of our top-rated consumer facing applications
  
Enablement of our product teams, architecture and platform robustness, observability, developer experience, and more.
  
Driving technical initiatives to foster our engineering excellence
  
Aligning with multiple stakeholders
  
Supporting product development teams by providing a robust platform that makes it simple and fast for our features to reach our millions of customers
  
If you like to communicate with many stakeholders, think about the long-term health and quality of customer experience and technical solutions, find ways to make other engineers’ lives easier and raise the bar of engineering excellence, this is the team for you!
  
  

This role is based in our headquarters Helsinki, Finland. Read more about our remote setup here.
  
  

Feel free to check the Wolt Tech Blog for more read about our culture & technology here.
  
  

Our humble expectations
  
Experienced in iOS development
  
Understanding of the iOS ecosystem and platform
  
A strong interest in building a maintainable and extensible iOS platform
  
End-to-end system design understanding
  
Experienced with CI/CD pipelines
  
Strong communication skills
  
Stakeholder management experience
  
Familiar in driving initiatives across an engineering organisation
  
**Optional, but great to have:** Experience/interest in mobile observability
  
Have an eye for great user experience
  
Next steps
  
  

We’re reviewing applications on a rolling basis, and the position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so apply as soon as you realize you’d love to join us!
  
  

The hiring process typically includes an initial chat with our Talent Acquisition Partner, followed by technical interviews, a team conversation, and final alignment.
  
  

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
  
  

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.
  
  

TeamTech blogHow we workOur cultureOur people
  
Engineering at Wolt
  
  

We build the technologies powering Wolt. Our apps connect millions of customers, hundreds of thousands of courier partners, and tens of thousands of shops and restaurants. We now operate in 30 countries, 500+ cities and we’re growing fast.
  
  

We build at scale, are laser-focused on building world-class customer experiences, and do things with heart. Dive with us into the complex problems of building the delivery of (almost) everything.
  
  

Engineering at Wolt
  
What we're working on
  
  

On this journey towards delivery of (almost) everything, we’re building a wide suite of products — from the systems powering our own Wolt Market stores, to our support tooling, and even fintech solutions.
  
  

Get a sneak peek into what we’re working on through our Wolt Tech blog, Wolt Tech Talks podcast, and more from the link below.
  
  

@WoltEngineering
  
We build beautiful products, the Wolt way
  
  

We like to do things well and move fast. Doing that requires less red tape and more trust.
  
  

At Wolt, every product team has the resources, talent, and autonomy they need to deliver the task at hand. This way our teams stay close to their customers. They work how they see best, and in return, they’re responsible for seeking alignment and owning the outcome.
  
  

Our Product Playbook
  
Our culture
  
  

At Wolt, you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies.
  
  

You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. All of which comes from working with passionate, caring, down-to-earth and super-smart people.
  
  

Our culture
  
  

“Wolt is a great environment for screwing up, learning from that, growing, and moving on to do things better. We never blame anyone for mistakes, we just make sure we can learn from them”
  
  

* Kimbo, Software Engineer


Read Kimbo's story

title: Backend Engineer
description:
About 0TO9:
   

  

**Team Is All**
 Ideas matter – but people make them real. In finance, that’s harder than it should be. Innovation shapes how we live, but progress is slowed by complexity, regulations, and outdated systems. Too often, great people go elsewhere.
   

  

**0TO9 exists to change that.**
 We’re a fintech venture builder and investor – a bank for entrepreneurship, founded in Stockholm in 2025 by serial entrepreneur Oliver Hildebrandt.
   

  

 Our mission: bring the right people, skills, and resources together so fintech founders can focus on building. From capital and compliance to tech and talent, we create an infrastructure for success.
   

  

 Numbers are the building blocks of finance and with zero to nine, we can build anything. Our name says it all: From you to a team. From idea to impact. From now to what’s next.
   

  

 With offices in Stockholm and Berlin, operations across the Nordics, and a growing portfolio – we’re just getting started.
   

  

**About The Role**
 At 0TO9, you won’t just build services - you’ll shape the core banking platform powering the next wave of fintech ventures. This is a chance to work with and solve complex problems at scale, and be part of building something from the ground up.
   

  

* Build and maintain C#/.NET Core microservices on AWS ECS for the banking platform
* Collaborate with product managers, architects, and engineers to deliver high-performance APIs
* Write clean, testable code following SOLID principles
* Apply DDD and CQRS to create modular, scalable, and maintainable systems
* Design event-driven communication using NATS
* Ensure reliability through idempotency, retries, and self-healing services
* Implement observability: logging, metrics, tracing, and performance monitoring
* Working with both relational (MS SQL Server) and NoSQL (DynamoDB) databases.
* Contribute to secure design (auth, secrets, compliance)
* Improve CI/CD, containerized workflows, and engineering practices


**About You**
 We think you’ll be a great fit if you:
   

  

* Have backend experience working with microservices and distributed systems, C# and .NET Core and AWS
* Take ownership, challenge unclear requirements, and prioritize reliability
* Have applied DDD and CQRS in real-world systems
* Understand event-driven architectures (ideally with NATS)
* Care about writing clean, maintainable, testable code


*Nice to have:*
* Previous fintech or banking industry experience
* Hands-on experience with integration testing, contract testing, or end-to-end service testing
* Knowledge of observability tools and testing strategies for microservices
* Understanding of cloud security, governance, and compliance


**What we offer:**
* Be part of the leading fintech venture builder
* A dynamic, entrepreneurial, international and fast-paced environment
* Beautiful office in the heart of Stockholm
* Strong opportunities for growth and development

title: Full-Stack Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin and Bird & Bird. Backed by over $110M in funding from top investors including ICONIQ, General Catalyst, Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a world-class team from Google, Spotify, and top tier consulting and law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 As a Fullstack Engineer at Legora you will build, review and ship amazing products helping legal professionals all over the world in their day-to-day job. You’ll get the chance to work across the entire tech stack with clear ownership and autonomy.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Architect and implement features end-to-end for our web platform
* Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
* Work with technologies such as React, Node.js, AWS, Azure and Kubernetes
* Drive continuous improvement and challenge us, the industry and yourself


 Who you are
   

  

* A passionate engineer with a few years of experience building great products using cutting-edge technologies
* You feel comfortable working across the entire tech stack, with focus on backend development
* You’re autonomous and take pride in the code you write
* You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about software architecture
* Experience in infrastructure and integrations are a big plus


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, London, and NYC, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve. We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons, while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**We are currently looking for a highly skilled Fullstack Developer to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain highly reliable and scalable web services and UIs that serve millions of users worldwide, for example our platforms UniFi OS, Design Center/InnerSpace, UniFi Network, Accounts or Community
* Collaborate with developers and designers in distributed teams in an agile and fast-paced, international work environment
* Actively participate in projects and voice your ideas and solutions
* Maintain industry-standard programming style and stay up-to-date with the latest technologies and trends


**Requirements**
* Extensive experience of coding in modern JavaScript, TypeScript, React and Node.js
* Experience of building scalable and high-availability GraphQL/REST APIs and working with SQL databases (Postgres) and key-value stores/message brokers such as Redis
* Solid knowledge about programming, design patterns and web protocols
* Experience of debugging, profiling and optimising web apps
* Strong sense of ownership of tasks and responsibilities
* Ability to lead yourself and your own work as well as collaborate extensively with others
* Familiar with Git and Jira
* Excellent communication skills and highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Skilled in Go and/or Java
* Experience developing AWS cloud services / DevOps
* Good understanding of networking protocols and architectures
* Familiarity with the agile software development processes


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests


***Please note that a background check will be conducted in the final stage of the recruitment process***

title: Backend Developer - User Platform
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Backend Developer** 
 to join our User Platform team in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Backend Developer at Viaplay, you will have the opportunity to work at the forefront of digital media, develop the platform to meet the challenges of a continuously growing user base. You will be working with backend services for user authentication & identity management and in-product communications, responsible for in-product messaging to the various Viaplay clients. We are now looking for a new team member to help us grow the platform, enhance our user experience and create the next generation of streaming services.
   

  

 We thrive in using cutting edge technology, always keeping up to date and constantly challenging the status quo. We work mainly with Node.js in a micro-services architecture that runs in AWS. Some of our high load services are written in Rust running on AWS Lambda.
   

  

**The journey ahead**
 You will join a kick-ass and stability cross-functional small but mighty squad team delivering engineering solutions aligned with technical and product long-term visions. The team delivers clear goals based on our customer journey and is focusing on the customer authentication journey but has other responsibilities within our core services.
   

  

**Some Of Your Daily Challenges Will Include**
* Running and taking ownership of technical design, complexity assessment, development, testing, and deployment
* Collaboration with other teams in an exciting and agile development process
* Participating in weekly backend guild meetings with discussions around best practices, maintenance, and long-term vision
* Writing clean, reusable, legible code that is easy to test and easy to extend
* Investing in our personal skills and increasing our knowledge every day


**What We’re Looking For**
 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we are looking for a passionate developer with a genuine interest in software development and an ambition to constantly improve your skills. You have worked with a variety of tasks requiring complex problem-solving using JavaScript. If you also have an interest in multiple programming languages, you will fit right in! You will be part of a team that makes things happen in a brilliant manner.
   

  

**Desired Skills**
* Solid work life experience developing web based services, using Node.js
* Good understanding of REST API’s
* Understanding of test- or behavior-driven development (TDD/BDD) including supporting frameworks
* Experience in developing services in the cloud, preferably AWS
* An interest and motivation to work with modern frameworks


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Experience working with a state-less and high transactional end user product
* Knowledge of the AWS environment and services (S3, SQS, Lambda, DynamoDB, etc)
* Knowledge of RUST
* A can-do attitude, sense of humor and the ability to work humbly with others


**What We Offer You**
* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* Flexibility that works. We follow a hybrid model with three days a week in the office and the rest remote, giving you the best of collaboration and focus time.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Backend Developer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Backend Developer** 
 in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Backend Developer in our Sports-and Ads Platforms team, you’ll work on improving and developing our sport scheduling platform. Your contributions will directly influence the ease, efficiency and quality of the planning of live sports event on Viaplay as well as outside our own product. You’ll contribute to building and refining our backend services in the sports-scheduling platform, as well as supporting the users of our platform having a seamless user experience.
   

  

 We’re modernizing our services in and around the platform, to enhance scalability and performance, and you’ll play a big part in contributing to this transformation. With a modern serverless architecture built on Java and AWS, you’ll thrive in an innovative and forward-thinking tech environment.
   

  

 You’ll join a newly formed platform team of 6 developers, one Ad tech Specialist, Product Manager and Engineering manager, all working in our Stockholm office.
   

  

**Here’s What Your Daily Challenges Might Look Like**
* Take ownership of technical design, complexity assessment, development, testing, and deployment
* Collaborate with your team members and-or other teams transforming our platform into modern solutions
* Participate in weekly guild meetings, contributing to best practices, long-term strategy, and maintaining technical excellence
* Continuously invest in your personal growth and skill development


**What We’re Looking For**
 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* Deep knowledge with 5+ years of experience in Java
* Solid understanding of Micro services and REST APIs
* Strong grasp of object-oriented programming principles
* Experience developing and maintaining services in cloud environments, preferably AWS
* Team player with a dedication to testing, code review, and other quality-oriented practices
* Curious and motivated by collaborating with and supporting other teams


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Familiarity with modern frameworks like Quarkus
* Knowledge in event-based architecture
* Knowledge or willingness to learn Go


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.

* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Staff Backend Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.


**We at the Recommendation Team**
 We aim to build the world’s most advanced and dynamic AI recommendation platform, creating a seamless connection between individuals and the products and content relevant to them, while providing businesses with an intelligent, adaptive platform for sustainable growth. Our team's features and offerings are crucial for delivering relevant recommendations, directly contributing to revenue growth and enhancing customer experience at scale by providing personalized, high-value content. Comprising some of Truecaller's most talented and experienced individuals, this team is relentlessly focused on building cutting-edge targeting solutions that deliver unparalleled precision and impactful user experiences
   

  

**As a Backend Engineer** 
 , you will own and lead
   

  

* Scalable System Design & Development: Lead the architecture, development, and maintenance of a high-performance, low-latency recommendation platform capable of handling substantial user traffic and delivering recommendations efficiently.
* API & Service Development: Create and manage robust APIs and microservices to facilitate seamless recommendation retrieval for internal & external stakeholders, including defining clear data contracts and ensuring smooth integration.
* Operational Reliability & Performance: Take ownership of the platform's operational health, encompassing continuous monitoring, performance optimization, and troubleshooting to guarantee high availability and responsiveness.


**What You Bring In**
* 5+ years of experience in Backend development
* Expert Java/Scala proficiency: Set technical direction, establish best practices, and guide complex implementations across multiple teams.
* Extensive experience with large-scale distributed systems: Proven track record of driving significant cross-organizational technical initiatives.
* Deep expertise in high-throughput, data-intensive applications: History of solving complex data challenges impacting core business functionality.
* Mastery of data structures and algorithms: Apply to novel/ambiguous engineering problems, set technical standards, and mentor senior engineers.
* Exceptional technical communication skills (oral and written English): Articulate complex technical visions, strategies, and trade-offs to diverse audiences.
* Strong track record of leading the resolution of systemic, cross-cutting technical problems.
* Demonstrated ability to influence technical strategy, drive architectural evolution, and foster a culture of engineering excellence and continuous learning.


**It Would Be Great If You Also Have**
* Experience building systems in the cloud
* Experience with virtualization environments, e.g. Docker
* Experience with systems for managing containerized applications, e.g. Kubernetes
* Experience with non-relational databases


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


**Come As You Are**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.
   

  

 Job info
   

  

 Location
   

  

**Stockholm, Sverige**
 Category
   

  

**Backend**
 Team
   

  

**CTO Office**
 Posted
   

  

**17 days ago**

title: Senior Frontend developer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 250 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 We are looking for a Frontend Developer with 5
 **+** 
 years of experience to join one of our product teams with a focus on customer facing features. As part of our journey toward innovation and scaling, you’ll play an important role in building and optimizing the technical platform that drives our business.
   

  

 This is an exciting opportunity for a driven and collaborative developer who thrives in a fast-paced environment. You will contribute to developing and maintaining features for our e-commerce platform while growing your technical skills alongside experienced colleagues.
   

  

 We're highly focused on SEO, performance, and accessibility. Our frontend technologies are based on server side rendered razor views with functionality added through imperative TypeScript code.
   

  

 As part of our tech organization, you’ll step into a product team that thrives on collaboration and open dialogue. We foster a culture of curiosity and knowledge sharing, where every idea is valued and has the potential to shape the future.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop, implement, and maintain features for our e-commerce platform.
* Collaborate with the team and stakeholders to deliver quality solutions aligned with business needs.
* Contribute to platform optimization and performance improvements.
* Participate in team discussions and contribute innovative ideas for technical solutions.
* Embrace challenges, engage in continuous learning, and grow as a developer.


**What We Want From You**
 We want you to succeed and thrive within this role and our team. Here’s what we’re looking for:
   

  

 5+ years of professional experience in frontend development and familiar with backend technologies.
   

  

 Proficiency in JavaScript, TypeScript, and modern frontend, and experience building modern frontend web solutions.
   

  

 Hands-on experience with SASS or LESS, and tools like Webpack.
   

  

 Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively.
   

  

 Excellent communication skills, with the ability to work effectively with technical and non-technical team members.
   

  

 Fluency in English, which is the working language at Haypp Group.
   

  

**Bonus Skills That Make You Stand Out**
* Previous experience with .NET Core.
* Experience working with B2C e-commerce platforms or other consumer-facing applications.
* Knowledge of cloud services or DevOps practices.
* A willingness to take on new challenges and grow your technical expertise.


**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values
 *We team up* 
 ,
 *Innovation Drives Us* 
 ,
 *No Douchebags* 
 and
 *Going the Extra Mile* 
 at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Lea Sjösten at lea.sjosten@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.
   

  

 With ten e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 100 000 consumers.

title: Application Manager (Java) to Payments Team Nordic
description:
**Do you want to take part in the further development of Crosskey**
 We are a fast-growing company currently refreshing our technology stack and we are therefore looking for an
   

  

**Application Manager (Java) with several years of experience in software development**
**Your job responsibilities** 
 are to
   

  

* be part of our team consisting of Product Owner, Developers and Product Specialists and be responsible for developing and maintaining our applications.
* be responsible for the product as a whole and can translate the customer's needs into feasible solutions.
* participate in and run development projects.


**As a person we’d like you to be**
* interested in programming and DevSecOps as a way of working
* able to juggle several things at the same time and stick to tight deadlines
* enjoying streamlining processes and routines through a dedicated solution focus
* driven and pro-active
* able to see things from the customer’s perspective
* fluent in speech and writing in English


**We Wish You Have Experience Of**
* Programming language Java
* Spring, Gradle, Oracle/SQL, Junit, docker, automated testing, Jenkins/continuous integration, security, Web Services (REST/SOAP), AWS (ECS/Fargate, Cloud watch…), Linux/Bash, Splunk, JSON/Open API spec are a merit


**Your geographical location will be either Turku, Helsinki, Stockholm or Mariehamn.**
**We offer you** 
 a fun and challenging workplace in an innovative company where our employees are in focus. We have an open and flexible working culture built on mutual trust. Cooperation and feedback are some of the cornerstones. We love challenges and are driven by making our customers more successful.
   

  

**For further information please contact** 
 HR Manager Monika Sigmark +358 40 717 8456. We are hiring continuously so please send your application as soon as possible but no later than 24th of October 2025.
